a.description: The <a> element creates a hyperlink to any resource that's accessible via a URL, such as web pages, files, email addresses, or locations within the same page.
a.description_html: The <a> element creates a hyperlink to any resource that's accessible via a URL, such as web pages, files, email addresses, or locations within the same page.
a.name: <a>

abbr.description: The <abbr> HTML element represents an abbreviation or acronym.
abbr.description_html: The <abbr> HTML element represents an abbreviation or acronym.
abbr.name: <abbr>

abortable-fetch.description: If you construct a fetch request with an AbortSignal, you can cancel the request.
abortable-fetch.description_html: If you construct a fetch request with an AbortSignal, you can cancel the request.
abortable-fetch.name: Abortable fetch

aborting.description: The AbortController and AbortSignal APIs allow you to cancel an ongoing operation, such as a fetch() request.
aborting.description_html: The AbortController and AbortSignal APIs allow you to cancel an ongoing operation, such as a fetch() request.
aborting.name: AbortController and AbortSignal

abortsignal-any.description: The AbortSignal.any() static method combines an iterable of abort signals into a single signal, with the abort reason taken from the first signal to abort.
abortsignal-any.description_html: The AbortSignal.any() static method combines an iterable of abort signals into a single signal, with the abort reason taken from the first signal to abort.
abortsignal-any.name: AbortSignal.any()

abs-sign.description: The abs() and sign() CSS functions compute the absolute value or the sign of the input.
abs-sign.description_html: The abs() and sign() CSS functions compute the absolute value or the sign of the input.
abs-sign.name: abs() and sign()

absolute-positioning.description: The position: absolute CSS declaration removes an element from the normal flow and positions it relative to its containing block, which is often the root element, or closest positioned ancestor.
absolute-positioning.description_html: The position: absolute CSS declaration removes an element from the normal flow and positions it relative to its containing block, which is often the root element, or closest positioned ancestor.
absolute-positioning.name: Absolute positioning

accelerometer.description: The Accelerometer, LinearAccelerationSensor and GravitySensor APIs read the acceleration applied to a device in three dimensions, either including the effect of gravity, without its effect, or only its effect, respectively.
accelerometer.description_html: The Accelerometer, LinearAccelerationSensor and GravitySensor APIs read the acceleration applied to a device in three dimensions, either including the effect of gravity, without its effect, or only its effect, respectively.
accelerometer.name: Accelerometer

accent-color.description: The accent-color CSS property sets a color for checkboxes, radio buttons, and other form controls.
accent-color.description_html: The accent-color CSS property sets a color for checkboxes, radio buttons, and other form controls.
accent-color.name: accent-color

accesskey.description: The accesskey global HTML attribute gives a hint for generating a keyboard shortcut for the current element. The attribute value must consist of a single printable character.
accesskey.description_html: The accesskey global HTML attribute gives a hint for generating a keyboard shortcut for the current element. The attribute value must consist of a single printable character.
accesskey.name: accesskey

accessor-methods.description: The __defineGetter__() and __defineSetter__() methods of objects bind a function to a property, which is called on setting or reading the property.
accessor-methods.description_html: The __defineGetter__() and __defineSetter__() methods of objects bind a function to a property, which is called on setting or reading the property.
accessor-methods.name: Accessor methods

active-view-transition.description: The :active-view-transition CSS pseudo-class matches the root element when a view transition is active. The :active-view-transition-type() CSS pseudo-class matches only when the active view transition was started with the specified type.
active-view-transition.description_html: The :active-view-transition CSS pseudo-class matches the root element when a view transition is active. The :active-view-transition-type() CSS pseudo-class matches only when the active view transition was started with the specified type.
active-view-transition.name: Active view transition

address.description: The <address> element represents contact information for a person or people, or for an organization.
address.description_html: The <address> element represents contact information for a person or people, or for an organization.
address.name: <address>

alerts.description: The window.alert(), window.confirm(), and window.prompt() methods open modal dialogs for notifying the user, asking for confirmation, or entering text.
alerts.description_html: The window.alert(), window.confirm(), and window.prompt() methods open modal dialogs for notifying the user, asking for confirmation, or entering text.
alerts.name: Alerts

align-content-block.description: The align-content property vertically aligns content in block layouts, like it does in flex or grid layouts.
align-content-block.description_html: The align-content property vertically aligns content in block layouts, like it does in flex or grid layouts.
align-content-block.name: align-content in block layouts

alignment-baseline.description: The alignment-baseline CSS property sets which baseline of an element is aligned with the corresponding baseline of its parent.
alignment-baseline.description_html: The alignment-baseline CSS property sets which baseline of an element is aligned with the corresponding baseline of its parent.
alignment-baseline.name: alignment-baseline

all.description: The all CSS property is a shorthand for all CSS properties, except for direction and unicode-bidi. It accepts only the keywords for explicit defaulting (such as initial and inherit), since they are the only values supported on all CSS properties.
all.description_html: The all CSS property is a shorthand for all CSS properties, except for direction and unicode-bidi. It accepts only the keywords for explicit defaulting (such as initial and inherit), since they are the only values supported on all CSS properties.
all.name: all

alt-text-generated-content.description: The / notation in content CSS property values adds alternative text to generated content. For example, the content: url('upvote-icon.svg') / 'Upvote' declaration adds accessible 'Upvote' text to the SVG icon. Also known as alternate text.
alt-text-generated-content.description_html: The / notation in content CSS property values adds alternative text to generated content. For example, the content: url('upvote-icon.svg') / 'Upvote' declaration adds accessible 'Upvote' text to the SVG icon. Also known as alternate text.
alt-text-generated-content.name: Alt text for generated content

alternative-style-sheets.description: The rel="alternate stylesheet" attribute for the <link> HTML element offers an alternative style option to users.
alternative-style-sheets.description_html: The rel="alternate stylesheet" attribute for the <link> HTML element offers an alternative style option to users.
alternative-style-sheets.name: Alternative style sheets

ambient-light.description: The AmbientLightSensor API returns the current light level in lux of the ambient light level around the device.
ambient-light.description_html: The AmbientLightSensor API returns the current light level in lux of the ambient light level around the device.
ambient-light.name: Ambient light sensor

anchor-positioning.description: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
anchor-positioning.description_html: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
anchor-positioning.name: Anchor positioning

angle-instanced-arrays.description: The ANGLE_instanced_arrays extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts draws the same object multiple times or groups of similar objects multiple times, if the group shares the same vertex data, primitive count and type.
angle-instanced-arrays.description_html: The ANGLE_instanced_arrays extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts draws the same object multiple times or groups of similar objects multiple times, if the group shares the same vertex data, primitive count and type.
angle-instanced-arrays.name: ANGLE_instanced_arrays WebGL extension

animation-composition.description: The animation-composition CSS property chooses how to combine animations that affect the same property.
animation-composition.description_html: The animation-composition CSS property chooses how to combine animations that affect the same property.
animation-composition.name: animation-composition

animations-css.description: The animation CSS property animates an element's style over time, using keyframes described in @keyframes rules.
animations-css.description_html: The animation CSS property animates an element's style over time, using keyframes described in @keyframes rules.
animations-css.name: Animations (CSS)

app-file-handlers.description: The file_handlers web app manifest member registers an installed web app as a handler for files with specific file extensions or MIME types.
app-file-handlers.description_html: The file_handlers web app manifest member registers an installed web app as a handler for files with specific file extensions or MIME types.
app-file-handlers.name: File handlers

app-launch-handler.description: The launch_handler web app manifest member, with the client_mode property, configure how web app launches behave when an instance of the app is already open. For example, you can choose to focus the existing app instance instead of launching a new one.
app-launch-handler.description_html: The launch_handler web app manifest member, with the client_mode property, configure how web app launches behave when an instance of the app is already open. For example, you can choose to focus the existing app instance instead of launching a new one.
app-launch-handler.name: Launch handler

app-protocol-handlers.description: The protocol_handlers web app manifest member registers an installed web app as a handler for a specific protocol. When a user follows a link with the specified protocol, the installed app opens the link.
app-protocol-handlers.description_html: The protocol_handlers web app manifest member registers an installed web app as a handler for a specific protocol. When a user follows a link with the specified protocol, the installed app opens the link.
app-protocol-handlers.name: Protocol handlers

app-share-targets.description: The share_target web app manifest member registers an installed web app as a handler for shared content. When a user shares content by using the device share dialog, the installed app can be listed as an option for handling the shared content.
app-share-targets.description_html: The share_target web app manifest member registers an installed web app as a handler for shared content. When a user shares content by using the device share dialog, the installed app can be listed as an option for handling the shared content.
app-share-targets.name: Share targets

app-shortcuts.description: The shortcuts web app manifest member registers common actions of an installed web app with the device. The device can present these actions to the user in contextually appropriate locations, such as jump lists on Windows or the app launcher on Android.
app-shortcuts.description_html: The shortcuts web app manifest member registers common actions of an installed web app with the device. The device can present these actions to the user in contextually appropriate locations, such as jump lists on Windows or the app launcher on Android.
app-shortcuts.name: Application shortcuts

appearance.description: The appearance CSS property controls the appearance of form controls. Using appearance: none disables any default native appearance and allows the elements to be styled with CSS.
appearance.description_html: The appearance CSS property controls the appearance of form controls. Using appearance: none disables any default native appearance and allows the elements to be styled with CSS.
appearance.name: appearance

arguments-callee.description: The callee property of the arguments variable in a non-strict function body's local scope is the function that arguments belongs to.
arguments-callee.description_html: The callee property of the arguments variable in a non-strict function body's local scope is the function that arguments belongs to.
arguments-callee.name: arguments.callee

aria-attribute-reflection.description: WAI-ARIA attributes have corresponding properties on Element and ElementInternals objects.
aria-attribute-reflection.description_html: WAI-ARIA attributes have corresponding properties on Element and ElementInternals objects.
aria-attribute-reflection.name: ARIA attribute reflection

array.description: Arrays are ordered lists of JavaScript values.
array.description_html: Arrays are ordered lists of JavaScript values.
array.name: Array (initial support)

array-at.description: The at() method of arrays and typed arrays returns the item at an index, including negative indices for getting items relative to the end of an array. Also known as the relative indexing method.
array-at.description_html: The at() method of arrays and typed arrays returns the item at an index, including negative indices for getting items relative to the end of an array. Also known as the relative indexing method.
array-at.name: Array at()

array-by-copy.description: The toReversed(), toSorted(), toSpliced(), and with() methods of arrays and typed arrays return changed copies of arrays. They stand in contrast to methods such as sort() or reverse() that change arrays in place.
array-by-copy.description_html: The toReversed(), toSorted(), toSpliced(), and with() methods of arrays and typed arrays return changed copies of arrays. They stand in contrast to methods such as sort() or reverse() that change arrays in place.
array-by-copy.name: Array by copy

array-copywithin.description: The copyWithin() method of arrays and typed arrays shifts or copies items of an array to another index of the array without changing its length.
array-copywithin.description_html: The copyWithin() method of arrays and typed arrays shifts or copies items of an array to another index of the array without changing its length.
array-copywithin.name: Array copyWithin()

array-fill.description: The fill() method of arrays and typed arrays sets all or some items of an array to a given a value.
array-fill.description_html: The fill() method of arrays and typed arrays sets all or some items of an array to a given a value.
array-fill.name: Array fill()

array-find.description: The find() and findIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array for the first item that satisfies a test function.
array-find.description_html: The find() and findIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array for the first item that satisfies a test function.
array-find.name: Array find() and findIndex()

array-findlast.description: The findLast() and findLastIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array in reverse order for the first item that satisfies a test function.
array-findlast.description_html: The findLast() and findLastIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array in reverse order for the first item that satisfies a test function.
array-findlast.name: Array findLast() and findLastIndex()

array-flat.description: The flat() and flatMap() methods for arrays creates a new array such that each nested array item is concatenated into it.
array-flat.description_html: The flat() and flatMap() methods for arrays creates a new array such that each nested array item is concatenated into it.
array-flat.name: Array flat() and flatMap()

array-from.description: The Array.from() and typed array .from() static methods copy items from an iterable or array-like object to make a new array.
array-from.description_html: The Array.from() and typed array .from() static methods copy items from an iterable or array-like object to make a new array.
array-from.name: Array.from()

array-fromasync.description: The Array.fromAsync() static method copies items from an async iterable object to make a new array.
array-fromasync.description_html: The Array.fromAsync() static method copies items from an async iterable object to make a new array.
array-fromasync.name: Array.fromAsync()

array-group.description: The Object.groupBy() and Map.groupBy() static methods group values of arrays and iterables based on a function that returns a key for each value.
array-group.description_html: The Object.groupBy() and Map.groupBy() static methods group values of arrays and iterables based on a function that returns a key for each value.
array-group.name: Array grouping

array-includes.description: The includes() method of arrays and typed arrays returns whether a given value appears in the array.
array-includes.description_html: The includes() method of arrays and typed arrays returns whether a given value appears in the array.
array-includes.name: Array includes()

array-isarray.description: The Array.isArray() static method checks whether a value is an array.
array-isarray.description_html: The Array.isArray() static method checks whether a value is an array.
array-isarray.name: Array.isArray()

array-iterators.description: Arrays are iterable with the for  of statement and enumerable with the methods entries(), keys(), and values().
array-iterators.description_html: Arrays are iterable with the for of statement and enumerable with the methods entries(), keys(), and values().
array-iterators.name: Array iterators

array-of.description: The Array.of() and typed array .of() static methods create new arrays from the values of any number of arguments.
array-of.description_html: The Array.of() and typed array .of() static methods create new arrays from the values of any number of arguments.
array-of.name: Array.of()

array-splice.description: The array splice() method changes an array in-place. You can use it to delete items, overwrite items, or insert items, starting from an index.
array-splice.description_html: The array splice() method changes an array in-place. You can use it to delete items, overwrite items, or insert items, starting from an index.
array-splice.name: Array splice()

article.description: The <article> element represents self-contained content, which is intended to be independently distributable or reusable, such as a comment, a blog post, or news article.
article.description_html: The <article> element represents self-contained content, which is intended to be independently distributable or reusable, such as a comment, a blog post, or news article.
article.name: <article>

aside.description: The <aside> element represents a portion of a document whose content is only indirectly related to the document's main content.
aside.description_html: The <aside> element represents a portion of a document whose content is only indirectly related to the document's main content.
aside.name: <aside>

aspect-ratio.description: The aspect-ratio CSS property controls the width-to-height ratio of elements. For and
aspect-ratio.description_html: The aspect-ratio CSS property controls the width-to-height ratio of elements. For <img> and <video> elements, the width and height attributes used together with height: auto control the aspect ratio while the image/video is loading.
aspect-ratio.name: aspect-ratio

async-await.description: The async and await keywords allow you to use the asynchronous, promise-based behavior of a function without using promise chains.
async-await.description_html: The async and await keywords allow you to use the asynchronous, promise-based behavior of a function without using promise chains.
async-await.name: Async functions

async-clipboard.description: The navigator.clipboard API asynchronously reads and writes to the system clipboard.
async-clipboard.description_html: The navigator.clipboard API asynchronously reads and writes to the system clipboard.
async-clipboard.name: Async clipboard

async-generators.description: Async generator functions (async function*) create iterators that return multiple promises, one after another, on-demand.
async-generators.description_html: Async generator functions (async function*) create iterators that return multiple promises, one after another, on-demand.
async-generators.name: Async generators

async-iterable-streams.description: Asynchronous iteration of a stream allows you to use for await  of loops to iterate through a stream's incoming data.
async-iterable-streams.description_html: Asynchronous iteration of a stream allows you to use for await of loops to iterate through a stream's incoming data.
async-iterable-streams.name: Asynchronously iterable streams

async-iterators.description: Asynchronous iterator objects, such as those returned by promises or generator functions, are iterable with the for await .. of loop.
async-iterators.description_html: Asynchronous iterator objects, such as those returned by promises or generator functions, are iterable with the for await .. of loop.
async-iterators.name: Async iterators and the for await..of loop

atomics-pause.description: The Atomics.pause() static method gives a hint to the CPU that the code calling the method is in a short-duration wait for shared memory, known as spinning or a spinlock.
atomics-pause.description_html: The Atomics.pause() static method gives a hint to the CPU that the code calling the method is in a short-duration wait for shared memory, known as spinning or a spinlock.
atomics-pause.name: Atomics.pause()

atomics-wait-async.description: The Atomics.waitAsync() static method waits for a value in a shared memory location, providing a promise when the expected value is not yet in memory. The waitAsync() method is a non-blocking alternative to Atomics.wait().
atomics-wait-async.description_html: The Atomics.waitAsync() static method waits for a value in a shared memory location, providing a promise when the expected value is not yet in memory. The waitAsync() method is a non-blocking alternative to Atomics.wait().
atomics-wait-async.name: Atomics.waitAsync

attr.description: The attr() CSS function, in the context of any property, returns the value of an attribute of an HTML element, with the option to return it as a specific type or unit. You can set a default value for missing or invalid attributes.
attr.description_html: The attr() CSS function, in the context of any property, returns the value of an attribute of an HTML element, with the option to return it as a specific type or unit. You can set a default value for missing or invalid attributes.
attr.name: attr()

attr-contents.description: The attr() CSS function, in content property declarations, sets a ::before or ::after pseudo-element's content to the value of the specified HTML attribute.
attr-contents.description_html: The attr() CSS function, in content property declarations, sets a ::before or ::after pseudo-element's content to the value of the specified HTML attribute.
attr-contents.name: attr() (content only)

attribution-reporting.description: The Attribution Reporting API measures when an ad click or view leads to a conversion, such as a purchase on an advertiser site.
attribution-reporting.description_html: The Attribution Reporting API measures when an ad click or view leads to a conversion, such as a purchase on an advertiser site.
attribution-reporting.name: Attribution reporting

audio.description: The <audio> element plays sound such as audio effects or music, optionally with controls provided by the browser.
audio.description_html: The <audio> element plays sound such as audio effects or music, optionally with controls provided by the browser.
audio.name: <audio>

audio-session.description: The navigator.audioSession API controls how audio playback interacts with other applications. For example, playing music can pause audio from other applications, while ambient audio can play at the same time.
audio-session.description_html: The navigator.audioSession API controls how audio playback interacts with other applications. For example, playing music can pause audio from other applications, while ambient audio can play at the same time.
audio-session.name: Audio session

audio-video-tracks.description: The audioTracks and videoTracks APIs for media elements switch audio and video tracks during playback.
audio-video-tracks.description_html: The audioTracks and videoTracks APIs for media elements switch audio and video tracks during playback.
audio-video-tracks.name: Audio and video tracks

audio-worklet.description: The AudioWorklet API runs module code in a separate thread, specifically for non-blocking, low latency audio processing.
audio-worklet.description_html: The AudioWorklet API runs module code in a separate thread, specifically for non-blocking, low latency audio processing.
audio-worklet.name: AudioWorklet

autocapitalize.description: The autocapitalize global HTML attribute sets the virtual keyboard capitalization behavior for user input on an element, such as the first letter of sentences or all words.
autocapitalize.description_html: The autocapitalize global HTML attribute sets the virtual keyboard capitalization behavior for user input on an element, such as the first letter of sentences or all words.
autocapitalize.name: autocapitalize

autocorrect.description: The autocorrect global HTML attribute controls whether to automatically correct spelling or punctuation errors for user input.
autocorrect.description_html: The autocorrect global HTML attribute controls whether to automatically correct spelling or punctuation errors for user input.
autocorrect.name: autocorrect

autofill.description: The :autofill pseudo-class matches <input> elements that have been filled in automatically by the browser.
autofill.description_html: The :autofill pseudo-class matches <input> elements that have been filled in automatically by the browser.
autofill.name: :autofill

autofocus.description: The autofocus HTML attribute gives focus to an element on page load.
autofocus.description_html: The autofocus HTML attribute gives focus to an element on page load.
autofocus.name: autofocus

autonomous-custom-elements.description: Autonomous custom elements are HTML elements with a hyphenated tag name (like <example-element>) that have behaviors you define.
autonomous-custom-elements.description_html: Autonomous custom elements are HTML elements with a hyphenated tag name (like <example-element>) that have behaviors you define.
autonomous-custom-elements.name: Autonomous custom elements

avif.description: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is an image format based on the AV1 video format.
avif.description_html: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is an image format based on the AV1 video format.
avif.name: AVIF

b.description: The <b> HTML element draws reader's attention to text, styling text as bold by default.
b.description_html: The <b> HTML element draws reader's attention to text, styling text as bold by default.
b.name: <b>

backdrop.description: The ::backdrop CSS pseudo-element is a box underneath an element in the top layer, such as a <dialog>. It can be used to create obscuring effects distinguishing a modal element from the elements underneath.
backdrop.description_html: The ::backdrop CSS pseudo-element is a box underneath an element in the top layer, such as a <dialog>. It can be used to create obscuring effects distinguishing a modal element from the elements underneath.
backdrop.name: ::backdrop

backdrop-filter.description: The backdrop-filter CSS property applies graphical effects such as blurring or color shifting to the area behind an element.
backdrop-filter.description_html: The backdrop-filter CSS property applies graphical effects such as blurring or color shifting to the area behind an element.
backdrop-filter.name: backdrop-filter

background.description: The background CSS property is a shorthand that sets several background properties at once.
background.description_html: The background CSS property is a shorthand that sets several background properties at once.
background.name: background

background-attachment.description: The background-attachment CSS property sets whether an element's background image or gradient moves as the element scrolls.
background-attachment.description_html: The background-attachment CSS property sets whether an element's background image or gradient moves as the element scrolls.
background-attachment.name: background-attachment

background-blend-mode.description: The background-blend-mode CSS property blends an element's background image and background color using blend modes like multiply, difference, or color.
background-blend-mode.description_html: The background-blend-mode CSS property blends an element's background image and background color using blend modes like multiply, difference, or color.
background-blend-mode.name: background-blend-mode

background-clip.description: The background-clip CSS property sets the extent of the background: the padding box, the content box, or the default border box.
background-clip.description_html: The background-clip CSS property sets the extent of the background: the padding box, the content box, or the default border box.
background-clip.name: background-clip

background-clip-border-area.description: The background-clip: border-area CSS declaration draws the background underneath only the border of an element.
background-clip-border-area.description_html: The background-clip: border-area CSS declaration draws the background underneath only the border of an element.
background-clip-border-area.name: background-clip: border-area

background-clip-text.description: The background-clip: text CSS declaration draws the background underneath only the text in the element.
background-clip-text.description_html: The background-clip: text CSS declaration draws the background underneath only the text in the element.
background-clip-text.name: background-clip: text

background-color.description: The background-color CSS property sets the fill color of an element, behind any content and background images or gradients.
background-color.description_html: The background-color CSS property sets the fill color of an element, behind any content and background images or gradients.
background-color.name: background-color

background-fetch.description: Background fetch downloads data in the background even when the web page is closed.
background-fetch.description_html: Background fetch downloads data in the background even when the web page is closed.
background-fetch.name: Background fetch

background-image.description: The background-image CSS property sets the graphics to display behind the content of an element and in front of the background color. Graphics may be any combination of images or gradients.
background-image.description_html: The background-image CSS property sets the graphics to display behind the content of an element and in front of the background color. Graphics may be any combination of images or gradients.
background-image.name: background-image

background-origin.description: The background-origin CSS property sets the background starting position relative to the border and padding of an element.
background-origin.description_html: The background-origin CSS property sets the background starting position relative to the border and padding of an element.
background-origin.name: background-origin

background-position.description: The background-position CSS property offsets the initial position of background images relative to the background origin.
background-position.description_html: The background-position CSS property offsets the initial position of background images relative to the background origin.
background-position.name: background-position

background-repeat.description: The background-repeat CSS property sets how a background image is tiled.
background-repeat.description_html: The background-repeat CSS property sets how a background image is tiled.
background-repeat.name: background-repeat

background-size.description: The background-size CSS property scales or stretches a background based on the size of the element (with the contain and cover keywords), a length, or percentage.
background-size.description_html: The background-size CSS property scales or stretches a background based on the size of the element (with the contain and cover keywords), a length, or percentage.
background-size.name: background-size

background-sync.description: The background synchronization API registers a service worker callback to run only when the device is no longer offline. You can use this to let users continue using your app while offline and synchronize with a server after reconnecting.
background-sync.description_html: The background synchronization API registers a service worker callback to run only when the device is no longer offline. You can use this to let users continue using your app while offline and synchronize with a server after reconnecting.
background-sync.name: Background sync

badging.description: The navigator.setAppBadge() method allows installed web applications to display an application badge, typically a dot or number shown alongside the application's icon on the device's home screen or application dock.
badging.description_html: The navigator.setAppBadge() method allows installed web applications to display an application badge, typically a dot or number shown alongside the application's icon on the device's home screen or application dock.
badging.name: Badging

barcode.description: The BarcodeDetector API recognizes various barcode formats in images.
barcode.description_html: The BarcodeDetector API recognizes various barcode formats in images.
barcode.name: Barcode detector

barprop.description: The visible property of the window.locationbar, window.menubar, window.personalbar, window.scrollbars, window.statusbar, and window.toolbar APIs historically represented the visibility of a browser user interface. For privacy reasons, it now represents whether the window is a pop-up.
barprop.description_html: The visible property of the window.locationbar, window.menubar, window.personalbar, window.scrollbars, window.statusbar, and window.toolbar APIs historically represented the visibility of a browser user interface. For privacy reasons, it now represents whether the window is a pop-up.
barprop.name: BarProp

base.description: The <base> element sets the base URL (the URL that relative URLs are relative to) for all relative URLs in the document.

base64encodedecode.description: The atob() and btoa() global functions encode and decode strings to and from base 64, respectively.
base64encodedecode.description_html: The atob() and btoa() global functions encode and decode strings to and from base 64, respectively.

baseline-shift.description: The baseline-shift CSS property sets the position of an element relative to its dominant baseline.
baseline-shift.description_html: The baseline-shift CSS property sets the position of an element relative to its dominant baseline.

baseline-source.description: The baseline-source CSS property controls how inline-level boxes with multiple lines of text are aligned with the surrounding text. By default, which typographic baseline is used depends on the display property value.

battery.description: The navigator.getBattery() API obtains information about the device's battery, including charge level and status. Also known as the Battery API.
battery.description_html: The navigator.getBattery() API obtains information about the device's battery, including charge level and status. Also known as the Battery API.

bdi.description: The <bdi> element isolates text that may have a different text direction from its surrounding text. This prevents the browser's bidirectional text algorithm from affecting or being affected by the direction of the surrounding text.
bdi.description_html: The <bdi> element isolates text that may have a different text direction from its surrounding text. This prevents the browser's bidirectional text algorithm from affecting or being affected by the direction of the surrounding text.

bdo.description: The <bdo> element overrides the directionality of text, so that the text within is rendered in a different direction than the surrounding text.

beacons.description: The navigator.sendBeacon() method asynchronously sends an HTTP POST request with a limited amount of data, typically for app state, events, and analytics data. The one-way beacon is guaranteed to be initiated before the browser unloads the page, but the sender does not get to handle the response.

The one-way beacon is guaranteed to be initiated before the browser unloads the page, but the sender does not get to handle the response.

before-after.description: The ::before and ::after CSS pseudo-elements select inline boxes preceding and following an element. They are often used with the content property to generate cosmetic content.

beforeinstallprompt.description: The beforeinstallprompt event fires when a Progressive Web App (PWA) is installable. You can cancel the event and later call event.prompt() to control when the installation prompt is shown. The appinstalled event fires when the PWA is successfully installed.
beforeinstallprompt.description_html: The beforeinstallprompt event fires when a Progressive Web App (PWA) is installable. You can cancel the event and later call event.prompt() to control when the installation prompt is shown. The appinstalled event fires when the PWA is successfully installed.

beforeunload.description: The beforeunload event is fired when the current window is about to be unloaded. Typically this is used to display a dialog to confirm if users really want to leave the page when there is unsaved data that would be lost.

blocking-render.description: The blocking="render" attribute for <link>, <script>, and <style> elements blocks rendering until the external script or stylesheet has been loaded. For <link rel="expect">, rendering is blocked until a specific element is in the DOM.

body.description: The <body> element represents the content of an HTML document.

borders.description: The border CSS property sets the color, style, and width of the line around an element.

box-sizing.description: The box-sizing CSS property sets whether an element's width and height are calculated based on the content-box, which does not count the size of borders or padding, or border-box, which does count them.

br.description:
The
element produces line breaks in text.

button.description: The <button> HTML element represents a button that triggers some action, such as submitting a form or opening a dialog, styled as a labeled rectangular box by default.

calc-constants.description: The e, pi, infinity, and NaN keywords represent well-defined constants accepted in CSS math functions such as calc().

canvas.description: The <canvas> HTML element is a space to draw graphics in, using the 2D canvas API, WebGL, or WebGPU.

canvas-2d.description: The CanvasRenderingContext2D API is the "2d" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It represents a flat, two-dimensional space for drawing graphics and animations.

canvas-2d-alpha.description: The optional alpha parameter of a 2D canvas's getContext() method sets whether the canvas has an alpha transparency channel. If set to false, then this permits the browser to optimize compositing for an opaque canvas.

canvas-2d-desynchronized.description: The optional desynchronized parameter of a canvas's getContext() method permits the browser to draw a 2D canvas independently of the event loop. This can reduce drawing latency.

You can use this to record the canvas, or send it elsewhere, such as another canvas or WebRTC connection.

constructed-stylesheets.name: Constructed stylesheets

contact-picker.description: The navigator.contacts API allows you to ask users to share limited details about entries in their contact list with your application.
contact-picker.description_html: The navigator.contacts API allows you to ask users to share limited details about entries in their contact list with your application.
contact-picker.name: Contact picker

contain.description: The contain CSS property sets limits to the scope of styles, layout, and paint rendering for speed and efficiency. The none keyword value disables containment, strict is equivalent to contain: size layout style paint, and content is equivalent to contain: layout style paint.
contain.description_html: The contain CSS property sets limits to the scope of styles, layout, and paint rendering for speed and efficiency. The none keyword value disables containment, strict is equivalent to contain: size layout style paint, and content is equivalent to contain: layout style paint.
contain.name: contain

contain-inline-size.description: The contain: inline-size CSS declaration prevents the element's inline dimension from being set by the element's contents. This permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations.
contain-inline-size.description_html: The contain: inline-size CSS declaration prevents the element's inline dimension from being set by the element's contents. This permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations.
contain-inline-size.name: Inline-size containment

contain-intrinsic-size.description: The contain-intrinsic-size CSS property sets the intrinsic size of an element. When using size containment, the browser will lay out the element as if it had a single child of this size.
contain-intrinsic-size.description_html: The contain-intrinsic-size CSS property sets the intrinsic size of an element. When using size containment, the browser will lay out the element as if it had a single child of this size.
contain-intrinsic-size.name: contain-intrinsic-size

contain-layout.description: The contain: layout CSS declaration isolates the inside of an element such that it cannot affect the layout of the rest of the page or be affected by the rest of the page. This permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations.
contain-layout.description_html: The contain: layout CSS declaration isolates the inside of an element such that it cannot affect the layout of the rest of the page or be affected by the rest of the page. This permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations.
contain-layout.name: Layout containment

contain-paint.description: The contain: paint CSS declaration prevents an element's descendants from being drawn outside the boundaries of the containing element, with any overflow clipped. This permits the browser to avoid slower painting calculations.
contain-paint.description_html: The contain: paint CSS declaration prevents an element's descendants from being drawn outside the boundaries of the containing element, with any overflow clipped. This permits the browser to avoid slower painting calculations.
contain-paint.name: Paint containment

contain-size.description: The contain: size CSS declaration sets an element's dimensions exclusively by its height and width properties, ignoring its contents and descendants. This permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations.
contain-size.description_html: The contain: size CSS declaration sets an element's dimensions exclusively by its height and width properties, ignoring its contents and descendants. This permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations.
contain-size.name: Size containment

contain-style.description: The contain: style CSS declaration permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations by preventing modification to counter (counter-increment and counter-set) and quotation styles (content property quote values) beyond the element's descendants.
contain-style.description_html: The contain: style CSS declaration permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations by preventing modification to counter (counter-increment and counter-set) and quotation styles (content property quote values) beyond the element's descendants.
contain-style.name: Style containment

container-queries.description: Container size queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the dimensions of its container.
container-queries.description_html: Container size queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the dimensions of its container.
container-queries.name: Container queries

container-scroll-state-queries.description: Container scroll-state queries with the @container scroll-state(...) at-rule apply styles to an element based on the sticky positioning, snapped, and scrollable state of the container.
container-scroll-state-queries.description_html: Container scroll-state queries with the @container scroll-state(...) at-rule apply styles to an element based on the sticky positioning, snapped, and scrollable state of the container.
container-scroll-state-queries.name: Container scroll-state queries

container-style-queries.description: Container style queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the values of custom properties of its container.
container-style-queries.description_html: Container style queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the values of custom properties of its container.
container-style-queries.name: Container style queries

content.description: The content CSS property sets the content inside of an element or pseudo-element, replacing the current value. It's often used with the ::before and ::after pseudo-elements to generate cosmetic content.
content.description_html: The content CSS property sets the content inside of an element or pseudo-element, replacing the current value. It's often used with the ::before and ::after pseudo-elements to generate cosmetic content.
content.name: Content

content-index.description: The Content Index API allows developers to register their offline enabled content with the browser.
content-index.description_html: The Content Index API allows developers to register their offline enabled content with the browser.
content-index.name: Content Index

content-visibility.description: The content-visibility CSS property delays rendering an element, including layout and painting, until it is needed.
content-visibility.description_html: The content-visibility CSS property delays rendering an element, including layout and painting, until it is needed.
content-visibility.name: content-visibility

contenteditable.description: The contenteditable global HTML attribute allows the user to edit the content of an element, such as inserting or deleting text.
contenteditable.description_html: The contenteditable global HTML attribute allows the user to edit the content of an element, such as inserting or deleting text.
contenteditable.name: contenteditable

contenteditable-plaintextonly.description: The contenteditable="plaintext-only" global HTML attribute allows the user to edit the content of an element, but prevents rich-text formatting.
contenteditable-plaintextonly.description_html: The contenteditable="plaintext-only" global HTML attribute allows the user to edit the content of an element, but prevents rich-text formatting.
contenteditable-plaintextonly.name: contenteditable="plaintext-only"

context-fill-stroke.description: The context-fill and context-stroke CSS values are used with fill and stroke in SVG <marker> or <use> elements to match a color from where they appear.
context-fill-stroke.description_html: The context-fill and context-stroke CSS values are used with fill and stroke in SVG <marker> or <use> elements to match a color from where they appear.
context-fill-stroke.name: context-fill and context-stroke

contrast-color.description: The contrast-color() CSS function picks a color that has guaranteed contrast against a specified foreground or background color.
contrast-color.description_html: The contrast-color() CSS function picks a color that has guaranteed contrast against a specified foreground or background color.
contrast-color.name: contrast-color()

controls-list.description: The controlslist attribute for <audio> or <video> hides parts of the browser's built-in controls. For example, controlslist="nofullscreen" removes the button to play the video in fullscreen.
controls-list.description_html: The controlslist attribute for <audio> or <video> hides parts of the browser's built-in controls. For example, controlslist="nofullscreen" removes the button to play the video in fullscreen.
controls-list.name: controlslist

cookie-enabled.description: The navigator.cookieEnabled property is a boolean for whether the browser accepts or ignores attempts to write cookie data.
cookie-enabled.description_html: The navigator.cookieEnabled property is a boolean for whether the browser accepts or ignores attempts to write cookie data.
cookie-enabled.name: cookieEnabled

cookie-store.description: The CookieStore API is an asynchronous and promise-based API for managing cookies. It does not rely on document and so is available to service workers as well.
cookie-store.description_html: The CookieStore API is an asynchronous and promise-based API for managing cookies. It does not rely on document and so is available to service workers as well.
cookie-store.name: Cookie store

cookies.description: The Set-Cookie HTTP header stores limited amounts of data that persist across request and response, creating shared state between the browser and server.
cookies.description_html: The Set-Cookie HTTP header stores limited amounts of data that persist across request and response, creating shared state between the browser and server.
cookies.name: Cookies

corner-shape.description: The corner-shape CSS property sets the shape of an element's corners when using border-radius, allowing for shapes other than rounded corners. For example, corner-shape: squircle is a shape in between a square and rounded corner.
corner-shape.description_html: The corner-shape CSS property sets the shape of an element's corners when using border-radius, allowing for shapes other than rounded corners. For example, corner-shape: squircle is a shape in between a square and rounded corner.
corner-shape.name: corner-shape

cors.description: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing is an HTTP-header based mechanism that allows a server to indicate any origins (domain, scheme, or port) other than its own from which a browser should permit loading resources. Also known as CORS.
cors.description_html: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing is an HTTP-header based mechanism that allows a server to indicate any origins (domain, scheme, or port) other than its own from which a browser should permit loading resources. Also known as CORS.
cors.name: CORS

counter-reset-reversed.description: The reversed() CSS function for counter-reset creates a counter that counts down.
counter-reset-reversed.description_html: The reversed() CSS function for counter-reset creates a counter that counts down.
counter-reset-reversed.name: Reversed counter-reset

counter-set.description: The counter-set CSS property creates (and optionally sets a value for) a counter, the numbers for a series of headings or ordered list items.
counter-set.description_html: The counter-set CSS property creates (and optionally sets a value for) a counter, the numbers for a series of headings or ordered list items.
counter-set.name: counter-set

counter-style.description: The @counter-style CSS at-rule sets custom counter styles for list items. For example, you can use a sequence of specific symbols instead of numbers for an ordered list.
counter-style.description_html: The @counter-style CSS at-rule sets custom counter styles for list items. For example, you can use a sequence of specific symbols instead of numbers for an ordered list.
counter-style.name: @counter-style

counters.description: The counter-reset and counter-increment CSS properties and the counter() and counters() functions automatically number headings or ordered list items.
counters.description_html: The counter-reset and counter-increment CSS properties and the counter() and counters() functions automatically number headings or ordered list items.
counters.name: Counters (CSS)

createimagebitmap.description: The createImageBitmap() global method creates an ImageBitmap object from a source such as an image, SVG, blob, or canvas. An ImageBitmap object represents pixel data that can be drawn to a canvas with lower latency than other types, such as ImageData.
createimagebitmap.description_html: The createImageBitmap() global method creates an ImageBitmap object from a source such as an image, SVG, blob, or canvas. An ImageBitmap object represents pixel data that can be drawn to a canvas with lower latency than other types, such as ImageData.
createimagebitmap.name: createImageBitmap

credential-management.description: The navigator.credentials API provides generic storage for authentication credentials. Other credential APIs represent specific kinds of credentials, such as password or public key credentials, that the credential management API stores.
credential-management.description_html: The navigator.credentials API provides generic storage for authentication credentials. Other credential APIs represent specific kinds of credentials, such as password or public key credentials, that the credential management API stores.
credential-management.name: Credential management

crisp-edges.description: The image-rendering: crisp-edges CSS declaration scales images to preserve lines without blurring.
crisp-edges.description_html: The image-rendering: crisp-edges CSS declaration scales images to preserve lines without blurring.
crisp-edges.name: crisp-edges

cross-document-view-transitions.description: The @view-transition CSS rule sets whether a document opts-in to transitions between documents in a multi-page application. Both the old and new document must opt-in for a transition to be triggered.
cross-document-view-transitions.description_html: The @view-transition CSS rule sets whether a document opts-in to transitions between documents in a multi-page application. Both the old and new document must opt-in for a transition to be triggered.
cross-document-view-transitions.name: Cross-document view transitions

cross-fade.description: The cross-fade() CSS function generates an image by mixing two images.
cross-fade.description_html: The cross-fade() CSS function generates an image by mixing two images.
cross-fade.name: cross-fade()

csp.description: Content Security Policy (CSP) helps to mitigate certain security threats, including cross-site scripting (XSS) and clickjacking attacks. It consists of a set of directives from a website to a browser, which instruct the browser to restrict the things that the site is allowed to do.
csp.description_html: Content Security Policy (CSP) helps to mitigate certain security threats, including cross-site scripting (XSS) and clickjacking attacks. It consists of a set of directives from a website to a browser, which instruct the browser to restrict the things that the site is allowed to do.
csp.name: Content Security Policy (CSP)

css-escape.description: The CSS.escape() static method escapes a string so that it can be used in a valid CSS selector.
css-escape.description_html: The CSS.escape() static method escapes a string so that it can be used in a valid CSS selector.
css-escape.name: CSS.escape()

css-modules.description: Module import  with { type: "css" } statements load CSS modules as constructable stylesheets. Also known as CSS module scripts.
css-modules.description_html: Module import with { type: "css" } statements load CSS modules as constructable stylesheets. Also known as CSS module scripts.
css-modules.name: CSS import attributes

css-object-model.description: The CSS object model API reads, creates, and modifies CSS stylesheets and inline styles. Also known as CSSOM.
css-object-model.description_html: The CSS object model API reads, creates, and modifies CSS stylesheets and inline styles. Also known as CSSOM.
css-object-model.name: CSS object model

css-object-model-discouraged.description: The DOM level 2 style specification defined interfaces to access and modify CSS styles, such as CSSValue and CSSPrimitiveValue, that were later excluded from the CSS object model.
css-object-model-discouraged.description_html: The DOM level 2 style specification defined interfaces to access and modify CSS styles, such as CSSValue and CSSPrimitiveValue, that were later excluded from the CSS object model.
css-object-model-discouraged.name: CSS object model (DOM level 2)

css-supports.description: The CSS.supports() static method returns whether the browser supports a CSS declaration (given by two arguments, a property and value) or an @supports at-rule condition string.
css-supports.description_html: The CSS.supports() static method returns whether the browser supports a CSS declaration (given by two arguments, a property and value) or an @supports at-rule condition string.
css-supports.name: CSS.supports()

css-typed-om.description: The CSSStyleValue and its subclasses represent CSS values as distinct types instead of only strings. Also known as typed OM.
css-typed-om.description_html: The CSSStyleValue and its subclasses represent CSS values as distinct types instead of only strings. Also known as typed OM.
css-typed-om.name: CSS typed object model

cubic-bezier-easing.description: The cubic-bezier() CSS easing function interpolates along a smooth curve, creating animations and transitions with continuous changes in speed. The ease, ease-in, ease-out, and ease-in-out keyword values are presets for common Bzier curves.
cubic-bezier-easing.description_html: The cubic-bezier() CSS easing function interpolates along a smooth curve, creating animations and transitions with continuous changes in speed. The ease, ease-in, ease-out, and ease-in-out keyword values are presets for common Bzier curves.
cubic-bezier-easing.name: cubic-bezier() easing

currentcolor.description: The currentColor CSS value allows you to reuse an element's computed text color for other properties.
currentcolor.description_html: The currentColor CSS value allows you to reuse an element's computed text color for other properties.
currentcolor.name: currentColor

cursor.description: The cursor CSS property styles the pointer, allowing you to provide hints to the user on how to interact with the hovered element.
cursor.description_html: The cursor CSS property styles the pointer, allowing you to provide hints to the user on how to interact with the hovered element.
cursor.name: Cursor styles

custom-ellipses.description: The text-overflow CSS property with a string value sets the string representing clipped text.
custom-ellipses.description_html: The text-overflow CSS property with a string value sets the string representing clipped text.
custom-ellipses.name: Custom ellipses

custom-properties.description: Custom properties are CSS properties prefixed with -- that set values you can reuse with the var() function. For example, you can set a --key-color property to reuse as border-color: var(--key-color). Also known as CSS variables.
custom-properties.description_html: Custom properties are CSS properties prefixed with -- that set values you can reuse with the var() function. For example, you can set a --key-color property to reuse as border-color: var(--key-color). Also known as CSS variables.
custom-properties.name: Custom properties

customizable-select.description: The <select> element's appearance, including the button, selected option, picker dropdown, and options, can be customized using CSS.
customizable-select.description_html: The <select> element's appearance, including the button, selected option, picker dropdown, and options, can be customized using CSS.
customizable-select.name: Customizable <select>

customized-built-in-elements.description: Customized built-in elements are HTML elements that extend built-in elements using the is attribute, to add new behaviors that you define.
customized-built-in-elements.description_html: Customized built-in elements are HTML elements that extend built-in elements using the is attribute, to add new behaviors that you define.
customized-built-in-elements.name: Customized built-in elements

data.description: The <data> element links a given piece of content with a machine-readable translation.
data.description_html: The <data> element links a given piece of content with a machine-readable translation.
data.name: <data>

data-urls.description: Data URLs are URLs that start with the data: scheme and which directly contain data rather than point to remote resources.
data-urls.description_html: Data URLs are URLs that start with the data: scheme and which directly contain data rather than point to remote resources.
data-urls.name: Data URLs

datalist.description: The <datalist> element sets recommended values for an <input> element. Browsers may show a dropdown menu of all values or match values as the user types.
datalist.description_html: The <datalist> element sets recommended values for an <input> element. Browsers may show a dropdown menu of all values or match values as the user types.
datalist.name: <datalist>

dataset.description: The dataset API attaches and accesses custom data on elements, using either the dataset property of HTMLElement or attributes prefixed with data-.
dataset.description_html: The dataset API attaches and accesses custom data on elements, using either the dataset property of HTMLElement or attributes prefixed with data-.
dataset.name: Dataset

date.description: The Date object represents a single moment in time.
date.description_html: The Date object represents a single moment in time.
date.name: Date

date-get-year-set-year.description: The getYear() and setYear() methods of Date objects get and set the year as an offset to 1900.
date-get-year-set-year.description_html: The getYear() and setYear() methods of Date objects get and set the year as an offset to 1900.
date-get-year-set-year.name: getYear() and setYear()

date-to-gmt-string.description: The toGMTString() method of Date objects is an alias to the toUTCString() method.
date-to-gmt-string.description_html: The toGMTString() method of Date objects is an alias to the toUTCString() method.
date-to-gmt-string.name: toGMTString()

declarative-shadow-dom.description: The shadowrootmode attribute on <template> creates a shadow root without the use of JavaScript. It is a declarative alternative to the attachShadow() method.
declarative-shadow-dom.description_html: The shadowrootmode attribute on <template> creates a shadow root without the use of JavaScript. It is a declarative alternative to the attachShadow() method.
declarative-shadow-dom.name: Declarative shadow DOM

dedicated-workers.description: The Worker() constructor runs a script in its own thread, which can send and receive messages with the script that created it. Also known as web workers.
dedicated-workers.description_html: The Worker() constructor runs a script in its own thread, which can send and receive messages with the script that created it. Also known as web workers.
dedicated-workers.name: Dedicated workers

default.description: The :default CSS pseudo-class matches the default element in a group of related form controls, such as checkboxes and radio buttons with the checked attribute.
default.description_html: The :default CSS pseudo-class matches the default element in a group of related form controls, such as checkboxes and radio buttons with the checked attribute.
default.name: :default

del.description: The <del> element element represents a range of text that has been deleted from a document, styling text as strikethrough by default.
del.description_html: The <del> element element represents a range of text that has been deleted from a document, styling text as strikethrough by default.
del.name: <del>

description-list.description: The <dl>, <dt>, and <dd> HTML elements represent a list of terms and their associated descriptions. Use a description list to create glossaries or similar list of key-value pairs.
description-list.description_html: The <dl>, <dt>, and <dd> HTML elements represent a list of terms and their associated descriptions. Use a description list to create glossaries or similar list of key-value pairs.
description-list.name: Description list

destructuring.description: The destructuring assignment syntax is a JavaScript expression that unpacks values from arrays, or properties from objects, into distinct variables.
destructuring.description_html: The destructuring assignment syntax is a JavaScript expression that unpacks values from arrays, or properties from objects, into distinct variables.
destructuring.name: Destructuring

details.description: The <details> element is a disclosure widget which can be expanded to reveal additional content. When closed, only the nested <summary> element is visible.
details.description_html: The <details> element is a disclosure widget which can be expanded to reveal additional content. When closed, only the nested <summary> element is visible.
details.name: <details>

details-content.description: The ::details-content pseudo-element selects the expandable content of a <details> element, excluding the <summary>.
details-content.description_html: The ::details-content pseudo-element selects the expandable content of a <details> element, excluding the <summary>.
details-content.name: ::details-content

details-name.description: Multiple <details> elements which use the same name attribute are mutually exclusive. When one member of the group is opened, all other members are closed.
details-name.description_html: Multiple <details> elements which use the same name attribute are mutually exclusive. When one member of the group is opened, all other members are closed.
details-name.name: Mutually exclusive <details> elements

device-memory.description: The navigator.deviceMemory property is the approximate amount of device memory, in gigabytes.
device-memory.description_html: The navigator.deviceMemory property is the approximate amount of device memory, in gigabytes.
device-memory.name: Device memory

device-orientation-events.description: The DeviceMotion and DeviceOrientation events report the movement and orientation of the browser's device in physical space. Note that coordinates can differ noticeably between platforms and devices.
device-orientation-events.description_html: The DeviceMotion and DeviceOrientation events report the movement and orientation of the browser's device in physical space. Note that coordinates can differ noticeably between platforms and devices.
device-orientation-events.name: Device orientation events

device-posture.description: The device posture API and the device-posture CSS media feature reflect the physical posture of a device, such as whether a foldable device is folded or unfolded.
device-posture.description_html: The device posture API and the device-posture CSS media feature reflect the physical posture of a device, such as whether a foldable device is folded or unfolded.
device-posture.name: Device posture

device-queries.description: The device-aspect-ratio, device-height, and device-width media features describe physical properties of the displaying output device.
device-queries.description_html: The device-aspect-ratio, device-height, and device-width media features describe physical properties of the displaying output device.
device-queries.name: Device media queries

devicepixelratio.description: The window.devicePixelRatio property is the ratio of the size of one CSS pixel to the vertical size of one physical pixel on the current display device.
devicepixelratio.description_html: The window.devicePixelRatio property is the ratio of the size of one CSS pixel to the vertical size of one physical pixel on the current display device.
devicepixelratio.name: devicePixelRatio

dfn.description: The <dfn> element marks a term to be defined, styling text as italic by default.
dfn.description_html: The <dfn> element marks a term to be defined, styling text as italic by default.
dfn.name: <dfn>

dialog.description: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
dialog.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
dialog.name: <dialog>

dialog-closedby.description: The closedby HTML attribute for <dialog> sets which user actions close a dialog. For example, closedby="any" allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it.
dialog-closedby.description_html: The closedby HTML attribute for <dialog> sets which user actions close a dialog. For example, closedby="any" allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it.
dialog-closedby.name: <dialog closedby>

digital-goods.description: The window.getDigitalGoodsService API connects to stores or billing services for in-app products and subscriptions.
digital-goods.description_html: The window.getDigitalGoodsService API connects to stores or billing services for in-app products and subscriptions.
digital-goods.name: Digital goods

dir-pseudo.description: The :dir() CSS functional pseudo-class matches elements by text direction, either right to left (rtl) or left to right (ltr).
dir-pseudo.description_html: The :dir() CSS functional pseudo-class matches elements by text direction, either right to left (rtl) or left to right (ltr).
dir-pseudo.name: :dir()

dirname.description: The dirname attribute of <textarea> and <input> HTML elements includes the field's writing direction as form data on submission.
dirname.description_html: The dirname attribute of <textarea> and <input> HTML elements includes the field's writing direction as form data on submission.
dirname.name: dirname

display.description: The display CSS property sets the display behavior of an element's box within its layout and sets the layout behavior for its child elements.
display.description_html: The display CSS property sets the display behavior of an element's box within its layout and sets the layout behavior for its child elements.
display.name: Display

display-animation.description: You can animate elements between display: none and any other display value or animate between content-visibility: hidden and any other content-visibility value. This also applies to transitions.
display-animation.description_html: You can animate elements between display: none and any other display value or animate between content-visibility: hidden and any other content-visibility value. This also applies to transitions.
display-animation.name: display animation

display-contents.description: The display: contents CSS declaration sets an element to display only its contents, not itself.
display-contents.description_html: The display: contents CSS declaration sets an element to display only its contents, not itself.
display-contents.name: display: contents

display-flow-root.description: The display: flow-root CSS declaration sets an element as the root element of a new flow layout for its children, preventing margin collapse with sibling elements.
display-flow-root.description_html: The display: flow-root CSS declaration sets an element as the root element of a new flow layout for its children, preventing margin collapse with sibling elements.
display-flow-root.name: display: flow-root

display-list-item.description: The display: list-item CSS declaration renders an element with the box layout of a <li> HTML element.
display-list-item.description_html: The display: list-item CSS declaration renders an element with the box layout of a <li> HTML element.
display-list-item.name: display: list-item

display-mode.description: The display-mode CSS media query sets styles based on whether the web page is in fullscreen, standalone, minimal-ui, browser, or picture-in-picture mode.
display-mode.description_html: The display-mode CSS media query sets styles based on whether the web page is in fullscreen, standalone, minimal-ui, browser, or picture-in-picture mode.
display-mode.name: display-mode media query

display-ruby.description: The display: ruby CSS declaration renders an element with the box layout of a <ruby> HTML element. Child elements may use equivalents to <ruby> internal elements such as display: ruby-base for <rb>.
display-ruby.description_html: The display: ruby CSS declaration renders an element with the box layout of a <ruby> HTML element. Child elements may use equivalents to <ruby> internal elements such as display: ruby-base for <rb>.
display-ruby.name: display: ruby

display-table.description: The display: table CSS declaration renders an element with the box layout of a <table> HTML element. Child elements may use equivalents to <table> internal elements such as display: table-row for <tr>.
display-table.description_html: The display: table CSS declaration renders an element with the box layout of a <table> HTML element. Child elements may use equivalents to <table> internal elements such as display: table-row for <tr>.
display-table.name: display: table

div.description: The <div> HTML element is the generic container for content.
div.description_html: The <div> HTML element is the generic container for content.
div.name: <div>

document-caretpositionfrompoint.description: The document.caretPositionFromPoint() method finds an insertion point, represented by a DOM node and an offset within that node, for given coordinates in the viewport.
document-caretpositionfrompoint.description_html: The document.caretPositionFromPoint() method finds an insertion point, represented by a DOM node and an offset within that node, for given coordinates in the viewport.
document-caretpositionfrompoint.name: document.caretPositionFromPoint()

document-colors.description: A document's bgColor, fgColor, alinkColor, linkColor, and vlinkColor properties get and set the background, foreground, active link, link, and visited link colors of that document.
document-colors.description_html: A document's bgColor, fgColor, alinkColor, linkColor, and vlinkColor properties get and set the background, foreground, active link, link, and visited link colors of that document.
document-colors.name: Document colors

document-picture-in-picture.description: The document picture-in-picture API creates an always-on-top window from arbitrary HTML content.
document-picture-in-picture.description_html: The document picture-in-picture API creates an always-on-top window from arbitrary HTML content.
document-picture-in-picture.name: Document picture-in-picture

document-write.description: The document.open(), document.write(), document.writeln(), and document.close() methods write content to a document, possibly while that document is still loading.
document-write.description_html: The document.open(), document.write(), document.writeln(), and document.close() methods write content to a document, possibly while that document is still loading.
document-write.name: document.write()

dom.description: The DOM (Document Object Model) API represents HTML and XML documents as trees of nodes. You can use the API to inspect and modify the structure and content of a document.
dom.description_html: The DOM (Document Object Model) API represents HTML and XML documents as trees of nodes. You can use the API to inspect and modify the structure and content of a document.
dom.name: DOM

dom-geometry.description: The DOMMatrix, DOMPoint, DOMQuad and DOMRect APIs represent points, rectangles, quadrilaterals and transformation matrices within JavaScript. They can be used in transformations in CSS, <canvas>, and SVG.
dom-geometry.description_html: The DOMMatrix, DOMPoint, DOMQuad and DOMRect APIs represent points, rectangles, quadrilaterals and transformation matrices within JavaScript. They can be used in transformations in CSS, <canvas>, and SVG.
dom-geometry.name: DOM Geometry

dominant-baseline.description: The dominant-baseline CSS property sets the specific baseline used to align an elements's text and inline-level contents.
dominant-baseline.description_html: The dominant-baseline CSS property sets the specific baseline used to align an elements's text and inline-level contents.
dominant-baseline.name: dominant-baseline

domparser.description: The DOMParser API parses XML or HTML source code from a string into a DOM Document.
domparser.description_html: The DOMParser API parses XML or HTML source code from a string into a DOM Document.
domparser.name: DOMParser

download.description: The download attribute for <a> elements loads the target URL as a file to be saved, instead of navigating to it. An optional attribute value sets a default file name.
download.description_html: The download attribute for <a> elements loads the target URL as a file to be saved, instead of navigating to it. An optional attribute value sets a default file name.
download.name: download

draganddrop.description: The Drag and Drop API lets users drag and drop elements and external files such as images onto web pages. Developers can customize which elements can become draggable, the type of feedback the draggable elements produce, and the droppable elements.
draganddrop.description_html: The Drag and Drop API lets users drag and drop elements and external files such as images onto web pages. Developers can customize which elements can become draggable, the type of feedback the draggable elements produce, and the droppable elements.
draganddrop.name: Drag and Drop

dynamic-range.description: The dynamic-range CSS media query sets styles based on whether a device can display at least standard range colors or at least high range colors. Non-visual devices will match neither.
dynamic-range.description_html: The dynamic-range CSS media query sets styles based on whether a device can display at least standard range colors or at least high range colors. Non-visual devices will match neither.
dynamic-range.name: dynamic-range media query

early-data.description: TLS 1.3 sessions may be resumed more quickly by sending so-called early data to servers before the TLS handshake has finished. Also known as zero round-trip time resumption or 0-RTT.
early-data.description_html: TLS 1.3 sessions may be resumed more quickly by sending so-called early data to servers before the TLS handshake has finished. Also known as zero round-trip time resumption or 0-RTT.
early-data.name: Early data

edit-context.description: The EditContext API allows you to build rich text editors that support advanced text input, such as Input Method Editor (IME) composition, an emoji picker, or other platform-specific editing UI.
edit-context.description_html: The EditContext API allows you to build rich text editors that support advanced text input, such as Input Method Editor (IME) composition, an emoji picker, or other platform-specific editing UI.
edit-context.name: EditContext

element.description: The element() CSS function creates a live-updating image from an HTML element that can be used as an image or background image.
