element.description_html: The element() CSS function creates a live-updating image from an HTML element that can be used as an image or background image.
element.name: element()

element-capture.description: The restrictTo() method on screen capture media tracks limits capture to a specific element, excluding content which might occlude the element itself, such as video conferencing controls.
element-capture.description_html: The restrictTo() method on screen capture media tracks limits capture to a specific element, excluding content which might occlude the element itself, such as video conferencing controls.
element-capture.name: Element capture

element-from-point.description: The document.elementFromPoint() and document.elementsFromPoint() methods find the top-most element at a given point in the viewport, or all elements at a given point in the viewport, respectively.
element-from-point.description_html: The document.elementFromPoint() and document.elementsFromPoint() methods find the top-most element at a given point in the viewport, or all elements at a given point in the viewport, respectively.
element-from-point.name: document.elementFromPoint() and document.elementsFromPoint()

element-timing.description: The element performance entry and the PerformanceElementTiming API measures the time to render elements that have the elementtiming attribute.
element-timing.description_html: The element performance entry and the PerformanceElementTiming API measures the time to render elements that have the elementtiming attribute.
element-timing.name: Element timing

em.description: The <em> HTML element emphasizes or stresses the content, styling text as italic by default.
em.description_html: The <em> HTML element emphasizes or stresses the content, styling text as italic by default.
em.name: <em>

em-unit.description: The em CSS length unit is a font-relative length equal to the specified font size. In an element with a 2 inch font, 1em equals 2 inches.
em-unit.description_html: The em CSS length unit is a font-relative length equal to the specified font size. In an element with a 2 inch font, 1em equals 2 inches.
em-unit.name: em unit

embed.description: The <embed> element represents an external resource such as a PDF or SVG document. It was historically used for plugins such as Shockwave Flash.
embed.description_html: The <embed> element represents an external resource such as a PDF or SVG document. It was historically used for plugins such as Shockwave Flash.
embed.name: <embed>

empty.description: The :empty CSS pseudo-class matches elements without child elements.
empty.description_html: The :empty CSS pseudo-class matches elements without child elements.
empty.name: :empty

encrypted-media-extensions.description: The mediaKeys property of HTMLMediaElement and the navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess() method control the playback of content subject to digital rights management. Also known as EME.
encrypted-media-extensions.description_html: The mediaKeys property of HTMLMediaElement and the navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess() method control the playback of content subject to digital rights management. Also known as EME.
encrypted-media-extensions.name: Encrypted media extensions

enterkeyhint.description: The enterkeyhint global HTML attribute sets the label for a virtual keyboard's Enter key. For example, enterkeyhint="search" may label the key with a magnifying glass icon.
enterkeyhint.description_html: The enterkeyhint global HTML attribute sets the label for a virtual keyboard's Enter key. For example, enterkeyhint="search" may label the key with a magnifying glass icon.
enterkeyhint.name: enterkeyhint

error-cause.description: The cause property of errors records the specific original cause of the error, particularly for errors that have been re-thrown.
error-cause.description_html: The cause property of errors records the specific original cause of the error, particularly for errors that have been re-thrown.
error-cause.name: Error cause

escape-unescape.description: The escape() and unescape() built-in Javascript methods encode and unencode strings using percent encoding, where certain characters are replaced by hexadecimal escape sequences.
escape-unescape.description_html: The escape() and unescape() built-in Javascript methods encode and unencode strings using percent encoding, where certain characters are replaced by hexadecimal escape sequences.
escape-unescape.name: escape() and unescape()

event-timing.description: The event and first-input performance entries and the PerformanceEventTiming API measures the latency of user input events, such as mouse clicks or keypresses, and the latency of the first user input. First Input Delay (FID) is a common metric for perceived responsiveness.
event-timing.description_html: The event and first-input performance entries and the PerformanceEventTiming API measures the latency of user input events, such as mouse clicks or keypresses, and the latency of the first user input. First Input Delay (FID) is a common metric for perceived responsiveness.
event-timing.name: Event timing

events.description: The Event API and the addEventListener() method on objects that receive events (event targets) represent and handle significant things happening on a page. Many APIs fire events for a wide range of situations relating to those APIs, such as an image loading, a user clicking, or a value changing.
events.description_html: The Event API and the addEventListener() method on objects that receive events (event targets) represent and handle significant things happening on a page. Many APIs fire events for a wide range of situations relating to those APIs, such as an image loading, a user clicking, or a value changing.
events.name: Events

ex.description: The ex CSS length unit is a font-relative length equal to the used x-height of the first available font. X-height is often equal to the height of the lowercase x.
ex.description_html: The ex CSS length unit is a font-relative length equal to the used x-height of the first available font. X-height is often equal to the height of the lowercase x.
ex.name: ex unit

execcommand.description: The execCommand() method reads and writes from the clipboard and performs editing commands on editable text, such as changing the font name or style. Related methods check whether commands are supported, enabled, or applied.
execcommand.description_html: The execCommand() method reads and writes from the clipboard and performs editing commands on editable text, such as changing the font name or style. Related methods check whether commands are supported, enabled, or applied.
execcommand.name: execCommand()

exp-functions.description: The pow(), sqrt(), hypot(), log(), and exp() CSS functions compute various exponential functions.
exp-functions.description_html: The pow(), sqrt(), hypot(), log(), and exp() CSS functions compute various exponential functions.
exp-functions.name: pow(), sqrt(), hypot(), log(), and exp()

explicit-resource-management.description: The using and await using declarations and the dispose and asyncDispose symbols manage the lifecycle of resources such as file handles and streams. The DisposableStack and AsyncDisposableStack objects can group, dispose, and coordinate dependencies between multiple disposable resources.
explicit-resource-management.description_html: The using and await using declarations and the dispose and asyncDispose symbols manage the lifecycle of resources such as file handles and streams. The DisposableStack and AsyncDisposableStack objects can group, dispose, and coordinate dependencies between multiple disposable resources.
explicit-resource-management.name: Explicit resource management

exponentiation.description: The exponentiation (**) operator returns the result of raising the first operand to the power of the second operand.
exponentiation.description_html: The exponentiation (**) operator returns the result of raising the first operand to the power of the second operand.
exponentiation.name: Exponentiation operator

ext-blend-minmax.description: The EXT_blend_minmax extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds two blend equations, the minimum and maximum color components of the source and destination colors.
ext-blend-minmax.description_html: The EXT_blend_minmax extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds two blend equations, the minimum and maximum color components of the source and destination colors.
ext-blend-minmax.name: EXT_blend_minmax WebGL extension

ext-color-buffer-float.description: The EXT_color_buffer_float extension for WebGL 2.0 contexts adds color-renderable floating point formats to renderbufferStorage().
ext-color-buffer-float.description_html: The EXT_color_buffer_float extension for WebGL 2.0 contexts adds color-renderable floating point formats to renderbufferStorage().
ext-color-buffer-float.name: EXT_color_buffer_float WebGL extension

ext-color-buffer-half-float.description: The EXT_color_buffer_half_float extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts renders 16-bit floating-point color buffers.
ext-color-buffer-half-float.description_html: The EXT_color_buffer_half_float extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts renders 16-bit floating-point color buffers.
ext-color-buffer-half-float.name: EXT_color_buffer_half_float WebGL extension

ext-disjoint-timer-query.description: The EXT_disjoint_timer_query extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts measures the duration of a set of GL commands, without stalling the rendering pipeline.
ext-disjoint-timer-query.description_html: The EXT_disjoint_timer_query extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts measures the duration of a set of GL commands, without stalling the rendering pipeline.
ext-disjoint-timer-query.name: EXT_disjoint_timer_query WebGL extension

ext-float-blend.description: The EXT_float_blend extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds 32-bit floating-point components to blending and draw buffers.
ext-float-blend.description_html: The EXT_float_blend extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds 32-bit floating-point components to blending and draw buffers.
ext-float-blend.name: EXT_float_blend WebGL extension

ext-frag-depth.description: The EXT_frag_depth extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds setting the depth value of a fragment from within the fragment shader.
ext-frag-depth.description_html: The EXT_frag_depth extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds setting the depth value of a fragment from within the fragment shader.
ext-frag-depth.name: EXT_frag_depth WebGL extension

ext-shader-texture-lod.description: The EXT_shader_texture_lod extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds texture functions to the OpenGL ES Shading Language such that the shader writer explicitly controls of the level of detail (LOD).
ext-shader-texture-lod.description_html: The EXT_shader_texture_lod extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds texture functions to the OpenGL ES Shading Language such that the shader writer explicitly controls of the level of detail (LOD).
ext-shader-texture-lod.name: EXT_shader_texture_lod WebGL extension

ext-srgb.description: The EXT_sRGB extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds sRGB support to textures and framebuffer objects.
ext-srgb.description_html: The EXT_sRGB extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds sRGB support to textures and framebuffer objects.
ext-srgb.name: EXT_sRGB WebGL extension

ext-texture-compression-bptc.description: The EXT_texture_compression_bptc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the BPTC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
ext-texture-compression-bptc.description_html: The EXT_texture_compression_bptc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the BPTC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
ext-texture-compression-bptc.name: EXT_texture_compression_bptc WebGL extension

ext-texture-compression-rgtc.description: The EXT_texture_compression_rgtc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds RGTC compressed texture formats. RGTC is a block-based texture compression format suited for unsigned and signed red and red-green textures. Also known as Red-Green Texture Compression.
ext-texture-compression-rgtc.description_html: The EXT_texture_compression_rgtc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds RGTC compressed texture formats. RGTC is a block-based texture compression format suited for unsigned and signed red and red-green textures. Also known as Red-Green Texture Compression.
ext-texture-compression-rgtc.name: EXT_texture_compression_rgtc WebGL extension

ext-texture-filter-anisotropic.description: The EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds anisotropic filtering (AF). AF improves the quality of mipmapped texture access when viewing a textured primitive at an oblique angle.
ext-texture-filter-anisotropic.description_html: The EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds anisotropic filtering (AF). AF improves the quality of mipmapped texture access when viewing a textured primitive at an oblique angle.
ext-texture-filter-anisotropic.name: EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic WebGL extension

ext-texture-norm16.description: The EXT_texture_norm16 extension to WebGL 2.0 contexts adds 16 bit signed normalized and unsigned normalized fixed-point texture, renderbuffer, and texture buffer formats.
ext-texture-norm16.description_html: The EXT_texture_norm16 extension to WebGL 2.0 contexts adds 16 bit signed normalized and unsigned normalized fixed-point texture, renderbuffer, and texture buffer formats.
ext-texture-norm16.name: EXT_texture_norm16 WebGL extension

external.description: The window.external.AddSearchProvider() and window.external.IsSearchProviderInstalled() do nothing. Historically, they added external search providers to the browser.
external.description_html: The window.external.AddSearchProvider() and window.external.IsSearchProviderInstalled() do nothing. Historically, they added external search providers to the browser.
external.name: window.external

eyedropper.description: The EyeDropper API opens an eyedropper tool, a color picker that allows users to select a color from their screen.
eyedropper.description_html: The EyeDropper API opens an eyedropper tool, a color picker that allows users to select a color from their screen.
eyedropper.name: Eyedropper

fast-seek.description: The fastSeek() method seeks an <audio> or <video> element as fast as possible, by seeking to a keyframe instead of exactly the requested time.
fast-seek.description_html: The fastSeek() method seeks an <audio> or <video> element as fast as possible, by seeking to a keyframe instead of exactly the requested time.
fast-seek.name: fastSeek()

fedcm.description: The IdentityCredential API delegates authentication to a third-party identity provider, instead of using third-party cookies. Also known as FedCM.
fedcm.description_html: The IdentityCredential API delegates authentication to a third-party identity provider, instead of using third-party cookies. Also known as FedCM.
fedcm.name: Federated credential management

federated-credentials.description: The FederatedCredential API represents the details required to authenticate a user using a third-party identity provider. Not to be confused with federated credential management (FedCM).
federated-credentials.description_html: The FederatedCredential API represents the details required to authenticate a user using a third-party identity provider. Not to be confused with federated credential management (FedCM).
federated-credentials.name: Federated credentials

fencedframe.description: The <fencedframe> element embeds another HTML page into the current page in a more secure and privacy-preserving way than <iframe> elements.
fencedframe.description_html: The <fencedframe> element embeds another HTML page into the current page in a more secure and privacy-preserving way than <iframe> elements.
fencedframe.name: <fencedframe>

fetch.description: The fetch() method makes asynchronous HTTP requests.
fetch.description_html: The fetch() method makes asynchronous HTTP requests.
fetch.name: Fetch

fetch-metadata.description: The Sec-Fetch-Dest, Sec-Fetch-Mode, Sec-Fetch-Site, and Sec-Fetch-User HTTP headers provide extra information about the way a request was made, to help servers reject certain kinds of malicious requests.
fetch-metadata.description_html: The Sec-Fetch-Dest, Sec-Fetch-Mode, Sec-Fetch-Site, and Sec-Fetch-User HTTP headers provide extra information about the way a request was made, to help servers reject certain kinds of malicious requests.
fetch-metadata.name: Fetch metadata request headers

fetch-priority.description: The fetch() priority option and the fetchpriority HTML attribute give hints to the browser about which requests to do before other requests of the same type.
fetch-priority.description_html: The fetch() priority option and the fetchpriority HTML attribute give hints to the browser about which requests to do before other requests of the same type.
fetch-priority.name: Fetch priority

fetch-request-streams.description: A fetch() request uploads a stream of data to the server when a request's body property is a ReadableStream object.
fetch-request-streams.description_html: A fetch() request uploads a stream of data to the server when a request's body property is a ReadableStream object.
fetch-request-streams.name: Fetch upload streams

fetchlater.description: The fetchLater() method requests a deferred fetch sent at an unknown time. The browser chooses a reliable time to send the request, ideally when the document is unloaded, and ignores the response. This API is useful for sending beacons to a server without expecting a particular response.
fetchlater.description_html: The fetchLater() method requests a deferred fetch sent at an unknown time. The browser chooses a reliable time to send the request, ideally when the document is unloaded, and ignores the response. This API is useful for sending beacons to a server without expecting a particular response.
fetchlater.name: fetchLater

field-sizing.description: The field-sizing CSS property allows form controls such as <textarea> to be sized based on their content.
field-sizing.description_html: The field-sizing CSS property allows form controls such as <textarea> to be sized based on their content.
field-sizing.name: field-sizing

fieldset.description: The <fieldset> and <legend> elements group several form control elements within a web form.
fieldset.description_html: The <fieldset> and <legend> elements group several form control elements within a web form.
fieldset.name: <fieldset> and <legend>

figure.description: The <figure> and <figcaption> HTML elements represent an illustration, diagram, text, or other self-contained reference content, with an optional caption.
figure.description_html: The <figure> and <figcaption> HTML elements represent an illustration, diagram, text, or other self-contained reference content, with an optional caption.
figure.name: <figure> and <figcaption>

file.description: The File API represents and reads from file data and metadata. Typically, you get files through other APIs, such as the <input type="file"> element or drag-and-drop events. You may also send file data to other APIs, such as creating images or drawing on canvases.
file.description_html: The File API represents and reads from file data and metadata. Typically, you get files through other APIs, such as the <input type="file"> element or drag-and-drop events. You may also send file data to other APIs, such as creating images or drawing on canvases.
file.name: File API

file-selector-button.description: The ::file-selector-button CSS pseudo-element selects the button of a <input type="file"> element.
file-selector-button.description_html: The ::file-selector-button CSS pseudo-element selects the button of a <input type="file"> element.
file-selector-button.name: ::file-selector-button

file-system-access.description: The showOpenFilePicker(), showDirectoryPicker(), and showSaveFilePicker() methods request access to files and directories on the user's device and returns a handle for reading and writing to them.
file-system-access.description_html: The showOpenFilePicker(), showDirectoryPicker(), and showSaveFilePicker() methods request access to files and directories on the user's device and returns a handle for reading and writing to them.
file-system-access.name: File system access

filter.description: The filter CSS property applies one or more graphic effects to an element. You can use filter functions, such as blur() and drop-shadow(), alone or combined to produce different effects.
filter.description_html: The filter CSS property applies one or more graphic effects to an element. You can use filter functions, such as blur() and drop-shadow(), alone or combined to produce different effects.
filter.name: filter

first-letter.description: The ::first-letter CSS pseudo-element selects the first letter in an element for styling.
first-letter.description_html: The ::first-letter CSS pseudo-element selects the first letter in an element for styling.
first-letter.name: ::first-letter

first-line.description: The ::first-line CSS pseudo-element selects the first line of text in an element for styling.
first-line.description_html: The ::first-line CSS pseudo-element selects the first line of text in an element for styling.
first-line.name: ::first-line

fit-content.description: The fit-content CSS keyword expands a box as needed to fit its contents until the maximum size is reached, preserving the content's preferred aspect ratio.
fit-content.description_html: The fit-content CSS keyword expands a box as needed to fit its contents until the maximum size is reached, preserving the content's preferred aspect ratio.
fit-content.name: fit-content

fit-content-function.description: The fit-content() CSS function, used outside of a grid layout property, clamps a length between min-content and max-content.
fit-content-function.description_html: The fit-content() CSS function, used outside of a grid layout property, clamps a length between min-content and max-content.
fit-content-function.name: fit-content()

fixed-positioning.description: The position: fixed CSS declaration removes an element from the normal flow and positions it relative to the viewport or page.
fixed-positioning.description_html: The position: fixed CSS declaration removes an element from the normal flow and positions it relative to the viewport or page.
fixed-positioning.name: Fixed positioning

flexbox.description: Flexbox is a one-dimensional layout system, which places content either horizontally or vertically, with optional wrapping.
flexbox.description_html: Flexbox is a one-dimensional layout system, which places content either horizontally or vertically, with optional wrapping.
flexbox.name: Flexbox

flexbox-gap.description: The gap CSS property in a flexbox layout sets the size of the space between items.
flexbox-gap.description_html: The gap CSS property in a flexbox layout sets the size of the space between items.
flexbox-gap.name: Flexbox gap

float-clear.description: The float CSS property aligns an element to either side of its container, allowing text and inline elements to flow around it. The clear CSS property sets whether an element is moved below floating elements that proceed it.
float-clear.description_html: The float CSS property aligns an element to either side of its container, allowing text and inline elements to flow around it. The clear CSS property sets whether an element is moved below floating elements that proceed it.
float-clear.name: float and clear

float16array.description: Float16Array is a typed array of 16-bit floating point numbers.
float16array.description_html: Float16Array is a typed array of 16-bit floating point numbers.
float16array.name: Float16Array

focus-events.description: Focus events, such as focus and blur, fire when an element gets or loses focus.
focus-events.description_html: Focus events, such as focus and blur, fire when an element gets or loses focus.
focus-events.name: Focus events

focus-visible.description: The :focus-visible CSS pseudo-class selects elements that match the :focus pseudo-class and meets the browser's criteria for visually emphasizing focused elements.
focus-visible.description_html: The :focus-visible CSS pseudo-class selects elements that match the :focus pseudo-class and meets the browser's criteria for visually emphasizing focused elements.
focus-visible.name: :focus-visible

focus-within.description: The :focus-within CSS pseudo-class matches an element if the element or any of its children are focused.
focus-within.description_html: The :focus-within CSS pseudo-class matches an element if the element or any of its children are focused.
focus-within.name: :focus-within

font-display.description: The font-display CSS descriptor sets whether to show a substitute font or nothing while a font face loads. The property manages what's known as a flash of unstyled text or flash of invisible text.
font-display.description_html: The font-display CSS descriptor sets whether to show a substitute font or nothing while a font face loads. The property manages what's known as a flash of unstyled text or flash of invisible text.
font-display.name: font-display

font-face.description: The @font-face CSS at-rule creates a custom font-family value. The at-rule's descriptors set the font's name, source, and various display settings.
font-face.description_html: The @font-face CSS at-rule creates a custom font-family value. The at-rule's descriptors set the font's name, source, and various display settings.
font-face.name: @font-face

font-family.description: The font-family CSS property sets the desired font face for text, along with optional fallback font faces.
font-family.description_html: The font-family CSS property sets the desired font face for text, along with optional fallback font faces.
font-family.name: font-family

font-family-math.description: The font-family: math CSS declaration uses the browser default font face for displaying mathematical expressions.
font-family-math.description_html: The font-family: math CSS declaration uses the browser default font face for displaying mathematical expressions.
font-family-math.name: Math font family

font-family-system.description: The font-family: system-ui CSS declaration uses the operating system default font for text.
font-family-system.description_html: The font-family: system-ui CSS declaration uses the operating system default font for text.
font-family-system.name: System font

font-family-ui.description: The ui-serif, ui-sans-serif, ui-monospace and ui-rounded values for the font-family CSS property use device-default user interface fonts for text.
font-family-ui.description_html: The ui-serif, ui-sans-serif, ui-monospace and ui-rounded values for the font-family CSS property use device-default user interface fonts for text.
font-family-ui.name: UI fonts

font-feature-settings.description: The font-feature-settings CSS property sets low-level OpenType feature tags for a font. When possible, use font-variant instead.
font-feature-settings.description_html: The font-feature-settings CSS property sets low-level OpenType feature tags for a font. When possible, use font-variant instead.
font-feature-settings.name: font-feature-settings

font-kerning.description: The font-kerning CSS property sets whether kerning data from a font is used to adjust the space between letters.
font-kerning.description_html: The font-kerning CSS property sets whether kerning data from a font is used to adjust the space between letters.
font-kerning.name: font-kerning

font-language-override.description: The font-language-override CSS property sets which language-specific glyphs are displayed.
font-language-override.description_html: The font-language-override CSS property sets which language-specific glyphs are displayed.
font-language-override.name: font-language-override

font-loading.description: The document.fonts API dynamically loads custom fonts and tracks when fonts are loading or ready to use.
font-loading.description_html: The document.fonts API dynamically loads custom fonts and tracks when fonts are loading or ready to use.
font-loading.name: Font loading

font-metric-overrides.description: The ascent-override, descent-override, and line-gap-override descriptors adjust the display of a font declared in an @font-face statement. This can help make fallback fonts look the same size.
font-metric-overrides.description_html: The ascent-override, descent-override, and line-gap-override descriptors adjust the display of a font declared in an @font-face statement. This can help make fallback fonts look the same size.
font-metric-overrides.name: Font metric overrides

font-optical-sizing.description: The font-optical-sizing CSS property sets whether text rendering is optimized for viewing at different sizes.
font-optical-sizing.description_html: The font-optical-sizing CSS property sets whether text rendering is optimized for viewing at different sizes.
font-optical-sizing.name: font-optical-sizing

font-palette.description: The font-palette CSS property selects a color palette from the font, optionally overriding individual colors in the @font-palette-values at-rule.
font-palette.description_html: The font-palette CSS property selects a color palette from the font, optionally overriding individual colors in the @font-palette-values at-rule.
font-palette.name: font-palette

font-palette-animation.description: You can animate color fonts between two font-palette values.
font-palette-animation.description_html: You can animate color fonts between two font-palette values.
font-palette-animation.name: font-palette animation

font-shorthand.description: The font CSS property shorthand sets multiple font properties, including style, weight, size, and font family.
font-shorthand.description_html: The font CSS property shorthand sets multiple font properties, including style, weight, size, and font family.
font-shorthand.name: Font shorthand

font-size.description: The font-size CSS property sets the text height.
font-size.description_html: The font-size CSS property sets the text height.
font-size.name: font-size

font-size-adjust.description: The font-size-adjust CSS property preserves apparent text size, regardless of the font used, by scaling fonts to the same size with respect to a specific metric, such as x-height. This can help make fallback fonts look the same size.
font-size-adjust.description_html: The font-size-adjust CSS property preserves apparent text size, regardless of the font used, by scaling fonts to the same size with respect to a specific metric, such as x-height. This can help make fallback fonts look the same size.
font-size-adjust.name: font-size-adjust

font-stretch.description: The font-stretch CSS property selects a font face from a font family based on width, either by a keyword such as condensed or a percentage.
font-stretch.description_html: The font-stretch CSS property selects a font face from a font family based on width, either by a keyword such as condensed or a percentage.
font-stretch.name: font-stretch

font-style.description: The font-style CSS property sets the text style, with normal, italic, and oblique options.
font-style.description_html: The font-style CSS property sets the text style, with normal, italic, and oblique options.
font-style.name: font-style

font-synthesis.description: The font-synthesis CSS shorthand property disables all font synthesis except the given kinds. To disable a specific kind of font synthesis, instead use the longhand properties such as font-synthesis-style and font-synthesis-weight.
font-synthesis.description_html: The font-synthesis CSS shorthand property disables all font synthesis except the given kinds. To disable a specific kind of font synthesis, instead use the longhand properties such as font-synthesis-style and font-synthesis-weight.
font-synthesis.name: font-synthesis

font-synthesis-position.description: The font-synthesis-position CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize subscript and superscript typefaces when they're missing from the font.
font-synthesis-position.description_html: The font-synthesis-position CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize subscript and superscript typefaces when they're missing from the font.
font-synthesis-position.name: font-synthesis-position

font-synthesis-small-caps.description: The font-synthesis-small-caps CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize small caps typefaces when they're missing from the font.
font-synthesis-small-caps.description_html: The font-synthesis-small-caps CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize small caps typefaces when they're missing from the font.
font-synthesis-small-caps.name: font-synthesis-small-caps

font-synthesis-style.description: The font-synthesis-style CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize italic and oblique typefaces when they're missing from the font.
font-synthesis-style.description_html: The font-synthesis-style CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize italic and oblique typefaces when they're missing from the font.
font-synthesis-style.name: font-synthesis-style

font-synthesis-weight.description: The font-synthesis-weight CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize bold typefaces when they're missing from the font.
font-synthesis-weight.description_html: The font-synthesis-weight CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize bold typefaces when they're missing from the font.
font-synthesis-weight.name: font-synthesis-weight

font-variant.description: The font-variant CSS property is a shorthand for font-variant-alternates, font-variant-caps, font-variant-east-asian, font-variant-emoji, font-variant-ligatures, font-variant-numeric, and font-variant-position.
font-variant.description_html: The font-variant CSS property is a shorthand for font-variant-alternates, font-variant-caps, font-variant-east-asian, font-variant-emoji, font-variant-ligatures, font-variant-numeric, and font-variant-position.
font-variant.name: font-variant

font-variant-alternates.description: The font-variant-alternates CSS property, along with the @font-feature-values at-rule, chooses when to use a font's alternate glyphs.
font-variant-alternates.description_html: The font-variant-alternates CSS property, along with the @font-feature-values at-rule, chooses when to use a font's alternate glyphs.
font-variant-alternates.name: font-variant-alternates

font-variant-caps.description: The font-variant-caps CSS property sets whether text should be displayed in small caps, petite caps, or with capital letters designed for titles.
font-variant-caps.description_html: The font-variant-caps CSS property sets whether text should be displayed in small caps, petite caps, or with capital letters designed for titles.
font-variant-caps.name: font-variant-caps

font-variant-east-asian.description: The font-variant-east-asian CSS property controls glyph substitution and sizing in East Asian text.
font-variant-east-asian.description_html: The font-variant-east-asian CSS property controls glyph substitution and sizing in East Asian text.
font-variant-east-asian.name: font-variant-east-asian

font-variant-emoji.description: The font-variant-emoji CSS property sets the default presentation for emoji characters.
font-variant-emoji.description_html: The font-variant-emoji CSS property sets the default presentation for emoji characters.
font-variant-emoji.name: font-variant-emoji

font-variant-ligatures.description: The font-variant-ligatures CSS property sets how characters can be visually combined for readability or stylistic reasons.
font-variant-ligatures.description_html: The font-variant-ligatures CSS property sets how characters can be visually combined for readability or stylistic reasons.
font-variant-ligatures.name: font-variant-ligatures

font-variant-numeric.description: The font-variant-numeric CSS property sets how numeric characters are displayed. For example, you can align columns of numbers or use zeroes that have a slash.
font-variant-numeric.description_html: The font-variant-numeric CSS property sets how numeric characters are displayed. For example, you can align columns of numbers or use zeroes that have a slash.
font-variant-numeric.name: font-variant-numeric

font-variant-position.description: The font-variant-position CSS property sets whether to use alternate glyphs for subscript and superscript text.
font-variant-position.description_html: The font-variant-position CSS property sets whether to use alternate glyphs for subscript and superscript text.
font-variant-position.name: font-variant-position

font-variation-settings.description: The font-variation-settings CSS property sets an "axis of variability" on a variable font, such as weight, optical size, or a custom axis defined by the typeface designer. When possible, use other CSS font properties, such as font-weight: bold. Also known as variable fonts.
font-variation-settings.description_html: The font-variation-settings CSS property sets an "axis of variability" on a variable font, such as weight, optical size, or a custom axis defined by the typeface designer. When possible, use other CSS font properties, such as font-weight: bold. Also known as variable fonts.
font-variation-settings.name: font-variation-settings

font-weight.description: The font-weight CSS property controls the thickness of a font. It is set explicitly with the keyword bold or a number, or relative to the inherited thickness with the keywords bolder or lighter.
font-weight.description_html: The font-weight CSS property controls the thickness of a font. It is set explicitly with the keyword bold or a number, or relative to the inherited thickness with the keywords bolder or lighter.
font-weight.name: font-weight

font-width.description: The font-width CSS property selects a font face from a font family based on width, either by a keyword such as condensed or a percentage.
font-width.description_html: The font-width CSS property selects a font face from a font family based on width, either by a keyword such as condensed or a percentage.
font-width.name: font-width

forced-colors.description: The forced-colors CSS @media rule detects when a user has chosen to use a forced colors mode, also known as high-contrast mode, and the forced-color-adjust CSS property sets whether forced colors apply to an element.
forced-colors.description_html: The forced-colors CSS @media rule detects when a user has chosen to use a forced colors mode, also known as high-contrast mode, and the forced-color-adjust CSS property sets whether forced colors apply to an element.
forced-colors.name: Forced colors

form.description: The <form> element contains interactive controls for submitting information.
form.description_html: The <form> element contains interactive controls for submitting information.
form.name: <form>

form-associated-custom-elements.description: Custom elements may act like built-in form elements, via the the attachInternals() method of HTMLElement and the ElementInternals API.
form-associated-custom-elements.description_html: Custom elements may act like built-in form elements, via the the attachInternals() method of HTMLElement and the ElementInternals API.
form-associated-custom-elements.name: Form-associated custom elements

form-validity-pseudos.description: The form validity CSS pseudo-classes match <form> elements based on the constraints of a form field, such as validity (:valid, :invalid, :in-range, :out-of-range) and necessity (:optional or :required).
form-validity-pseudos.description_html: The form validity CSS pseudo-classes match <form> elements based on the constraints of a form field, such as validity (:valid, :invalid, :in-range, :out-of-range) and necessity (:optional or :required).
form-validity-pseudos.name: Form validity pseudo-classes

fullscreen.description: The fullscreen API makes a specific element fill the whole screen and hides most browser UI.
fullscreen.description_html: The fullscreen API makes a specific element fill the whole screen and hides most browser UI.
fullscreen.name: Fullscreen API

function.description: The @function CSS at-rule defines a custom function that takes CSS values or custom properties as arguments, and returns a CSS value. It can be based on conditional logic such as by using the @media at-rule.
function.description_html: The @function CSS at-rule defines a custom function that takes CSS values or custom properties as arguments, and returns a CSS value. It can be based on conditional logic such as by using the @media at-rule.
function.name: @function

functions.description: Functions are series of statements that can be called and return a value. The function keyword (as in function () { }) and arrow (=>) expression create functions. The JavaScript functions protocol includes default and rest parameters and binding to this.
functions.description_html: Functions are series of statements that can be called and return a value. The function keyword (as in function () { }) and arrow (=>) expression create functions. The JavaScript functions protocol includes default and rest parameters and binding to this.
functions.name: Functions

functions-caller-arguments.description: The caller and arguments properties of a non-strict mode Function object are the function that called it and the arguments it was called with. Not to be confused with the arguments variable in a function body's local scope.
functions-caller-arguments.description_html: The caller and arguments properties of a non-strict mode Function object are the function that called it and the arguments it was called with. Not to be confused with the arguments variable in a function body's local scope.
functions-caller-arguments.name: Function caller and arguments

gamepad.description: The navigator.getGamepads() API accesses and responds to signals from game controllers.
gamepad.description_html: The navigator.getGamepads() API accesses and responds to signals from game controllers.
gamepad.name: Gamepad

gamepad-haptics.description: The gamepad.vibrationActuator property represents a gamepad's haptics hardware, which allows you to control the vibration motors in a gamepad.
gamepad-haptics.description_html: The gamepad.vibrationActuator property represents a gamepad's haptics hardware, which allows you to control the vibration motors in a gamepad.
gamepad-haptics.name: Gamepad haptic feedback

gamepad-touch.description: The touched property of a GamepadButton object indicates whether a button capable of detecting touch is currently touched.
gamepad-touch.description_html: The touched property of a GamepadButton object indicates whether a button capable of detecting touch is currently touched.
gamepad-touch.name: Gamepad touch buttons

gamepad-vr.description: The hand and pose properties of a Gamepad object represent the position in space and the hand that WebVR controllers are held in.
gamepad-vr.description_html: The hand and pose properties of a Gamepad object represent the position in space and the hand that WebVR controllers are held in.
gamepad-vr.name: Gamepad VR hands and poses

gap-decorations.description: The column-rule and row-rule CSS properties display decorative lines between columns and rows of a flex, grid, or multi-column layout. The rule-break, rule-outset, and rule-paint-order properties control the appearance of these lines.
gap-decorations.description_html: The column-rule and row-rule CSS properties display decorative lines between columns and rows of a flex, grid, or multi-column layout. The rule-break, rule-outset, and rule-paint-order properties control the appearance of these lines.
gap-decorations.name: Gap decorations

generators.description: Generator functions (function*) create iterators that return multiple values, one after another, on-demand.
generators.description_html: Generator functions (function*) create iterators that return multiple values, one after another, on-demand.
generators.name: Generators

geolocation.description: The navigator.gelocation API requests the user's latitude, longitude, heading, and speed.
geolocation.description_html: The navigator.gelocation API requests the user's latitude, longitude, heading, and speed.
geolocation.name: Geolocation

get-computed-style.description: The getComputedStyle() global method returns an CSSStyleDeclaration object that represents all CSS declarations applied to a given element.
get-computed-style.description_html: The getComputedStyle() global method returns an CSSStyleDeclaration object that represents all CSS declarations applied to a given element.
get-computed-style.name: getComputedStyle()

getboxquads.description: The getBoxQuads() method, when called on a document, element, pseudo-element, or text node, returns the list of DOMQuad objects that represent the CSS boxes used to render the node.
getboxquads.description_html: The getBoxQuads() method, when called on a document, element, pseudo-element, or text node, returns the list of DOMQuad objects that represent the CSS boxes used to render the node.
getboxquads.name: getBoxQuads()

gethtml.description: The getHTML() method of Element and ShadowRoot objects serializes an element's DOM to an HTML string.
gethtml.description_html: The getHTML() method of Element and ShadowRoot objects serializes an element's DOM to an HTML string.
gethtml.name: getHTML()

globalthis.description: The globalThis property accesses the global this value (and hence the global object itself) across environments.
globalthis.description_html: The globalThis property accesses the global this value (and hence the global object itself) across environments.
globalthis.name: globalThis

glyph-orientation-vertical.description: The glyph-orientation-vertical CSS property sets the orientation of glyphs in text rendered in a vertical writing mode.
glyph-orientation-vertical.description_html: The glyph-orientation-vertical CSS property sets the orientation of glyphs in text rendered in a vertical writing mode.
glyph-orientation-vertical.name: glyph-orientation-vertical

gpc.description: The Sec-GPC request header indicates that the user does not consent to a website or service selling or sharing their personal information with third parties.
gpc.description_html: The Sec-GPC request header indicates that the user does not consent to a website or service selling or sharing their personal information with third parties.
gpc.name: Global privacy control

gradient-interpolation.description: Gradient interpolation controls how the colors between gradient stops are calculated in CSS. For example, linear-gradient(to right in oklch longer hue, red, red); calculates in the oklch color space, with the hue going all the way around the hue circle from red back to red.
gradient-interpolation.description_html: Gradient interpolation controls how the colors between gradient stops are calculated in CSS. For example, linear-gradient(to right in oklch longer hue, red, red); calculates in the oklch color space, with the hue going all the way around the hue circle from red back to red.

gradients.description: The linear-gradient() and radial-gradient() CSS functions and their repeating counterparts create backgrounds that progress smoothly between multiple colors.
gradients.description_html: The linear-gradient() and radial-gradient() CSS functions and their repeating counterparts create backgrounds that progress smoothly between multiple colors.

grid.description: CSS grid is a two-dimensional layout system, which lays content out in rows and columns.
grid.description_html: CSS grid is a two-dimensional layout system, which lays content out in rows and columns.
grid.name: Grid

grid-animation.description: Grid animation allows you to animate the grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows CSS properties.
grid-animation.description_html: Grid animation allows you to animate the grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows CSS properties.
grid-animation.name: Grid animation

gyroscope.description: The Gyroscope API reads the angular velocity of a device in three dimensions.
gyroscope.description_html: The Gyroscope API reads the angular velocity of a device in three dimensions.
gyroscope.name: Gyroscope

hanging-punctuation.description: The hanging-punctuation CSS property puts punctuation characters outside of the box to align the text with the rest of the document.
hanging-punctuation.description_html: The hanging-punctuation CSS property puts punctuation characters outside of the box to align the text with the rest of the document.
hanging-punctuation.name: Hanging punctuation

hardware-concurrency.description: The navigator.hardwareConcurrency property is the number of logical processors available to run threads on the user's computer.
hardware-concurrency.description_html: The navigator.hardwareConcurrency property is the number of logical processors available to run threads on the user's computer.
hardware-concurrency.name: hardwareConcurrency

has.description: The :has() CSS functional pseudo-class matches an element if any of the selectors passed as parameters would match at least one element.
has.description_html: The :has() CSS functional pseudo-class matches an element if any of the selectors passed as parameters would match at least one element.
has.name: :has()

has-slotted.description: The :has-slotted CSS pseudo-class matches <slot> elements where the fallback content is not shown. The pseudo-class matches any slotted content, including white space, text nodes, or elements.
has-slotted.description_html: The :has-slotted CSS pseudo-class matches <slot> elements where the fallback content is not shown. The pseudo-class matches any slotted content, including white space, text nodes, or elements.

hashbang-comments.description: The #! comment at the absolute start of a script or module is treated as a normal comment and is ignored by the JavaScript engine.
hashbang-comments.description_html: The #! comment at the absolute start of a script or module is treated as a normal comment and is ignored by the JavaScript engine.
hashbang-comments.name: Hashbang comments

hashchange.description: The hashchange event fires when the URL fragment identifier (the part of the URL starting with #) of the current page has changed.
hashchange.description_html: The hashchange event fires when the URL fragment identifier (the part of the URL starting with #) of the current page has changed.
hashchange.name: hashchange

head.description: The <head> element contains machine-readable information (metadata) about the document, such as the title, <script> and <style> elements, and <meta> elements.
head.description_html: The <head> element contains machine-readable information (metadata) about the document, such as the title, <script> and <style> elements, and <meta> elements.

header-footer.description: The <header> and <footer> HTML elements represent content that precedes and follows the main page content, respectively.
header-footer.description_html: The <header> and <footer> HTML elements represent content that precedes and follows the main page content, respectively.

heading-selectors.description: The :heading and :heading() CSS pseudo-classes match headings of varying levels. The :heading pseudo-class matches any heading (<h1> through <h6>). The :heading() selector matches any of the given levels. For example, :heading(1, 2) matches headings level 1 and 2.
heading-selectors.description_html: The :heading and :heading() CSS pseudo-classes match headings of varying levels. The :heading pseudo-class matches any heading (<h1> through <h6>). The :heading() selector matches any of the given levels. For example, :heading(1, 2) matches headings level 1 and 2.

headings.description: The <h1> through <h6> HTML elements represent six levels of section headings, in order of decreasing importance.
headings.description_html: The <h1> through <h6> HTML elements represent six levels of section headings, in order of decreasing importance.
headings.name: <h1> through <h6>

hgroup.description: The <hgroup> element represents a heading and related content.
hgroup.description_html: The <hgroup> element represents a heading and related content.
hgroup.name: <hgroup>

hidden-until-found.description: The hidden="until-found" attribute hides an element until it is found using the browser's find-in-page search or it is directly navigated to by following a URL fragment.
hidden-until-found.description_html: The hidden="until-found" attribute hides an element until it is found using the browser's find-in-page search or it is directly navigated to by following a URL fragment.
hidden-until-found.name: hidden="until-found"

highlight.description: Custom highlights style arbitrary text ranges, without adding extra elements to the DOM.
highlight.description_html: Custom highlights style arbitrary text ranges, without adding extra elements to the DOM.

history.description: The window.history API manipulates the browser session history, from navigations to state management, in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in.
history.description_html: The window.history API manipulates the browser session history, from navigations to state management, in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in.
history.name: History

host.description: The :host CSS pseudo-class selects the containing element of the shadow tree in which it is used. The :host() CSS pseudo-class selects the that element only if it matches the provided selector.
host.description_html: The :host CSS pseudo-class selects the containing element of the shadow tree in which it is used. The :host() CSS pseudo-class selects the that element only if it matches the provided selector.

host-context.description: The :host-context() CSS pseudo-class selects the containing element of the shadow tree in which it is used if that element or an ancestor matches the provided selector.
host-context.description_html: The :host-context() CSS pseudo-class selects the containing element of the shadow tree in which it is used if that element or an ancestor matches the provided selector.

hr.description: The <hr> element represents a thematic break between paragraphs, often shown as a horizontal rule.
hr.description_html: The <hr> element represents a thematic break between paragraphs, often shown as a horizontal rule.

hsl.description: The hsl() and hsla() CSS functions pick colors using hue, saturation, lightness, and alpha (transparency) channels.
hsl.description_html: The hsl() and hsla() CSS functions pick colors using hue, saturation, lightness, and alpha (transparency) channels.

hsts.description: The Strict-Transport-Security HTTP response header informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS, and that any future attempts to access it using HTTP should automatically be converted to HTTPS. Also known as HSTS.
hsts.description_html: The Strict-Transport-Security HTTP response header informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS, and that any future attempts to access it using HTTP should automatically be converted to HTTPS. Also known as HSTS.

html.description: The <html> element represents the top-level of an HTML document and is referred to as the root element.
html.description_html: The <html> element represents the top-level of an HTML document and is referred to as the root element.
html.name: <html>

html-media-capture.description: The capture HTML attribute for <input type="file"> elements allows the user to capture media using the device's camera or microphone.
html-media-capture.description_html: The capture HTML attribute for <input type="file"> elements allows the user to capture media using the device's camera or microphone.
html-media-capture.name: HTML media capture

html-wrapper-methods.description: JavaScript built-in methods such as, String.bold() and String.italics(), wrap strings in (often historic) HTML.
html-wrapper-methods.description_html: JavaScript built-in methods such as, String.bold() and String.italics(), wrap strings in (often historic) HTML.

http-authentication.description: The Authorization and WWW-Authenticate headers authenticate a user with a server.
http-authentication.description_html: The Authorization and WWW-Authenticate headers authenticate a user with a server.
http-authentication.name: HTTP authentication

http11.description: HTTP/1.1 is a network protocol used by browsers and servers. It has been superseded by HTTP/2 and HTTP/3.
http11.description_html: HTTP/1.1 is a network protocol used by browsers and servers. It has been superseded by HTTP/2 and HTTP/3.

http2.description: The HTTP/2 protocol is a major revision of the HTTP network protocol, providing improved performance and efficiency by using a single TCP connection to send multiple streams of data at once.
http2.description_html: The HTTP/2 protocol is a major revision of the HTTP network protocol, providing improved performance and efficiency by using a single TCP connection to send multiple streams of data at once.

http3.description: HTTP/3 is a major revision of the HTTP network protocol, providing improved performance and efficiency by using QUIC as the underlying transport protocol.
http3.description_html: HTTP/3 is a major revision of the HTTP network protocol, providing improved performance and efficiency by using QUIC as the underlying transport protocol.

hwb.description: The hwb() CSS function picks colors using hue, whiteness, and blackness channels.
hwb.description_html: The hwb() CSS function picks colors using hue, whiteness, and blackness channels.

hyphenate-character.description: The hyphenate-character CSS property sets the character or string to use at the end of a line before a line break.
hyphenate-character.description_html: The hyphenate-character CSS property sets the character or string to use at the end of a line before a line break.
hyphenate-character.name: Hyphenate character

hyphenate-limit-chars.description: The hyphenate-limit-chars CSS property sets the number of characters in a word before it is hyphenated and the minimum number of characters on either side of the hyphen.
hyphenate-limit-chars.description_html: The hyphenate-limit-chars CSS property sets the number of characters in a word before it is hyphenated and the minimum number of characters on either side of the hyphen.

hyphens.description: The hyphens CSS property controls when long words are broken by line wrapping. Although called hyphens, the property applies to word-splitting behavior across languages, such as customary spelling changes or the use of other characters. Support for non-English languages varies significantly.

i.description_html: The <i> HTML element identifies idiomatic content, styling text as italic by default.

ic.description: The ic CSS length unit corresponds to the width of CJK ideographic characters.

idle-detection.description: The IdleDetector API is used to notify a webpage of the user's idle, active, and locked state.

if.description: The if() CSS function is an inline conditional value that returns a value based on a set of conditions.

iframe.description: The <iframe> element embeds another HTML page into the current page.
iframe.description_html: The <iframe> element embeds another HTML page into the current page.

iframe-credentialless.description: The credentialless attribute for the <iframe> HTML element loads third-party content in an ephemeral context and does not send any credentials such as cookies. When using cross-origin isolation, this allows you to embed content that does not send Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy headers.
iframe-credentialless.description_html: The credentialless attribute for the <iframe> HTML element loads third-party content in an ephemeral context and does not send any credentials such as cookies. When using cross-origin isolation, this allows you to embed content that does not send Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy headers.

iframe-sandbox.description: The sandbox attribute for the <iframe> HTML element sets many security restrictions on the iframe, such as preventing form submissions or opening modal dialogs. Optional allow- values relax specific restrictions.

iframe-sandbox.name: Sandboxed iframes

iframe-srcdoc.description: The srcdoc attribute for the <iframe> HTML element sets a string of HTML to embed in the document. The value of srcdoc overrides loading a document from the src attribute.
iframe-srcdoc.description_html: The srcdoc attribute for the <iframe> HTML element sets a string of HTML to embed in the document. The value of srcdoc overrides loading a document from the src attribute.
iframe-srcdoc.name: srcdoc

image-function.description: The image() CSS function creates an image similar to url() but with additional functionality. It can create a solid color as an image, provide a fallback from an image URL to a solid color, or clip a sprite image using media fragments. Not to be confused with the Image() constructor.
image-function.description_html: The image() CSS function creates an image similar to url() but with additional functionality. It can create a solid color as an image, provide a fallback from an image URL to a solid color, or clip a sprite image using media fragments. Not to be confused with the Image() constructor.
image-function.name: image()

image-maps.description: The <area> and <map> elements define a clickable area on an image.
image-maps.description_html: The <area> and <map> elements define a clickable area on an image.
image-maps.name: Image maps

image-orientation.description: The image-orientation CSS property corrects the rotation of an image using the image's metadata, such as EXIF.
image-orientation.description_html: The image-orientation CSS property corrects the rotation of an image using the image's metadata, such as EXIF.
image-orientation.name: image-orientation

image-rendering.description: The image-rendering CSS property sets how images are scaled, retaining smoothness for photos, or hard edges for pixel art and QR codes.
image-rendering.description_html: The image-rendering CSS property sets how images are scaled, retaining smoothness for photos, or hard edges for pixel art and QR codes.
image-rendering.name: image-rendering

image-set.description: The image-set() CSS function provides a set of images at different resolutions or pixel densities, which the browser can pick from, depending on the device capabilities.
image-set.description_html: The image-set() CSS function provides a set of images at different resolutions or pixel densities, which the browser can pick from, depending on the device capabilities.
image-set.name: image-set()

imagebitmaprenderingcontext.description: The ImageBitmapRenderingContext API is the "bitmaprenderer" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It is commonly used to transfer frames from an OffscreenCanvas to a user-visible <canvas> element.
imagebitmaprenderingcontext.description_html: The ImageBitmapRenderingContext API is the "bitmaprenderer" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It is commonly used to transfer frames from an OffscreenCanvas to a user-visible <canvas> element.
imagebitmaprenderingcontext.name: ImageBitmapRenderingContext

ime-mode.description: The ime-mode CSS property sets the state of the input method editor for text fields.
ime-mode.description_html: The ime-mode CSS property sets the state of the input method editor for text fields.
ime-mode.name: ime-mode

img.description: The element adds an image into the document.
img.description_html: The <img> element adds an image into the document.

import.description: The @import CSS at-rule loads styles from another stylesheet.
import.description_html: The @import CSS at-rule loads styles from another stylesheet.
import.name: @import

import-assertions.description: Module import  assert { type: "json" } and import  assert { type: "css" } JavaScript statements load JSON and CSS data.
import-assertions.description_html: Module import assert { type: "json" } and import assert { type: "css" } JavaScript statements load JSON and CSS data.
import-assertions.name: Import assertions

import-maps.description: A <script type="importmap"> HTML element provides an import map as a JSON string. An import map controls how the browser should resolve module specifiers when importing JavaScript modules.
import-maps.description_html: A <script type="importmap"> HTML element provides an import map as a JSON string. An import map controls how the browser should resolve module specifiers when importing JavaScript modules.
import-maps.name: Import maps

indeterminate.description: The :indeterminate CSS pseudo-class selects any form element whose state is indeterminate, such as checkboxes that have been set to an indeterminate state with JavaScript, or radio buttons which are members of a group in which all radio buttons are unchecked.
indeterminate.description_html: The :indeterminate CSS pseudo-class selects any form element whose state is indeterminate, such as checkboxes that have been set to an indeterminate state with JavaScript, or radio buttons which are members of a group in which all radio buttons are unchecked.
indeterminate.name: :indeterminate

indexeddb.description: The IndexedDB API is a local storage transactional object database.
indexeddb.description_html: The IndexedDB API is a local storage transactional object database.
indexeddb.name: IndexedDB

individual-transforms.description: The translate, rotate, and scale CSS properties apply single transformations independently, as opposed to applying multiple transformations with the transform CSS property.
individual-transforms.description_html: The translate, rotate, and scale CSS properties apply single transformations independently, as opposed to applying multiple transformations with the transform CSS property.
individual-transforms.name: Individual transform properties

inert.description: The inert HTML attribute marks an element and its descendants as non-interactive. Inert elements don't get focus or fire click events.
inert.description_html: The inert HTML attribute marks an element and its descendants as non-interactive. Inert elements don't get focus or fire click events.
inert.name: inert

inherit-value.description: The inherit keyword resets any CSS property to the computed value of that property from the parent element.
inherit-value.description_html: The inherit keyword resets any CSS property to the computed value of that property from the parent element.
inherit-value.name: inherit

initial-letter.description: The initial-letter CSS property sets the number of lines the first letter of an element occupies. You can use the property to make a raised capital or drop cap.
initial-letter.description_html: The initial-letter CSS property sets the number of lines the first letter of an element occupies. You can use the property to make a raised capital or drop cap.
initial-letter.name: initial-letter

initial-value.description: The initial keyword resets any CSS property to its initial value as defined by the specification. For example, the initial value of the display property is inline, regardless of the element being styled. Not to be confused with revert, which resets to the user or browser default style.
initial-value.description_html: The initial keyword resets any CSS property to its initial value as defined by the specification. For example, the initial value of the display property is inline, regardless of the element being styled. Not to be confused with revert, which resets to the user or browser default style.
initial-value.name: initial

ink.description: The navigator.ink API uses the system compositor to draw to a <canvas> element ahead of pointer events, reducing the delay between moving a stylus or cursor and a pen stroke appearing on screen.
ink.description_html: The navigator.ink API uses the system compositor to draw to a <canvas> element ahead of pointer events, reducing the delay between moving a stylus or cursor and a pen stroke appearing on screen.
ink.name: Ink

input.description: The <input type="text"> HTML element allows the user to enter information into a form. By default, an <input> element is a text input.
input.description_html: The <input type="text"> HTML element allows the user to enter information into a form. By default, an <input> element is a text input.
input.name: <input>

input-button.description: The <input type="button"> HTML element represents a button that triggers some action, such as submitting a form or opening a dialog, styled as a labeled rectangular box by default. Not to be confused with the <button> element, which contains HTML content.
input-button.description_html: The <input type="button"> HTML element represents a button that triggers some action, such as submitting a form or opening a dialog, styled as a labeled rectangular box by default. Not to be confused with the <button> element, which contains HTML content.
input-button.name: <input type="button">

input-checkbox.description: The <input type="checkbox"> HTML element represents a tickable box with two states, checked and unchecked.
input-checkbox.description_html: The <input type="checkbox"> HTML element represents a tickable box with two states, checked and unchecked.
input-checkbox.name: <input type="checkbox">

input-color.description: The <input type="color"> HTML element shows a color picker from which users can choose a color value.
input-color.description_html: The <input type="color"> HTML element shows a color picker from which users can choose a color value.
input-color.name: <input type="color">

input-date-time.description: The <input type="date"> and <input type="time"> HTML elements show date and time pickers.
input-date-time.description_html: The <input type="date"> and <input type="time"> HTML elements show date and time pickers.
input-date-time.name: Date and time <input> types

input-email-tel-url.description: The <input type="email">, <input type="tel">, and <input type="url"> HTML elements represent email address, telephone number, and URL fields in a form.
input-email-tel-url.description_html: The <input type="email">, <input type="tel">, and <input type="url"> HTML elements represent email address, telephone number, and URL fields in a form.
input-email-tel-url.name: Email, telephone, and URL <input> types

input-event.description: The input event fires when a form control changes or an element with the contenteditable attribute changes.
input-event.description_html: The input event fires when a form control changes or an element with the contenteditable attribute changes.
input-event.name: input (event)

input-file.description: The <input type="file"> HTML element shows a file picker from which users can choose a file to upload with the form.
input-file.description_html: The <input type="file"> HTML element shows a file picker from which users can choose a file to upload with the form.
input-file.name: <input type="file">

input-hidden.description: The <input type="hidden"> HTML element represents a form field that is not shown visually but is still included in the form submission.
input-hidden.description_html: The <input type="hidden"> HTML element represents a form field that is not shown visually but is still included in the form submission.
input-hidden.name: <input type="hidden">

input-image.description: The <input type="image"> HTML element is an image that can be used to submit a form, like the <input type="submit"> element.
input-image.description_html: The <input type="image"> HTML element is an image that can be used to submit a form, like the <input type="submit"> element.
input-image.name: <input type="image">

input-number.description: The <input type="number"> HTML element represents numeric input data.
input-number.description_html: The <input type="number"> HTML element represents numeric input data.
input-number.name: <input type="number">

input-password.description: The <input type="password"> HTML element represents a field for users to enter a password. The password is hidden from view, typically replaced by dots or asterisks.
input-password.description_html: The <input type="password"> HTML element represents a field for users to enter a password. The password is hidden from view, typically replaced by dots or asterisks.
input-password.name: <input type="password">

input-radio.description: The <input type="radio"> HTML element represents one button in a group such that only one can be chosen at a time.
input-radio.description_html: The <input type="radio"> HTML element represents one button in a group such that only one can be chosen at a time.
input-radio.name: <input type="radio">

input-range.description: The <input type="range"> element represents a slider for choosing an inexact value between a minimum and maximum value.
input-range.description_html: The <input type="range"> element represents a slider for choosing an inexact value between a minimum and maximum value.
input-range.name: <input type="range">

input-reset.description: The <input type="reset"> HTML element represents a button that sets all form fields to their initial values.
input-reset.description_html: The <input type="reset"> HTML element represents a button that sets all form fields to their initial values.
input-reset.name: <input type="reset">

input-selectors.description: The :checked, :disabled, and :enabled CSS pseudo-classes match form elements based on their state.
input-selectors.description_html: The :checked, :disabled, and :enabled CSS pseudo-classes match form elements based on their state.
input-selectors.name: Input selectors

input-submit.description: The <input type="submit"> HTML element represents a button that triggers an action on its associated <form>, such as sending the form data to a server.
input-submit.description_html: The <input type="submit"> HTML element represents a button that triggers an action on its associated <form>, such as sending the form data to a server.
input-submit.name: <input type="submit">

inputmode.description: The inputmode global HTML attribute gives a hint about what type of data is to be entered into an <input> element, such as text, numeric, or email, so the browser may help the user enter data using an adapted input mechanism, such as an on-screen virtual keyboard.
inputmode.description_html: The inputmode global HTML attribute gives a hint about what type of data is to be entered into an <input> element, such as text, numeric, or email, so the browser may help the user enter data using an adapted input mechanism, such as an on-screen virtual keyboard.
inputmode.name: inputmode

ins.description: The <ins> element element represents a range of text that has been inserted into a document, styling text as underlined by default.
ins.description_html: The <ins> element element represents a range of text that has been inserted into a document, styling text as underlined by default.
ins.name: <ins>

insertable-streams.description: The MediaStreamTrackProcessor and MediaStreamTrackGenerator APIs modify the contents of a media track for merging streams, applying real-time effects like funny hats, and content overlays.
insertable-streams.description_html: The MediaStreamTrackProcessor and MediaStreamTrackGenerator APIs modify the contents of a media track for merging streams, applying real-time effects like funny hats, and content overlays.
insertable-streams.name: Insertable streams for MediaStreamTrack

interaction.description: The pointer, any-pointer, hover, and any-hover CSS media queries set styles based on the presence of pointing devices and their ability to hover over elements. For example, most smartphones match the (hover: none) and (pointer: coarse) media query.
interaction.description_html: The pointer, any-pointer, hover, and any-hover CSS media queries set styles based on the presence of pointing devices and their ability to hover over elements. For example, most smartphones match the (hover: none) and (pointer: coarse) media query.
interaction.name: Interaction media queries

interactivity.description: The interactivity: inert CSS declaration makes an element and its descendants inert, like when using the inert HTML attribute. Inert elements can't be focused or clicked, their text can't be selected or found using the browser's find-in-page feature.
interactivity.description_html: The interactivity: inert CSS declaration makes an element and its descendants inert, like when using the inert HTML attribute. Inert elements can't be focused or clicked, their text can't be selected or found using the browser's find-in-page feature.
interactivity.name: interactivity

interpolate-size.description: The interpolate-size CSS property sets whether animations and transitions interpolate between a numeric value and a keyword value, such as from a fixed length to auto or fit-content.
interpolate-size.description_html: The interpolate-size CSS property sets whether animations and transitions interpolate between a numeric value and a keyword value, such as from a fixed length to auto or fit-content.
interpolate-size.name: interpolate-size

intersection-observer.description: The IntersectionObserver API asynchronously observes changes in the intersection of a target element with an ancestor element or with a top-level document's viewport.
intersection-observer.description_html: The IntersectionObserver API asynchronously observes changes in the intersection of a target element with an ancestor element or with a top-level document's viewport.
intersection-observer.name: Intersection observer

intersection-observer-v2.description: The trackVisibility parameter for the IntersectionObserver constructor enables tracking the visibility of an element, to detect if it may be obscured by other content or visual effects. Also known as IntersectionObserver v2.
intersection-observer-v2.description_html: The trackVisibility parameter for the IntersectionObserver constructor enables tracking the visibility of an element, to detect if it may be obscured by other content or visual effects. Also known as IntersectionObserver v2.
intersection-observer-v2.name: Intersection observer visibility tracking

intl.description: The Intl API provides language sensitive string comparison, number formatting, date and time formatting, and more.
intl.description_html: The Intl API provides language sensitive string comparison, number formatting, date and time formatting, and more.
intl.name: Intl

intl-display-names.description: The Intl.DisplayNames API provides localized names of language, region, script, and currency codes.
intl-display-names.description_html: The Intl.DisplayNames API provides localized names of language, region, script, and currency codes.
intl-display-names.name: Intl.DisplayNames

intl-duration-format.description: The Intl.DurationFormat API creates a locale-aware formatter that turns an object representing a duration (such as days, hours, and minutes) into a string.
intl-duration-format.description_html: The Intl.DurationFormat API creates a locale-aware formatter that turns an object representing a duration (such as days, hours, and minutes) into a string.
intl-duration-format.name: Intl.DurationFormat

intl-list-format.description: The Intl.ListFormat API creates a locale-aware formatter that turns iterable objects into localized strings.
