intl-list-format.description_html: The Intl.ListFormat API creates a locale-aware formatter that turns iterable objects into localized strings.
intl-list-format.name: Intl.ListFormat

intl-locale.description: The Intl.Locale API parses Unicode locale identifiers, with language, region, and script codes, such as zh-Hans-CN or en-GB.
intl-locale.description_html: The Intl.Locale API parses Unicode locale identifiers, with language, region, and script codes, such as zh-Hans-CN or en-GB.
intl-locale.name: Intl.Locale

intl-locale-info.description: The getter methods of the Intl.Locale API provide supplemental information about a Unicode locale, such as the locale's calendar (for example, the first day in a week or the weekend start day), writing direction, 12- or 24-hour cycles, and numbering system.
intl-locale-info.description_html: The getter methods of the Intl.Locale API provide supplemental information about a Unicode locale, such as the locale's calendar (for example, the first day in a week or the weekend start day), writing direction, 12- or 24-hour cycles, and numbering system.
intl-locale-info.name: Intl.Locale info

intl-plural-rules.description: The Intl.PluralRules API creates a locale-aware object that tells you which of the language's pluralization rules apply based on a given number.
intl-plural-rules.description_html: The Intl.PluralRules API creates a locale-aware object that tells you which of the language's pluralization rules apply based on a given number.
intl-plural-rules.name: Intl.PluralRules

intl-relative-time-format.description: The Intl.RelativeTimeFormat API creates a locale-aware formatter that turns an object representing a relative time (such as '1 day ago') into a localized string.
intl-relative-time-format.description_html: The Intl.RelativeTimeFormat API creates a locale-aware formatter that turns an object representing a relative time (such as '1 day ago') into a localized string.
intl-relative-time-format.name: Intl.RelativeTimeFormat

intl-segmenter.description: The Intl.Segmenter API creates a locale-aware text splitter that can separate a string into meaningful graphemes, words, or sentences.
intl-segmenter.description_html: The Intl.Segmenter API creates a locale-aware text splitter that can separate a string into meaningful graphemes, words, or sentences.
intl-segmenter.name: Intl.Segmenter

inverted-colors.description: The inverted-colors CSS media query sets styles based on whether the user has inverted all colors, such as with mobile accessibility settings.
inverted-colors.description_html: The inverted-colors CSS media query sets styles based on whether the user has inverted all colors, such as with mobile accessibility settings.
inverted-colors.name: inverted-colors media query

invoker-commands.description: The command and commandfor attributes for the <button> HTML element dispatch an action to an element when the button is invoked (by click or keystroke), as a declarative alternative to addEventListener() calls or onclick attribute handlers.
invoker-commands.description_html: The command and commandfor attributes for the <button> HTML element dispatch an action to an element when the button is invoked (by click or keystroke), as a declarative alternative to addEventListener() calls or onclick attribute handlers.
invoker-commands.name: Invoker commands

is.description: The :is() CSS functional pseudo-class takes a selector list as its argument, and matches any element that can be selected by one of the selectors in that list.
is.description_html: The :is() CSS functional pseudo-class takes a selector list as its argument, and matches any element that can be selected by one of the selectors in that list.
is.name: :is()

is-error.description: The Error.isError() static method checks whether a value is an Error object.
is-error.description_html: The Error.isError() static method checks whether a value is an Error object.
is-error.name: Error.isError()

is-input-pending.description: The navigator.scheduling.isInputPending() method checks if there are pending input events, such as touch or mouse events. This allows you to yield from long-running scripts that might be blocking user interaction.
is-input-pending.description_html: The navigator.scheduling.isInputPending() method checks if there are pending input events, such as touch or mouse events. This allows you to yield from long-running scripts that might be blocking user interaction.
is-input-pending.name: isInputPending()

is-secure-context.description: The isSecureContext global property is a boolean for whether the current browsing context is secure. This is primarily a check that the page has been served over an HTTPS URL.
is-secure-context.description_html: The isSecureContext global property is a boolean for whether the current browsing context is secure. This is primarily a check that the page has been served over an HTTPS URL.
is-secure-context.name: isSecureContext

isolation.description: The isolation CSS property creates a new stacking context, which impacts z-index ordering and blend modes.
isolation.description_html: The isolation CSS property creates a new stacking context, which impacts z-index ordering and blend modes.
isolation.name: isolation

iterator-methods.description: The Iterator object is an abstract base for objects that implement the iterator protocol. It provides methods common to built-in iterators, such as filter(), find(), map(), and reduce(). You can also use the static method Iterator.from() to convert an existing iterable into an Iterator.
iterator-methods.description_html: The Iterator object is an abstract base for objects that implement the iterator protocol. It provides methods common to built-in iterators, such as filter(), find(), map(), and reduce(). You can also use the static method Iterator.from() to convert an existing iterable into an Iterator.
iterator-methods.name: Iterator methods

iterators.description: The for...of loop operates on a sequence of values sourced from an iterable object, such as arrays, array-like objects, DOM collections, iterators, generators, and user-defined iterables. All built-in iterators inherit from the Iterator class.
iterators.description_html: The for...of loop operates on a sequence of values sourced from an iterable object, such as arrays, array-like objects, DOM collections, iterators, generators, and user-defined iterables. All built-in iterators inherit from the Iterator class.
iterators.name: Iterators and the for...of loop

javascript.description: JavaScript is a programming language that runs in browsers, usually through the <script> element. JavaScript has changed over many years. This feature represents the oldest language features, such as built-in objects, statements, and operators. Also known as ECMAScript.
javascript.description_html: JavaScript is a programming language that runs in browsers, usually through the <script> element. JavaScript has changed over many years. This feature represents the oldest language features, such as built-in objects, statements, and operators. Also known as ECMAScript.
javascript.name: JavaScript (initial core language support)

jpegxl.description: The JPEG XL image format is a raster graphics file format that supports animation, alpha transparency, and lossy as well as lossless compression.
jpegxl.description_html: The JPEG XL image format is a raster graphics file format that supports animation, alpha transparency, and lossy as well as lossless compression.
jpegxl.name: JPEG XL

js-modules.description: JavaScript modules allow code to be organized into reusable units. Modules use import to load other modules and export to declare what is available to import from other modules. In HTML, modules are loaded with <script type="module">.
js-modules.description_html: JavaScript modules allow code to be organized into reusable units. Modules use import to load other modules and export to declare what is available to import from other modules. In HTML, modules are loaded with <script type="module">.
js-modules.name: JavaScript modules

js-modules-service-workers.description: The navigator.serviceWorker.register() method accepts { type: "module" } to load scripts that use import and export. Also known as ECMAScript modules or ESM in service workers.
js-modules-service-workers.description_html: The navigator.serviceWorker.register() method accepts { type: "module" } to load scripts that use import and export. Also known as ECMAScript modules or ESM in service workers.
js-modules-service-workers.name: JavaScript modules in service workers

js-modules-shared-workers.description: The SharedWorker() constructor accepts { type: "module" } to load scripts that use import and export. Also known as ECMAScript modules or ESM in shared workers.
js-modules-shared-workers.description_html: The SharedWorker() constructor accepts { type: "module" } to load scripts that use import and export. Also known as ECMAScript modules or ESM in shared workers.
js-modules-shared-workers.name: JavaScript modules in shared workers

js-modules-workers.description: The Worker() constructor accepts { type: "module" } to load scripts that use import and export. Also known as ECMAScript modules or ESM in workers.
js-modules-workers.description_html: The Worker() constructor accepts { type: "module" } to load scripts that use import and export. Also known as ECMAScript modules or ESM in workers.
js-modules-workers.name: JavaScript modules in workers

json.description: The JSON API provides static methods for parsing values from and converting values to JavaScript Object Notation (JSON), a serialization format for objects, arrays, numbers, strings, Boolean values, and null.
json.description_html: The JSON API provides static methods for parsing values from and converting values to JavaScript Object Notation (JSON), a serialization format for objects, arrays, numbers, strings, Boolean values, and null.
json.name: JSON

json-modules.description: Module import  with { type: "json" } statements load JSON data. Also known as JSON module scripts.
json-modules.description_html: Module import with { type: "json" } statements load JSON data. Also known as JSON module scripts.
json-modules.name: JSON import attributes

json-raw.description: To serialize and parse JSON in a lossless way, JSON.stringify() handles rawJSON values and JSON.parse()'s reviver callback takes a source context parameter.
json-raw.description_html: To serialize and parse JSON in a lossless way, JSON.stringify() handles rawJSON values and JSON.parse()'s reviver callback takes a source context parameter.
json-raw.name: JSON source text access

kbd.description: The <kbd> element represents textual user input, such as keyboard or voice input, styling text in monospaced type by default.
kbd.description_html: The <kbd> element represents textual user input, such as keyboard or voice input, styling text in monospaced type by default.
kbd.name: <kbd>

keyboard-events.description: The keydown and keyup events fire for each key press (or, with modifier keys, a combination of key presses) on a keyboard.
keyboard-events.description_html: The keydown and keyup events fire for each key press (or, with modifier keys, a combination of key presses) on a keyboard.
keyboard-events.name: Keyboard events

keyboard-lock.description: The navigator.keyboard.lock() API allows you to capture keys that are normally reserved by the operating system. It can be used to provide an immersive fullscreen experience such as games.
keyboard-lock.description_html: The navigator.keyboard.lock() API allows you to capture keys that are normally reserved by the operating system. It can be used to provide an immersive fullscreen experience such as games.
keyboard-lock.name: Keyboard lock

keyboard-map.description: The navigator.keyboard.getLayoutMap() API returns a map from key codes to human readable key names. It can be used to describe buttons to the user when using the keyboard as a set of buttons, such as in games.
keyboard-map.description_html: The navigator.keyboard.getLayoutMap() API returns a map from key codes to human readable key names. It can be used to describe buttons to the user when using the keyboard as a set of buttons, such as in games.
keyboard-map.name: Keyboard map

khr-parallel-shader-compile.description: The KHR_parallel_shader_compile extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts checks the status of shader compilation without blocking the runtime.
khr-parallel-shader-compile.description_html: The KHR_parallel_shader_compile extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts checks the status of shader compilation without blocking the runtime.
khr-parallel-shader-compile.name: KHR_parallel_shader_compile WebGL extension

lab.description: The CIE Lab color space expresses colors in terms of lightness and how red/green and blue/yellow a color is. LCH is a variant of Lab with polar coordinates. These color spaces can be used with the CSS color(), lab(), and lch() functions. Also known as CIELAB and CIELCH.
lab.description_html: The CIE Lab color space expresses colors in terms of lightness and how red/green and blue/yellow a color is. LCH is a variant of Lab with polar coordinates. These color spaces can be used with the CSS color(), lab(), and lch() functions. Also known as CIELAB and CIELCH.
lab.name: Lab and LCH

label.description: The <label> HTML element represents a caption for a form field.
label.description_html: The <label> HTML element represents a caption for a form field.
label.name: <label>

lang.description: The :lang() CSS functional pseudo-class matches elements based on their content language.
lang.description_html: The :lang() CSS functional pseudo-class matches elements based on their content language.
lang.name: :lang()

lang-attr.description: The lang global HTML attribute defines the language of an element. It's used by assistive technology to correctly read the content, translation tools to select the origin language, and other applications.
lang-attr.description_html: The lang global HTML attribute defines the language of an element. It's used by assistive technology to correctly read the content, translation tools to select the origin language, and other applications.
lang-attr.name: lang

language.description: The navigator.language property is a string representing the preferred language of the user, usually the language of the browser UI. The navigator.languages property is an array of strings representing the user's preferred languages.
language.description_html: The navigator.language property is a string representing the preferred language of the user, usually the language of the browser UI. The navigator.languages property is an array of strings representing the user's preferred languages.
language.name: Language

largest-contentful-paint.description: The largest-contentful-paint performance entry and the LargestContentfulPaint API measures  the time it takes for the largest image or text to appear. Largest contentful paint (LCP) is a common metric for perceived loading times.
largest-contentful-paint.description_html: The largest-contentful-paint performance entry and the LargestContentfulPaint API measures the time it takes for the largest image or text to appear. Largest contentful paint (LCP) is a common metric for perceived loading times.
largest-contentful-paint.name: Largest contentful paint (LCP)

layout-direction-override.description: The unicode-bidi and direction CSS properties override the Unicode layout algorithm. They are intended for Document Type Definition (DTD) designers. For HTML documents, you should use the dir global HTML attribute and <bdo> HTML element instead.
layout-direction-override.description_html: The unicode-bidi and direction CSS properties override the Unicode layout algorithm. They are intended for Document Type Definition (DTD) designers. For HTML documents, you should use the dir global HTML attribute and <bdo> HTML element instead.
layout-direction-override.name: Layout direction override

layout-instability.description: The layout-shift performance entry and LayoutShift API measures the layout stability of web pages based on movements of the elements on the page.
layout-instability.description_html: The layout-shift performance entry and LayoutShift API measures the layout stability of web pages based on movements of the elements on the page.
layout-instability.name: Layout instability

let-const.description: The let and const declarations define block-scoped variables.
let-const.description_html: The let and const declarations define block-scoped variables.
let-const.name: Let and const

letter-spacing.description: The letter-spacing CSS property controls the amount of space between each letter in an element or block of text.
letter-spacing.description_html: The letter-spacing CSS property controls the amount of space between each letter in an element or block of text.
letter-spacing.name: letter-spacing

lh.description: The lh CSS length unit corresponds to the requested line height, the computed value of the line-height property. Some lines may be higher than this based on their content.
lh.description_html: The lh CSS length unit corresponds to the requested line height, the computed value of the line-height property. Some lines may be higher than this based on their content.
lh.name: lh unit

light-dark.description: The light-dark() CSS function accepts two colors and uses one depending on the current color scheme.
light-dark.description_html: The light-dark() CSS function accepts two colors and uses one depending on the current color scheme.
light-dark.name: light-dark()

line-break.description: The line-break CSS property sets how strictly to apply rules for wrapping text to new lines, especially for symbols and punctuation.
line-break.description_html: The line-break CSS property sets how strictly to apply rules for wrapping text to new lines, especially for symbols and punctuation.
line-break.name: line-break

line-clamp.description: The line-clamp CSS property limits the text in a block container to a certain number of lines. The prefixed -webkit-line-clamp is widely supported but only works with -webkit-box-orient: vertical in combination with display: -webkit-box or display: -webkit-inline-box.
line-clamp.description_html: The line-clamp CSS property limits the text in a block container to a certain number of lines. The prefixed -webkit-line-clamp is widely supported but only works with -webkit-box-orient: vertical in combination with display: -webkit-box or display: -webkit-inline-box.
line-clamp.name: line-clamp

line-height.description: The line-height CSS property sets the spacing between text baselines, oriented to the horizontal or vertical writing mode.
line-height.description_html: The line-height CSS property sets the spacing between text baselines, oriented to the horizontal or vertical writing mode.
line-height.name: line-height

linear-easing.description: The linear() easing function for animations and transitions interpolates linearly between the control points, and can be used to approximate complex easing functions, such as a bounce effect.
linear-easing.description_html: The linear() easing function for animations and transitions interpolates linearly between the control points, and can be used to approximate complex easing functions, such as a bounce effect.
linear-easing.name: linear() easing

link.description: The <link> element creates a relationship between the current document and an external resource, such as a stylesheet or favicon.
link.description_html: The <link> element creates a relationship between the current document and an external resource, such as a stylesheet or favicon.
link.name: <link>

link-rel-dns-prefetch.description: The rel="dns-prefetch" attribute for the <link> HTML element is a hint to the browser that the page or user is likely to request resources from another domain, so the browser should preemptively resolve DNS for the href value's domain.
link-rel-dns-prefetch.description_html: The rel="dns-prefetch" attribute for the <link> HTML element is a hint to the browser that the page or user is likely to request resources from another domain, so the browser should preemptively resolve DNS for the href value's domain.
link-rel-dns-prefetch.name: <link rel="dns-prefetch">

link-rel-expect.description: The rel="expect" attribute for the <link> HTML element is a hint to the browser to block rendering until the element that the href value references is connected to the document and fully parsed.
link-rel-expect.description_html: The rel="expect" attribute for the <link> HTML element is a hint to the browser to block rendering until the element that the href value references is connected to the document and fully parsed.
link-rel-expect.name: <link rel="expect">

link-rel-preconnect.description: The rel="preconnect" attribute for the <link> HTML element is a hint to the browser that the page or user is likely to request resources from another origin, so the browser should preemptively start a connection to the href value's origin.
link-rel-preconnect.description_html: The rel="preconnect" attribute for the <link> HTML element is a hint to the browser that the page or user is likely to request resources from another origin, so the browser should preemptively start a connection to the href value's origin.
link-rel-preconnect.name: <link rel="preconnect">

link-rel-prefetch.description: The rel="prefetch" attribute for the <link> HTML element is a hint to the browser that the user is likely to navigate to a resource, so the browser should preemptively fetch and cache the resource.
link-rel-prefetch.description_html: The rel="prefetch" attribute for the <link> HTML element is a hint to the browser that the user is likely to navigate to a resource, so the browser should preemptively fetch and cache the resource.
link-rel-prefetch.name: <link rel="prefetch">

link-rel-preload.description: The rel="preload" attribute for the <link> HTML element requests resources, such as images or style sheets, that the page needs soon, so the browser may prioritize them for loading before rendering begins.
link-rel-preload.description_html: The rel="preload" attribute for the <link> HTML element requests resources, such as images or style sheets, that the page needs soon, so the browser may prioritize them for loading before rendering begins.
link-rel-preload.name: <link rel="preload">

link-selectors.description: The :link CSS pseudo-class matches unvisited links, :visited matches visited links, and :any-link matches both.
link-selectors.description_html: The :link CSS pseudo-class matches unvisited links, :visited matches visited links, and :any-link matches both.
link-selectors.name: Link selectors

list-elements.description: The <ol>, <ul>, and <li> HTML elements represent ordered and unordered lists.
list-elements.description_html: The <ol>, <ul>, and <li> HTML elements represent ordered and unordered lists.
list-elements.name: <ol>, <ul>, and <li>

list-style.description: The list-style shorthand CSS property and the list-style-image, list-style-position, and list-style-type longhand properties set the position and appearance of a list item's marker.
list-style.description_html: The list-style shorthand CSS property and the list-style-image, list-style-position, and list-style-type longhand properties set the position and appearance of a list item's marker.
list-style.name: List style

loading-lazy.description: The loading="lazy" attribute for and
loading-lazy.description_html: The loading="lazy" attribute for <img> and <iframe> elements blocks loading the external resource until the user scrolls to that element's part of the page.
loading-lazy.name: Lazy-loading images and iframes

local-fonts.description: The window.queryLocalFonts() method returns an array of locally-installed fonts, each represented by a FontData object.
local-fonts.description_html: The window.queryLocalFonts() method returns an array of locally-installed fonts, each represented by a FontData object.
local-fonts.name: Local fonts

local-network-access.description: The "local-network-access" user permission (and certain actions that imply this permission, such as a fetch() request with { targetAddressSpace: "local" }) allows a site to send requests to servers on a user's local network.
local-network-access.description_html: The "local-network-access" user permission (and certain actions that imply this permission, such as a fetch() request with { targetAddressSpace: "local" }) allows a site to send requests to servers on a user's local network.
local-network-access.name: Local network access

localstorage.description: The localStorage and sessionStorage APIs store data as key-value pairs. While localStorage persists across sessions, sessionStorage data is discarded when the page is closed.
localstorage.description_html: The localStorage and sessionStorage APIs store data as key-value pairs. While localStorage persists across sessions, sessionStorage data is discarded when the page is closed.
localstorage.name: localStorage and sessionStorage

location.description: The location global object represents the current page's address. You can use it to get the parts of the address (such as location.hostname or location.pathname) or navigate to another URL.
location.description_html: The location global object represents the current page's address. You can use it to get the parts of the address (such as location.hostname or location.pathname) or navigate to another URL.
location.name: Location

logical-assignments.description: The logical AND assignment (&&=) and the logical OR assignment (||=) operators short-circuit the respective binary logical operators.
logical-assignments.description_html: The logical AND assignment (&&=) and the logical OR assignment (||=) operators short-circuit the respective binary logical operators.
logical-assignments.name: Logical assignments

logical-properties.description: CSS logical properties control borders, size, margin, and padding with directions and dimensions relative to the writing mode. For example, in a left to right, top to bottom writing mode, block-end refers to the bottom. Also known as flow relative.
logical-properties.description_html: CSS logical properties control borders, size, margin, and padding with directions and dimensions relative to the writing mode. For example, in a left to right, top to bottom writing mode, block-end refers to the bottom. Also known as flow relative.
logical-properties.name: Logical properties

long-animation-frames.description: The long-animation-frame performance event type and the PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTiming API provide information about rendering updates that take longer than 50 milliseconds. Also known as LoAFs.
long-animation-frames.description_html: The long-animation-frame performance event type and the PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTiming API provide information about rendering updates that take longer than 50 milliseconds. Also known as LoAFs.
long-animation-frames.name: Long animation frames

longtasks.description: The longtask performance event type and the PerformanceLongTaskTiming API provides information about tasks that occupy the UI thread for 50 milliseconds or more, a metric for input latency, delayed animations, and other sources of "jank."
longtasks.description_html: The longtask performance event type and the PerformanceLongTaskTiming API provides information about tasks that occupy the UI thread for 50 milliseconds or more, a metric for input latency, delayed animations, and other sources of "jank."
longtasks.name: Long tasks

magnetometer.description: The Magnetometer API reads magnetic field sensor data from the device's magnetometer.
magnetometer.description_html: The Magnetometer API reads magnetic field sensor data from the device's magnetometer.
magnetometer.name: Magnetometer

main.description: The <main> element represents the dominant content of a document. It is commonly used together with <header> and <footer>.
main.description_html: The <main> element represents the dominant content of a document. It is commonly used together with <header> and <footer>.
main.name: <main>

managed-media-source.description: The ManagedMediaSource API is a MediaSource where the browser manages the memory of source buffers and may evict data if needed.
managed-media-source.description_html: The ManagedMediaSource API is a MediaSource where the browser manages the memory of source buffers and may evict data if needed.
managed-media-source.name: Managed media source

manifest.description: A web app manifest file provides metadata about the site. The browser can use the metadata to install the site as a standalone application on the user's device. The metadata usually includes the app's name, icon, description, and ways in which the app wishes to integrate with the device.
manifest.description_html: A web app manifest file provides metadata about the site. The browser can use the metadata to install the site as a standalone application on the user's device. The metadata usually includes the app's name, icon, description, and ways in which the app wishes to integrate with the device.
manifest.name: Web app manifest

map.description: Map objects hold key-value pairs and remember the original insertion order of the keys.
map.description_html: Map objects hold key-value pairs and remember the original insertion order of the keys.
map.name: Map (initial support)

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets space around an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.
margin.description_html: The margin CSS property sets space around an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.
margin.name: margin

margin-trim.description: The margin-trim CSS property removes the margins of child elements when they meet the edges of the container.
margin-trim.description_html: The margin-trim CSS property removes the margins of child elements when they meet the edges of the container.
margin-trim.name: margin-trim

mark.description: The <mark> element represents text which is marked or highlighted for reference or notation purposes.
mark.description_html: The <mark> element represents text which is marked or highlighted for reference or notation purposes.
mark.name: <mark>

marker.description: The ::marker CSS pseudo-element selects list item markers for styling numbers or bullets.
marker.description_html: The ::marker CSS pseudo-element selects list item markers for styling numbers or bullets.
marker.name: ::marker

mask-border.description: The mask-border CSS property sets how the edges of an element are masked. It is a shorthand for mask-border-outset, mask-border-repeat, mask-border-slice, mask-border-source, and mask-border-width.
mask-border.description_html: The mask-border CSS property sets how the edges of an element are masked. It is a shorthand for mask-border-outset, mask-border-repeat, mask-border-slice, mask-border-source, and mask-border-width.
mask-border.name: mask-border

mask-type.description: The mask-type CSS property on an SVG <mask> element sets whether the mask is a luminance or alpha mask.
mask-type.description_html: The mask-type CSS property on an SVG <mask> element sets whether the mask is a luminance or alpha mask.
mask-type.name: mask-type

masks.description: The mask CSS property (and several longhand properties) partially or completely hides an element according to the shape and depth of an image.
masks.description_html: The mask CSS property (and several longhand properties) partially or completely hides an element according to the shape and depth of an image.
masks.name: Masks

masonry.description: Masonry is a type of CSS grid layout where the items on one of the axes are tightly packed together, like brickwork, instead of leaving gaps to align across the other axis.
masonry.description_html: Masonry is a type of CSS grid layout where the items on one of the axes are tightly packed together, like brickwork, instead of leaving gaps to align across the other axis.
masonry.name: Masonry

matchmedia.description: The window.matchMedia() method checks whether a media query applies to the document.
matchmedia.description_html: The window.matchMedia() method checks whether a media query applies to the document.
matchmedia.name: matchMedia

math-sum-precise.description: The Math.sumPrecise() static method returns the sum of an iterable of numbers. It avoids the precision loss of intermediate partial sums, as found using reduce() or a loop to add together an array of values.
math-sum-precise.description_html: The Math.sumPrecise() static method returns the sum of an iterable of numbers. It avoids the precision loss of intermediate partial sums, as found using reduce() or a loop to add together an array of values.
math-sum-precise.name: Math.sumPrecise()

mathml.description: MathML, or the Mathematical Markup Language, describes mathematical notation, such as expressions and formulas. Also known as MathML Core.
mathml.description_html: MathML, or the Mathematical Markup Language, describes mathematical notation, such as expressions and formulas. Also known as MathML Core.
mathml.name: MathML

measure-memory.description: The measureUserAgentSpecificMemory() method estimates the memory usage of a web application including all its iframes and workers.
measure-memory.description_html: The measureUserAgentSpecificMemory() method estimates the memory usage of a web application including all its iframes and workers.
measure-memory.name: Memory measurement

media-capabilities.description: The navigator.mediaCapabilities API queries the encoding and decoding abilities of the device, such as supported codecs, resolutions, and bitrates.
media-capabilities.description_html: The navigator.mediaCapabilities API queries the encoding and decoding abilities of the device, such as supported codecs, resolutions, and bitrates.
media-capabilities.name: Media capabilities

media-capture.description: The navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia() API requests access to devices that produce audio or video streams, such as microphones or video cameras.
media-capture.description_html: The navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia() API requests access to devices that produce audio or video streams, such as microphones or video cameras.
media-capture.name: Media capture

media-playback-quality.description: The getVideoPlaybackQuality() method of HTMLVideoElement returns metrics that can be used to determine the playback quality of a video, such as how many frames were dropped.
media-playback-quality.description_html: The getVideoPlaybackQuality() method of HTMLVideoElement returns metrics that can be used to determine the playback quality of a video, such as how many frames were dropped.
media-playback-quality.name: Media playback quality

media-pseudos.description: The :playing, :paused, :seeking, :buffering, :stalled, :muted, and :volume-locked CSS pseudo-classes match <audio> and <video> elements based on their state.
media-pseudos.description_html: The :playing, :paused, :seeking, :buffering, :stalled, :muted, and :volume-locked CSS pseudo-classes match <audio> and <video> elements based on their state.
media-pseudos.name: Media element pseudo-classes

media-queries.description: The @media CSS rule conditionally applies styles based on the output device type, its capabilities, and the user's preferences. Media queries are composed of an optional media type such as screen or print, and one or more mandatory media features, such as prefers-reduced-animations.
media-queries.description_html: The @media CSS rule conditionally applies styles based on the output device type, its capabilities, and the user's preferences. Media queries are composed of an optional media type such as screen or print, and one or more mandatory media features, such as prefers-reduced-animations.
media-queries.name: Media queries

media-query-range-syntax.description: The range syntax of CSS media queries allows you to use mathematical comparison operators such as <, >, <=, and >= to define a range of values for a media query. For example, (400px < width < 1000px) returns true if the viewport width is between 400px and 1000px.
media-query-range-syntax.description_html: The range syntax of CSS media queries allows you to use mathematical comparison operators such as <, >, <=, and >= to define a range of values for a media query. For example, (400px < width < 1000px) returns true if the viewport width is between 400px and 1000px.
media-query-range-syntax.name: Media query range syntax

media-session.description: The navigator.mediaSession API integrates with platform UI for media playback. It can be used to set metadata such as title and artwork, and to handle user actions like playing, pausing, or seeking.
media-session.description_html: The navigator.mediaSession API integrates with platform UI for media playback. It can be used to set metadata such as title and artwork, and to handle user actions like playing, pausing, or seeking.
media-session.name: Media session

media-source.description: The MediaSource API is a custom data source for media elements commonly used for adaptive streaming. Also known as Media Source Extensions (MSE).
media-source.description_html: The MediaSource API is a custom data source for media elements commonly used for adaptive streaming. Also known as Media Source Extensions (MSE).
media-source.name: Media source

mediacontroller.description: The playback of multiple <video> or <audio> elements can be coordinated by a MediaController instance, for example to synchronize a sign-language interpreter track with the main video track.
mediacontroller.description_html: The playback of multiple <video> or <audio> elements can be coordinated by a MediaController instance, for example to synchronize a sign-language interpreter track with the main video track.
mediacontroller.name: MediaController

mediastream-recording.description: The MediaRecorder API captures data generated by MediaStream or HTMLMediaElement objects for analysis, processing, or saving to disk. Also known as the Media Recording API.
mediastream-recording.description_html: The MediaRecorder API captures data generated by MediaStream or HTMLMediaElement objects for analysis, processing, or saving to disk. Also known as the Media Recording API.
mediastream-recording.name: MediaStream recording

menu.description: The <menu> element represents an unordered list of action items (<li>), such as a toolbar. It is a semantic alternative to the <ul> element.
menu.description_html: The <menu> element represents an unordered list of action items (<li>), such as a toolbar. It is a semantic alternative to the <ul> element.
menu.name: <menu>

messageerror.description: The messageerror event fires on a target, such as a window or worker, when an incoming message cannot be deserialized. This event can fire for many types of messages, such as cross-document messages or broadcast channel messages.
messageerror.description_html: The messageerror event fires on a target, such as a window or worker, when an incoming message cannot be deserialized. This event can fire for many types of messages, such as cross-document messages or broadcast channel messages.
messageerror.name: messageerror

meta.description: The <meta> element represents metadata about the page used by the browser or search engines, including description, keywords, and character sets.
meta.description_html: The <meta> element represents metadata about the page used by the browser or search engines, including description, keywords, and character sets.
meta.name: <meta>

meta-application-title.description: The name="application-title" attribute for the <meta> HTML element sets an installed web application's title bar text.
meta-application-title.description_html: The name="application-title" attribute for the <meta> HTML element sets an installed web application's title bar text.
meta-application-title.name: <meta name="application-title">

meta-theme-color.description: The name="theme-color" attribute for the <meta> HTML element sets the preferred color to customize the display of the page or the surrounding browser user interface.
meta-theme-color.description_html: The name="theme-color" attribute for the <meta> HTML element sets the preferred color to customize the display of the page or the surrounding browser user interface.
meta-theme-color.name: <meta name="theme-color">

meter.description: The <meter> element represents a scalar value within a known range or a fractional value, typically shown as a progress bar.
meter.description_html: The <meter> element represents a scalar value within a known range or a fractional value, typically shown as a progress bar.
meter.name: <meter>

min-max-clamp.description: The min() and max() CSS functions return the minimum or maximum of the arguments, while clamp() clamps a value to a given range.
min-max-clamp.description_html: The min() and max() CSS functions return the minimum or maximum of the arguments, while clamp() clamps a value to a given range.
min-max-clamp.name: min(), max(), and clamp()

min-max-content.description: The min-content and max-content CSS keywords represent the smallest and largest intrinsic sizes of an element.
min-max-content.description_html: The min-content and max-content CSS keywords represent the smallest and largest intrinsic sizes of an element.
min-max-content.name: min-content and max-content

min-max-width-height.description: The min-width, min-height, max-width, and max-height CSS properties set the minimum and maximum size of an element.
min-max-width-height.description_html: The min-width, min-height, max-width, and max-height CSS properties set the minimum and maximum size of an element.
min-max-width-height.name: Min and max width and height

mix-blend-mode.description: The mix-blend-mode CSS property blends an element's content with its background or parent elements using blend modes like multiply, difference, or color.
mix-blend-mode.description_html: The mix-blend-mode CSS property blends an element's content with its background or parent elements using blend modes like multiply, difference, or color.
mix-blend-mode.name: mix-blend-mode

mixed-content.description: When a document is loaded over HTTPS, browsers ensure that none of the document's resources are loaded over an insecure protocol. Instead, resources that the document attempts to load over an insecure protocol are either loaded over HTTPS or are blocked.
mixed-content.description_html: When a document is loaded over HTTPS, browsers ensure that none of the document's resources are loaded over an insecure protocol. Instead, resources that the document attempts to load over an insecure protocol are either loaded over HTTPS or are blocked.
mixed-content.name: Mixed content handling

modal.description: The :modal pseudo-class selects elements that put other elements into a non-interactive state, such as a fullscreen element or a <dialog> element used with showModal().
modal.description_html: The :modal pseudo-class selects elements that put other elements into a non-interactive state, such as a fullscreen element or a <dialog> element used with showModal().
modal.name: :modal

modulepreload.description: The rel="modulepreload" attribute for the <link> HTML element indicates that a module script should be fetched, parsed, and compiled preemptively, and stored for later execution.
modulepreload.description_html: The rel="modulepreload" attribute for the <link> HTML element indicates that a module script should be fetched, parsed, and compiled preemptively, and stored for later execution.
modulepreload.name: <link rel="modulepreload">

motion-path.description: The offset CSS property animates an element along a defined motion path.
motion-path.description_html: The offset CSS property animates an element along a defined motion path.
motion-path.name: Motion path

mouse-events.description: Mouse events, such as click, mousedown, or mousemove, fire when users interact with an input or pointing device such as a mouse, trackpad, or touchscreen.
mouse-events.description_html: Mouse events, such as click, mousedown, or mousemove, fire when users interact with an input or pointing device such as a mouse, trackpad, or touchscreen.
mouse-events.name: Mouse events

move-before.description: The moveBefore() DOM method relocates a node while preserving its state. For example, you can move the active element without losing focus, move an animated element without resetting the animation, or move an iframe without reloading its content.
move-before.description_html: The moveBefore() DOM method relocates a node while preserving its state. For example, you can move the active element without losing focus, move an animated element without resetting the animation, or move an iframe without reloading its content.
move-before.name: moveBefore()

multi-column.description: Multi-column layout flows an element's content across one or more columns in a single row, without affecting the display property of its children.
multi-column.description_html: Multi-column layout flows an element's content across one or more columns in a single row, without affecting the display property of its children.
multi-column.name: Multi-column layout

mutation-events.description: Mutation events like DOMSubtreeModified, DOMNodeInserted, or DOMNodeRemoved fire when DOM changes occur.
mutation-events.description_html: Mutation events like DOMSubtreeModified, DOMNodeInserted, or DOMNodeRemoved fire when DOM changes occur.
mutation-events.name: Mutation events

mutationobserver.description: The MutationObserver API watches for changes to the DOM tree and calls a callback function when DOM changes occur.
mutationobserver.description_html: The MutationObserver API watches for changes to the DOM tree and calls a callback function when DOM changes occur.
mutationobserver.name: MutationObserver

named-color.description: Some CSS color values can be referenced by name, such as red or limegreen. They stand in for specific RGB color values.
named-color.description_html: Some CSS color values can be referenced by name, such as red or limegreen. They stand in for specific RGB color values.
named-color.name: Named colors

namespace.description: The @namespace CSS rule sets a default namespace or namespace prefix. Namespace prefixes allow CSS selectors to distinguish elements with the same name but different document types, such as the HTML <a> element and the SVG <a> element.
namespace.description_html: The @namespace CSS rule sets a default namespace or namespace prefix. Namespace prefixes allow CSS selectors to distinguish elements with the same name but different document types, such as the HTML <a> element and the SVG <a> element.
namespace.name: @namespace

nav.description: The <nav> element represents a section of a page whose purpose is to provide navigation links, either within the current document or to other documents.
nav.description_html: The <nav> element represents a section of a page whose purpose is to provide navigation links, either within the current document or to other documents.
nav.name: <nav>

navigation.description: The navigation API initiates, intercepts, or modifies browser navigation actions. Not to be confused with the navigator API.
navigation.description_html: The navigation API initiates, intercepts, or modifies browser navigation actions. Not to be confused with the navigator API.
navigation.name: Navigation API

navigation-timing.description: The navigation performance entry and the PerformanceNavigationTiming API measures navigation events, such as loading time or the number of redirects.
navigation-timing.description_html: The navigation performance entry and the PerformanceNavigationTiming API measures navigation events, such as loading time or the number of redirects.
navigation-timing.name: Navigation timing

navigator.description: The window.navigator API is a generic global object, under which many other, more interesting APIs are located. It doesn't do anything interesting on its own.
navigator.description_html: The window.navigator API is a generic global object, under which many other, more interesting APIs are located. It doesn't do anything interesting on its own.
navigator.name: Navigator

nesting.description: CSS nesting allows for shorter selectors, easier reading, and more modularity by nesting rules inside others.
nesting.description_html: CSS nesting allows for shorter selectors, easier reading, and more modularity by nesting rules inside others.
nesting.name: Nesting

network-information.description: The navigator.connection API provides information about the network connection a device is using and fires events when the connection type changes.
network-information.description_html: The navigator.connection API provides information about the network connection a device is using and fires events when the connection type changes.
network-information.name: Network Information

non-cookie-storage-access.description: Non-cookie storage access extends the requestStorageAccess() API to let content in cross-site iframes request access to first-party data beyond cookies.
non-cookie-storage-access.description_html: Non-cookie storage access extends the requestStorageAccess() API to let content in cross-site iframes request access to first-party data beyond cookies.
non-cookie-storage-access.name: Non-cookie storage access

not.description: The :not() functional pseudo-class matches elements that do not match the selectors in its argument.
not.description_html: The :not() functional pseudo-class matches elements that do not match the selectors in its argument.
not.name: :not()

notifications.description: The Notification() constructor shows a message to the user, typically using the notification system of the host operating system.
notifications.description_html: The Notification() constructor shows a message to the user, typically using the notification system of the host operating system.
notifications.name: Notifications

notifications-apps.description: Notifications via service worker registration's showNotification() method, sent from installed web applications (for example, saved to the Home Screen on Safari for iOS), show a message to the user, typically using the notification system of the host operating system.
notifications-apps.description_html: Notifications via service worker registration's showNotification() method, sent from installed web applications (for example, saved to the Home Screen on Safari for iOS), show a message to the user, typically using the notification system of the host operating system.
notifications-apps.name: Notifications from service workers and installed apps

nth-child.description: The :nth-child() and :nth-last-child() CSS functional pseudo-classes match elements based on their index within a list of elements. The :first-child and :last-child pseudo-classes match the first and last element in a list, and the :only-child pseudo-class matches an element with no siblings.
nth-child.description_html: The :nth-child() and :nth-last-child() CSS functional pseudo-classes match elements based on their index within a list of elements. The :first-child and :last-child pseudo-classes match the first and last element in a list, and the :only-child pseudo-class matches an element with no siblings.
nth-child.name: :nth-child()

nth-child-of.description: The of syntax for the :nth-child() and :nth-last-child() CSS functional pseudo-classes match elements by the relative position of elements, counted from the first or last sibling matching a selector list.
nth-child-of.description_html: The of syntax for the :nth-child() and :nth-last-child() CSS functional pseudo-classes match elements by the relative position of elements, counted from the first or last sibling matching a selector list.
nth-child-of.name: :nth-child() of <selector>

nth-of-type.description: The :nth-of-type() and :nth-last-of-type() CSS functional pseudo-classes match elements based on their position among siblings of the same type. The :first-of-type, :last-of-type, and :only-of-type pseudo-classes match the first, last, and only elements of its type.
nth-of-type.description_html: The :nth-of-type() and :nth-last-of-type() CSS functional pseudo-classes match elements based on their position among siblings of the same type. The :first-of-type, :last-of-type, and :only-of-type pseudo-classes match the first, last, and only elements of its type.
nth-of-type.name: :nth-of-type() pseudo-classes

nullish-coalescing.description: The nullish coalescing (??) and nullish coalescing assignment (??=) operators return (or assign) its right-hand side operand when its left-hand side operand is null or undefined, and otherwise returns its left-hand side operand.
nullish-coalescing.description_html: The nullish coalescing (??) and nullish coalescing assignment (??=) operators return (or assign) its right-hand side operand when its left-hand side operand is null or undefined, and otherwise returns its left-hand side operand.
nullish-coalescing.name: Nullish coalescing

number.description: The number type (and Number object) represents floating-point numbers, such as 42 or -4.201, while the Math API contains mathematical functions and constants. JavaScript can also represent boundless negative and positive values as Infinity or not-a-number as NaN (as in 0 * Infinity).
number.description_html: The number type (and Number object) represents floating-point numbers, such as 42 or -4.201, while the Math API contains mathematical functions and constants. JavaScript can also represent boundless negative and positive values as Infinity or not-a-number as NaN (as in 0 * Infinity).
number.name: Math and numbers

numeric-factory-functions.description: The numeric factory functions, such as CSS.px() or CSS.kHz(), return a CSSUnitValue representing a CSS number value (as in 12px or 440kHz).
numeric-factory-functions.description_html: The numeric factory functions, such as CSS.px() or CSS.kHz(), return a CSSUnitValue representing a CSS number value (as in 12px or 440kHz).
numeric-factory-functions.name: Numeric factory functions

numeric-separators.description: To improve readability for numeric literals, underscores (_) can be used as separators. For example, 1_050.95 is equivalent to 1050.95.
numeric-separators.description_html: To improve readability for numeric literals, underscores (_) can be used as separators. For example, 1_050.95 is equivalent to 1050.95.
numeric-separators.name: Numeric separators

object.description: The <object> element represents an external resource such as a PDF or SVG document. It was historically used for plugins such as Shockwave Flash.
object.description_html: The <object> element represents an external resource such as a PDF or SVG document. It was historically used for plugins such as Shockwave Flash.
object.name: <object>

object-fit.description: The object-fit CSS property sets how images, videos, and other replaced elements are scaled within their container.
object-fit.description_html: The object-fit CSS property sets how images, videos, and other replaced elements are scaled within their container.
object-fit.name: object-fit

object-hasown.description: The Object.hasOwn() static method checks whether an object has a given property. It's a more robust alternative to the Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty() method.
object-hasown.description_html: The Object.hasOwn() static method checks whether an object has a given property. It's a more robust alternative to the Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty() method.
object-hasown.name: Object.hasOwn()

object-object.description: Objects in JavaScript are collections of key-value pairs.
object-object.description_html: Objects in JavaScript are collections of key-value pairs.
object-object.name: Object

object-position.description: The object-position CSS property places images, videos, and other replaced elements within their boxes.
object-position.description_html: The object-position CSS property places images, videos, and other replaced elements within their boxes.
object-position.name: object-position

object-view-box.description: The object-view-box CSS property crops and zooms to an inset area of an image.
object-view-box.description_html: The object-view-box CSS property crops and zooms to an inset area of an image.
object-view-box.name: object-view-box

observable.description: The when() method on a event target returns an Observable object, which provides a declarative API for subscribing to and operating on events. It's an alternative to addEventListener() callbacks.
observable.description_html: The when() method on a event target returns an Observable object, which provides a declarative API for subscribing to and operating on events. It's an alternative to addEventListener() callbacks.
observable.name: Observable

oes-element-index-uint.description: The OES_element_index_uint extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds support for gl.UNSIGNED_INT types to WebGLRenderingContext.drawElements().
oes-element-index-uint.description_html: The OES_element_index_uint extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds support for gl.UNSIGNED_INT types to WebGLRenderingContext.drawElements().
oes-element-index-uint.name: OES_element_index_uint WebGL extension

oes-fbo-render-mipmap.description: The OES_fbo_render_mipmap extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts attaches any level of a texture to a framebuffer object.
oes-fbo-render-mipmap.description_html: The OES_fbo_render_mipmap extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts attaches any level of a texture to a framebuffer object.
oes-fbo-render-mipmap.name: OES_fbo_render_mipmap WebGL extension

oes-standard-derivatives.description: The OES_standard_derivatives extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds the GLSL derivative functions dFdx, dFdy, and fwidth.
oes-standard-derivatives.description_html: The OES_standard_derivatives extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds the GLSL derivative functions dFdx, dFdy, and fwidth.
oes-standard-derivatives.name: OES_standard_derivatives WebGL extension

oes-texture-float.description: The OES_texture_float extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds floating-point pixel types for textures.
oes-texture-float.description_html: The OES_texture_float extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds floating-point pixel types for textures.
oes-texture-float.name: OES_texture_float WebGL extension

oes-texture-float-linear.description: The OES_texture_float_linear extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds linear filtering with floating-point pixel types for textures.
oes-texture-float-linear.description_html: The OES_texture_float_linear extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds linear filtering with floating-point pixel types for textures.
oes-texture-float-linear.name: OES_texture_float_linear WebGL extension

oes-texture-half-float.description: The OES_texture_half_float extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds texture formats with 16-bit (also known as half float) and 32-bit floating-point components.
oes-texture-half-float.description_html: The OES_texture_half_float extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds texture formats with 16-bit (also known as half float) and 32-bit floating-point components.
oes-texture-half-float.name: OES_texture_half_float WebGL extension

oes-texture-half-float-linear.description: The OES_texture_half_float_linear extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds linear filtering with half floating-point pixel types for textures.
oes-texture-half-float-linear.description_html: The OES_texture_half_float_linear extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds linear filtering with half floating-point pixel types for textures.
oes-texture-half-float-linear.name: OES_texture_half_float_linear WebGL extension

oes-vertex-array-object.description: The OES_vertex_array_object extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds vertex array objects (VAOs) which encapsulate vertex array states. These objects keep pointers to vertex data and names for different sets of vertex data.
oes-vertex-array-object.description_html: The OES_vertex_array_object extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds vertex array objects (VAOs) which encapsulate vertex array states. These objects keep pointers to vertex data and names for different sets of vertex data.
oes-vertex-array-object.name: OES_vertex_array_object WebGL extension

offline-audio-context.description: The OfflineAudioContext API represents an audio processing graph that writes to an AudioBuffer instead of an output device.
offline-audio-context.description_html: The OfflineAudioContext API represents an audio processing graph that writes to an AudioBuffer instead of an output device.
offline-audio-context.name: OfflineAudioContext

offscreen-canvas.description: The OffscreenCanvas API provides a canvas that can be drawn to off screen, with no dependencies on the DOM, which can be used to run heavy rendering operations inside a worker context.
offscreen-canvas.description_html: The OffscreenCanvas API provides a canvas that can be drawn to off screen, with no dependencies on the DOM, which can be used to run heavy rendering operations inside a worker context.
offscreen-canvas.name: Offscreen canvas

oklab.description: The Oklab color space expresses colors in terms of lightness and how red/green and blue/yellow a color is, aiming to match how humans perceive colors. Oklch is a variant of Oklab with polar coordinates. These color spaces can be used with the CSS color(), oklab(), and oklch() functions.
oklab.description_html: The Oklab color space expresses colors in terms of lightness and how red/green and blue/yellow a color is, aiming to match how humans perceive colors. Oklch is a variant of Oklab with polar coordinates. These color spaces can be used with the CSS color(), oklab(), and oklch() functions.
oklab.name: Oklab and Oklch

online.description: The navigator.onLine property is a boolean for whether the browser is connected to some network (though not necessarily the internet). The online and offline events fire when the connection state changes.
online.description_html: The navigator.onLine property is a boolean for whether the browser is connected to some network (though not necessarily the internet). The online and offline events fire when the connection state changes.
online.name: Online status

opacity.description: The opacity CSS property sets the transparency of an element.
opacity.description_html: The opacity CSS property sets the transparency of an element.
opacity.name: opacity

opacity-svg.description: The fill-opacity, and stroke-opacity SVG attributes and CSS properties control the transparency of a stroke or fill of an SVG element.
opacity-svg.description_html: The fill-opacity, and stroke-opacity SVG attributes and CSS properties control the transparency of a stroke or fill of an SVG element.
opacity-svg.name: Opacity (SVG)

open-closed.description: The :open CSS pseudo-class matches elements that have open states, like <details>, <dialog>, or <select>, based on their state.
open-closed.description_html: The :open CSS pseudo-class matches elements that have open states, like <details>, <dialog>, or <select>, based on their state.
open-closed.name: :open

optional-catch-binding.description: Omit the the binding parameter of a catch clause when you don't need information about the exception in a try ... catch statement.
optional-catch-binding.description_html: Omit the the binding parameter of a catch clause when you don't need information about the exception in a try ... catch statement.
optional-catch-binding.name: Optional catch binding

orientation-sensor.description: The AbsoluteOrientationSensor and RelativeOrientationSensor APIs describe the physical orientation of a device in three-dimensional space, either in relation to the Earth's coordinate system or in relation to the device's own orientation, respectively.
orientation-sensor.description_html: The AbsoluteOrientationSensor and RelativeOrientationSensor APIs describe the physical orientation of a device in three-dimensional space, either in relation to the Earth's coordinate system or in relation to the device's own orientation, respectively.
orientation-sensor.name: Orientation Sensor

origin-private-file-system.description: The navigator.storage.getDirectory() method returns a FileSystemDirectoryHandle that is restricted to a specific origin and invisible to the user's actual file system for faster file-based applications, such as SQLite databases.
origin-private-file-system.description_html: The navigator.storage.getDirectory() method returns a FileSystemDirectoryHandle that is restricted to a specific origin and invisible to the user's actual file system for faster file-based applications, such as SQLite databases.
origin-private-file-system.name: Origin private file system

outline.description: The outline CSS shorthand sets the color, style, and width of a line around an element, outside of the border.
outline.description_html: The outline CSS shorthand sets the color, style, and width of a line around an element, outside of the border.
outline.name: outline

outlines.description: The outline-color, outline-style, and outline-width and outline-offset CSS properties style a line around an element, outside of the border.
outlines.description_html: The outline-color, outline-style, and outline-width and outline-offset CSS properties style a line around an element, outside of the border.
outlines.name: Outlines

output.description: The <output> element represents the result of a calculation, user action, or form entry.
output.description_html: The <output> element represents the result of a calculation, user action, or form entry.
output.name: <output>

overflow.description: The overflow-block and overflow-inline CSS media queries set styles based on the way a device displays content that's larger than the viewport or page area. For example, a laptop lets users scroll to reveal content, while a printer displays overflowing content on additional pages.
overflow.description_html: The overflow-block and overflow-inline CSS media queries set styles based on the way a device displays content that's larger than the viewport or page area. For example, a laptop lets users scroll to reveal content, while a printer displays overflowing content on additional pages.
overflow.name: Overflow media queries

overflow-anchor.description: The overflow-anchor CSS property sets an element as a possible scroll anchor, reducing unintended scrolling when document changes occur above the current scrollport. This is enabled by default where supported.
overflow-anchor.description_html: The overflow-anchor CSS property sets an element as a possible scroll anchor, reducing unintended scrolling when document changes occur above the current scrollport. This is enabled by default where supported.
overflow-anchor.name: overflow-anchor

overflow-clip.description: The overflow: clip CSS declaration clips an element's overflowing content to the box that's defined by the overflow-clip-margin property. Unlike overflow: hidden, it allows you to hide overflow on one axis while keeping overflow on the other axis visible.
overflow-clip.description_html: The overflow: clip CSS declaration clips an element's overflowing content to the box that's defined by the overflow-clip-margin property. Unlike overflow: hidden, it allows you to hide overflow on one axis while keeping overflow on the other axis visible.
overflow-clip.name: overflow: clip

overflow-clip-margin.description: The overflow-clip-margin CSS property sets how far overflow content may appear outside the bounds of an element before it's clipped by effects such as overflow: clip.
overflow-clip-margin.description_html: The overflow-clip-margin CSS property sets how far overflow content may appear outside the bounds of an element before it's clipped by effects such as overflow: clip.
overflow-clip-margin.name: overflow-clip-margin

overflow-overlay.description: The overflow: overlay CSS declaration is an alias to overflow: auto. Historically, it caused non-standard behavior, allowing scrollbars to overlay content without taking up layout space.
overflow-overlay.description_html: The overflow: overlay CSS declaration is an alias to overflow: auto. Historically, it caused non-standard behavior, allowing scrollbars to overlay content without taking up layout space.
overflow-overlay.name: overflow: overlay

overflow-shorthand.description: The overflow CSS property sets the behavior for when content doesn't fit in an element.
overflow-shorthand.description_html: The overflow CSS property sets the behavior for when content doesn't fit in an element.
overflow-shorthand.name: overflow

overflow-wrap.description: The overflow-wrap CSS property breaks a line of text onto multiple lines inside the targeted element in an otherwise unbreakable place to prevent overflow. The legacy property is word-wrap.
overflow-wrap.description_html: The overflow-wrap CSS property breaks a line of text onto multiple lines inside the targeted element in an otherwise unbreakable place to prevent overflow. The legacy property is word-wrap.
overflow-wrap.name: overflow-wrap

overlay.description: The overlay CSS property, used as an allow-discrete CSS transition, prevents a top layer element, such as a popover or a <dialog>, from being removed from the top layer before it has finished animating. You can't set the value of the overlay property; only use it as transition property.
overlay.description_html: The overlay CSS property, used as an allow-discrete CSS transition, prevents a top layer element, such as a popover or a <dialog>, from being removed from the top layer before it has finished animating. You can't set the value of the overlay property; only use it as transition property.
overlay.name: overlay

overscroll-behavior.description: The overscroll-behavior CSS property disables default scrolling behaviors when the edges of a scrolling area are reached.
overscroll-behavior.description_html: The overscroll-behavior CSS property disables default scrolling behaviors when the edges of a scrolling area are reached.
overscroll-behavior.name: overscroll-behavior

ovr-multiview2.description: The OVR_multiview2 extension for WebGL 2.0 contexts renders into multiple views simultaneously. This especially useful for virtual reality (VR) and WebXR.
ovr-multiview2.description_html: The OVR_multiview2 extension for WebGL 2.0 contexts renders into multiple views simultaneously. This especially useful for virtual reality (VR) and WebXR.
ovr-multiview2.name: OVR_multiview2 WebGL extension

p.description:
The

element represents a paragraph of text.
p.description_html: The <p> element represents a paragraph of text.

padding.description: The padding CSS property sets space between an element's edge and its contents. It is a shorthand for padding-top, padding-right, padding-bottom, and padding-left.
padding.description_html: The padding CSS property sets space between an element's edge and its contents. It is a shorthand for padding-top, padding-right, padding-bottom, and padding-left.
padding.name: padding

page-break-aliases.description: The page-break-before, page-break-inside, and page-break-after CSS properties are aliases to the break-before, break-inside, and break-after properties.
page-break-aliases.description_html: The page-break-before, page-break-inside, and page-break-after CSS properties are aliases to the break-before, break-inside, and break-after properties.
page-break-aliases.name: Page break aliases

page-breaks.description: In printed page layouts, the break-after, break-before, break-inside CSS properties control where printed pages start and end. Also known as pagination or page breaking.
page-breaks.description_html: In printed page layouts, the break-after, break-before, break-inside CSS properties control where printed pages start and end. Also known as pagination or page breaking.
page-breaks.name: Page breaks

page-lifecycle.description: The page lifecycle API helps you safely handle page suspensions or discards from memory. The freeze and resume events fire when the browser suspends or resumes a page from memory while the document.wasDiscarded property reports whether the page was reloaded after being dropped.
page-lifecycle.description_html: The page lifecycle API helps you safely handle page suspensions or discards from memory. The freeze and resume events fire when the browser suspends or resumes a page from memory while the document.wasDiscarded property reports whether the page was reloaded after being dropped.
page-lifecycle.name: Page lifecycle

page-orientation.description: The page-orientation CSS property sets the rotation of a page after pagination. This allows pages with the same size declaration to display with different orientations.
page-orientation.description_html: The page-orientation CSS property sets the rotation of a page after pagination. This allows pages with the same size declaration to display with different orientations.
page-orientation.name: page-orientation

page-selectors.description: The :first, :left, and :right pseudo-classes select pages based on their position in sequence after pagination. They're often used with the page CSS property, to choose a print layout defined by the @page rule.
page-selectors.description_html: The :first, :left, and :right pseudo-classes select pages based on their position in sequence after pagination. They're often used with the page CSS property, to choose a print layout defined by the @page rule.
page-selectors.name: Page selectors

page-setup.description: The @page CSS at-rule sets the page-specific dimensions and margins for content such as printed documents, ebooks, or slides.
page-setup.description_html: The @page CSS at-rule sets the page-specific dimensions and margins for content such as printed documents, ebooks, or slides.
page-setup.name: Page setup

page-transition-events.description: The pageshow and pagehide transition events fire when a document loads or unloads due to a navigation, such as clicking on a link on a page or the back button in a browser.
page-transition-events.description_html: The pageshow and pagehide transition events fire when a document loads or unloads due to a navigation, such as clicking on a link on a page or the back button in a browser.
page-transition-events.name: Page transition events

page-visibility.description: The document.visibilityState and document.hidden properties tell you whether the page is visible to the user (for example, it's not minimized or in a background tab).
page-visibility.description_html: The document.visibilityState and document.hidden properties tell you whether the page is visible to the user (for example, it's not minimized or in a background tab).
page-visibility.name: Page visibility

page-visibility-state.description: The visibility-state performance entry and the VisibilityStateEntry API measure the timing of page visibility state changes, such as when a tab is no longer visible or the user has switched to another app.
page-visibility-state.description_html: The visibility-state performance entry and the VisibilityStateEntry API measure the timing of page visibility state changes, such as when a tab is no longer visible or the user has switched to another app.
page-visibility-state.name: Page visibility state

paint.description: The paint() CSS function creates a custom image, drawn using a paint worklet, for an element's background or border.
paint.description_html: The paint() CSS function creates a custom image, drawn using a paint worklet, for an element's background or border.
paint.name: paint()

paint-order.description: The paint-order CSS property sets the z-order of strokes, fills, and (in SVG content) markers. For example, paint-order: markers stroke fill; draws the markers, then stroke on top of markers, then fill on top of both markers and stroke.
paint-order.description_html: The paint-order CSS property sets the z-order of strokes, fills, and (in SVG content) markers. For example, paint-order: markers stroke fill; draws the markers, then stroke on top of markers, then fill on top of both markers and stroke.
paint-order.name: paint-order

paint-timing.description: The paint performance entry and the PerformancePaintTiming API measures the duration of "paint" (also called "render") operations as a page loads. The API measures the time to First Paint (FP) and First Contentful Paint (FCP), common metrics for perceived loading times.
paint-timing.description_html: The paint performance entry and the PerformancePaintTiming API measures the duration of "paint" (also called "render") operations as a page loads. The API measures the time to First Paint (FP) and First Contentful Paint (FCP), common metrics for perceived loading times.
paint-timing.name: Paint timing

parse-html-unsafe.description: The Document.parseHTMLUnsafe() static method parses HTML into a DOM tree, while the setHTMLUnsafe() method of Element and ShadowRoot parses and inserts HTML into an existing tree. No sanitization applies to these methods, so never call them with user-provided HTML strings.
parse-html-unsafe.description_html: The Document.parseHTMLUnsafe() static method parses HTML into a DOM tree, while the setHTMLUnsafe() method of Element and ShadowRoot parses and inserts HTML into an existing tree. No sanitization applies to these methods, so never call them with user-provided HTML strings.
parse-html-unsafe.name: Unsanitized HTML parsing methods

partitioned-cookies.description: Partitioned cookies allow you to opt a cookie into partitioned storage, with a separate cookie jar per top-level site. Also known as Cookies Having Independent Partitioned State or CHIPS.
partitioned-cookies.description_html: Partitioned cookies allow you to opt a cookie into partitioned storage, with a separate cookie jar per top-level site. Also known as Cookies Having Independent Partitioned State or CHIPS.
partitioned-cookies.name: Partitioned cookies

password-credentials.description: The PasswordCredential API represents a username and password.
password-credentials.description_html: The PasswordCredential API represents a username and password.
password-credentials.name: Password credentials

path-shape.description: The path() CSS shape function creates a shape for clip-path, shape-outside, and the SVG attribute d.
path-shape.description_html: The path() CSS shape function creates a shape for clip-path, shape-outside, and the SVG attribute d.
path-shape.name: path()

payment-handler.description: The payment handler API registers a web application as a payment handler and responds to payment requests in the browser's user interface, rather than redirecting users to a separate site to complete a payment.
payment-handler.description_html: The payment handler API registers a web application as a payment handler and responds to payment requests in the browser's user interface, rather than redirecting users to a separate site to complete a payment.
payment-handler.name: Payment handler

payment-request.description: The PaymentRequest API prompts the user to make a payment through the browser's user interface.
payment-request.description_html: The PaymentRequest API prompts the user to make a payment through the browser's user interface.
payment-request.name: Payment request

pdf-viewer.description: The navigator.pdfViewerEnabled property is a boolean for whether the browser navigates to and shows a PDF in the browser window or downloads the PDF.
