pdf-viewer.description_html: The navigator.pdfViewerEnabled property is a boolean for whether the browser navigates to and shows a PDF in the browser window or downloads the PDF.
pdf-viewer.name: pdfViewerEnabled

performance.description: The performance global object and the PerformanceObserver API provide access to performance-related information for the current execution context.
performance.description_html: The performance global object and the PerformanceObserver API provide access to performance-related information for the current execution context.
performance.name: Performance

performancetiming.description: The window.performance.timing and window.performance.navigation APIs report performance timing information for events that occur during the loading and use of the current page.
performancetiming.description_html: The window.performance.timing and window.performance.navigation APIs report performance timing information for events that occur during the loading and use of the current page.
performancetiming.name: PerformanceTiming and PerformanceNavigation

periodic-background-sync.description: The periodic background synchronization API fires a recurring periodicsync event in a service worker. You can use this to update data in the background at regular intervals.
periodic-background-sync.description_html: The periodic background synchronization API fires a recurring periodicsync event in a service worker. You can use this to update data in the background at regular intervals.
periodic-background-sync.name: Periodic background sync

permissions.description: The navigator.permissions API checks whether a permission, such as access to geolocation data, has been granted.
permissions.description_html: The navigator.permissions API checks whether a permission, such as access to geolocation data, has been granted.
permissions.name: Permissions

physical-properties.description: The physical CSS properties, top, right, bottom, and left, set the inset position of an element relative to the corresponding side of a container determined by the element's position property.
physical-properties.description_html: The physical CSS properties, top, right, bottom, and left, set the inset position of an element relative to the corresponding side of a container determined by the element's position property.
physical-properties.name: Physical properties

picture.description: The <picture> element is used for art direction in responsive images, where a different image is displayed based on the <source> element.
picture.description_html: The <picture> element is used for art direction in responsive images, where a different image is displayed based on the <source> element.
picture.name: <picture>

picture-in-picture.description: The picture-in-picture API allow websites to create a floating, always-on-top video window. Also known as PiP or pop-out video.
picture-in-picture.description_html: The picture-in-picture API allow websites to create a floating, always-on-top video window. Also known as PiP or pop-out video.
picture-in-picture.name: Picture-in-picture (video)

ping.description: The ping attribute for <a> elements sets a URL to send a POST request to when the <a> is clicked. This is typically used for outbound link reporting.
ping.description_html: The ping attribute for <a> elements sets a URL to send a POST request to when the <a> is clicked. This is typically used for outbound link reporting.
ping.name: ping

placeholder.description: The ::placeholder CSS pseudo-element selects help text in <input> and <textarea> elements when no value is set.
placeholder.description_html: The ::placeholder CSS pseudo-element selects help text in <input> and <textarea> elements when no value is set.
placeholder.name: ::placeholder

placeholder-shown.description: The :placeholder-shown CSS pseudo-element selects <input> and <textarea> elements when no value is set and the element's placeholder attribute is not empty. Not to be confused with ::placeholder, which selects the placeholder text itself.
placeholder-shown.description_html: The :placeholder-shown CSS pseudo-element selects <input> and <textarea> elements when no value is set and the element's placeholder attribute is not empty. Not to be confused with ::placeholder, which selects the placeholder text itself.
placeholder-shown.name: :placeholder-shown

pointer-events.description: The pointer-events CSS property sets whether a user can interact with an element using a mouse, touch, or other pointing input device.
pointer-events.description_html: The pointer-events CSS property sets whether a user can interact with an element using a mouse, touch, or other pointing input device.
pointer-events.name: pointer-events

pointer-events-api.description: Pointer events, such as pointerdown, and the PointerEvent API, represent general pointing inputs, from a wide range of devices, such as a mouse, pen or stylus, or touch with one or more fingers. Not to be confused with the pointer-events CSS property.
pointer-events-api.description_html: Pointer events, such as pointerdown, and the PointerEvent API, represent general pointing inputs, from a wide range of devices, such as a mouse, pen or stylus, or touch with one or more fingers. Not to be confused with the pointer-events CSS property.
pointer-events-api.name: Pointer Events

pointer-lock.description: Provides access to raw mouse movement by locking the target of mouse events to a single element and hiding the mouse cursor.
pointer-lock.description_html: Provides access to raw mouse movement by locking the target of mouse events to a single element and hiding the mouse cursor.
pointer-lock.name: Pointer lock

popover.description: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
popover.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
popover.name: Popover

popover-hint.description: The popover="hint" global HTML attribute creates a popover that is subordinate to popovers with a popover="auto" attribute. You can use this to create tooltips that don't dismiss auto popovers.
popover-hint.description_html: The popover="hint" global HTML attribute creates a popover that is subordinate to popovers with a popover="auto" attribute. You can use this to create tooltips that don't dismiss auto popovers.
popover-hint.name: popover="hint"

portal.description: The <portal> HTML element embeds another page into the current page as a non-interactive preview.
portal.description_html: The <portal> HTML element embeds another page into the current page as a non-interactive preview.
portal.name: Portals

position.description: The position CSS property sets the origin position of an element to an element, the element's scrollport, or the viewport.
position.description_html: The position CSS property sets the origin position of an element to an element, the element's scrollport, or the viewport.
position.name: Position

postmessage.description: The postMessage() global method sends cross-origin messages to windows and workers, including popups and iframes. Also known as cross-document messaging.
postmessage.description_html: The postMessage() global method sends cross-origin messages to windows and workers, including popups and iframes. Also known as cross-document messaging.
postmessage.name: postMessage

pre.description: The <pre> element represents a block element of preformatted text that is presented exactly as written, including all white space.
pre.description_html: The <pre> element represents a block element of preformatted text that is presented exactly as written, including all white space.
pre.name: <pre>

prefers-color-scheme.description: The prefers-color-scheme CSS media query sets styles based on the requested color scheme, light or dark.
prefers-color-scheme.description_html: The prefers-color-scheme CSS media query sets styles based on the requested color scheme, light or dark.
prefers-color-scheme.name: prefers-color-scheme media query

prefers-contrast.description: The prefers-contrast CSS media query sets styles based on whether the user prefers more or less contrast, the difference between foreground and background colors.
prefers-contrast.description_html: The prefers-contrast CSS media query sets styles based on whether the user prefers more or less contrast, the difference between foreground and background colors.
prefers-contrast.name: prefers-contrast media query

prefers-reduced-data.description: The prefers-reduced-data CSS media query detects whether the user has a preference for using less network traffic. For example, you can use this media query to avoid loading large font files and use a system font instead.
prefers-reduced-data.description_html: The prefers-reduced-data CSS media query detects whether the user has a preference for using less network traffic. For example, you can use this media query to avoid loading large font files and use a system font instead.
prefers-reduced-data.name: prefers-reduced-data media query

prefers-reduced-motion.description: The prefers-reduced-motion CSS media query sets styles based on whether the user prefers to minimize the amount of non-essential animations on the device, such as scrolling, panning, zooming, and strobing.
prefers-reduced-motion.description_html: The prefers-reduced-motion CSS media query sets styles based on whether the user prefers to minimize the amount of non-essential animations on the device, such as scrolling, panning, zooming, and strobing.
prefers-reduced-motion.name: prefers-reduced-motion media query

prefers-reduced-transparency.description: The prefers-reduced-transparency CSS media query sets styles based on whether the user prefers to reduce the amount of transparent effects on their device, for example to improve contrast and legibility.
prefers-reduced-transparency.description_html: The prefers-reduced-transparency CSS media query sets styles based on whether the user prefers to reduce the amount of transparent effects on their device, for example to improve contrast and legibility.
prefers-reduced-transparency.name: prefers-reduced-transparency media query

preloading-responsive-images.description: The imagesrcset and imagesizes attributes with the rel="preload" attribute for the <link> HTML element starts fetching responsive images before they're found in the body of the document.
preloading-responsive-images.description_html: The imagesrcset and imagesizes attributes with the rel="preload" attribute for the <link> HTML element starts fetching responsive images before they're found in the body of the document.
preloading-responsive-images.name: Preloading responsive images

presentation-api.description: The Presentation API shows or controls content on another display, such as a network-connected TV or projector.
presentation-api.description_html: The Presentation API shows or controls content on another display, such as a network-connected TV or projector.
presentation-api.name: Presentation API

preserves-pitch.description: The preservesPitch property for <audio> or <video> adjusts the pitch of audio to sound more natural when the playback rate is faster or slower than the default.
preserves-pitch.description_html: The preservesPitch property for <audio> or <video> adjusts the pitch of audio to sound more natural when the playback rate is faster or slower than the default.
preserves-pitch.name: preservesPitch

print.description: The window.print() method opens the browser's print dialog.
print.description_html: The window.print() method opens the browser's print dialog.
print.name: window.print()

print-color-adjust.description: The print-color-adjust CSS property sets whether styles of printed pages should be adjusted to use less ink, in cases such as light text on a dark background.
print-color-adjust.description_html: The print-color-adjust CSS property sets whether styles of printed pages should be adjusted to use less ink, in cases such as light text on a dark background.
print-color-adjust.name: print-color-adjust

print-events.description: An alternative to @media print queries, the beforeprint and afterprint events allow you to change the page for printing and and restore the page after printing.
print-events.description_html: An alternative to @media print queries, the beforeprint and afterprint events allow you to change the page for printing and and restore the page after printing.
print-events.name: Print events

private-click-measurement.description: The attributionsourceid and attributiondestination attributes for <a> elements measure clicks across websites without associating a click to a specific session. Not to be confused with attribution reporting. Also known as PCM.
private-click-measurement.description_html: The attributionsourceid and attributiondestination attributes for <a> elements measure clicks across websites without associating a click to a specific session. Not to be confused with attribution reporting. Also known as PCM.
private-click-measurement.name: Private click measurement

private-network-access.description: The Access-Control-Request-Private-Network: true and Access-Control-Allow-Private-Network: true HTTP request and response headers establish permission for websites to make requests to internal networks, such as to routers.
private-network-access.description_html: The Access-Control-Request-Private-Network: true and Access-Control-Allow-Private-Network: true HTTP request and response headers establish permission for websites to make requests to internal networks, such as to routers.
private-network-access.name: Private network access

profiler.description: The Profiler API records data about the execution of a page, which you can send to a server for later analysis. Also known as self-profiling.
profiler.description_html: The Profiler API records data about the execution of a page, which you can send to a server for later analysis. Also known as self-profiling.
profiler.name: Profiler

progress.description: The <progress> element displays an indicator showing the completion progress of a task, typically displayed as a progress bar.
progress.description_html: The <progress> element displays an indicator showing the completion progress of a task, typically displayed as a progress bar.
progress.name: <progress>

promise.description: A promise represents an asynchronous operation which eventually succeeds or fails.
promise.description_html: A promise represents an asynchronous operation which eventually succeeds or fails.
promise.name: Promise (initial support)

promise-allsettled.description: The Promise.allSettled() static method waits for an array of promises to settle (resolve or reject).
promise-allsettled.description_html: The Promise.allSettled() static method waits for an array of promises to settle (resolve or reject).
promise-allsettled.name: Promise.allSettled()

promise-any.description: The Promise.any() static method returns a promise that fulfills as soon as the first of an iterable of promises fulfills, with that promise's value. Otherwise, it rejects with an AggregateError when all of the promises have rejected.
promise-any.description_html: The Promise.any() static method returns a promise that fulfills as soon as the first of an iterable of promises fulfills, with that promise's value. Otherwise, it rejects with an AggregateError when all of the promises have rejected.
promise-any.name: Promise.any()

promise-finally.description: The promise finally() method executes a function when the promise settles (resolves or rejects).
promise-finally.description_html: The promise finally() method executes a function when the promise settles (resolves or rejects).
promise-finally.name: Promise finally()

promise-try.description: The Promise.try() static method returns a promise that takes a callback of any kind (returns or throws, synchronously or asynchronously) and wraps its result in a Promise.
promise-try.description_html: The Promise.try() static method returns a promise that takes a callback of any kind (returns or throws, synchronously or asynchronously) and wraps its result in a Promise.
promise-try.name: Promise.try()

promise-withresolvers.description: The Promise.withResolvers() static method is an alternative to the Promise() constructor that returns both the promise and resolution functions. You can use this to access resolve and reject outside the scope of the executor function.
promise-withresolvers.description_html: The Promise.withResolvers() static method is an alternative to the Promise() constructor that returns both the promise and resolution functions. You can use this to access resolve and reject outside the scope of the executor function.
promise-withresolvers.name: Promise.withResolvers()

proto.description: The __proto__ property of objects partially exposes the prototype of an object.
proto.description_html: The __proto__ property of objects partially exposes the prototype of an object.
proto.name: __proto__

proxy-reflect.description: The Proxy and Reflect JavaScript built-ins intercept and define custom behavior for fundamental language operations (such as property lookup, assignment, enumeration, or function invocation).
proxy-reflect.description_html: The Proxy and Reflect JavaScript built-ins intercept and define custom behavior for fundamental language operations (such as property lookup, assignment, enumeration, or function invocation).
proxy-reflect.name: Proxy and Reflect

push.description: The Push API subscribes to and receives server-initiated messages. Subscribers receive pushed messages in the background, even after periods inactive or offline.
push.description_html: The Push API subscribes to and receives server-initiated messages. Subscribers receive pushed messages in the background, even after periods inactive or offline.
push.name: Push messages

q.description: The <q> element represents a short inline quotation.
q.description_html: The <q> element represents a short inline quotation.
q.name: <q>

q-unit.description: The Q CSS length unit is an absolute length anchored to the physical measurement of quarter-millimeters. 1Q is equivalent to 1/40 of 1 centimeter.
q-unit.description_html: The Q CSS length unit is an absolute length anchored to the physical measurement of quarter-millimeters. 1Q is equivalent to 1/40 of 1 centimeter.
q-unit.name: Q unit

quotes.description: The quotes CSS property sets the quotation marks inserted via the content CSS property or <q> element.
quotes.description_html: The quotes CSS property sets the quotation marks inserted via the content CSS property or <q> element.
quotes.name: Quotes

rcap.description: The rcap CSS length unit is a font-relative length equal to the value of the cap unit on the root element. Cap-height is approximately equal to the height of a capital Latin letter.
rcap.description_html: The rcap CSS length unit is a font-relative length equal to the value of the cap unit on the root element. Cap-height is approximately equal to the height of a capital Latin letter.
rcap.name: rcap unit

rch.description: The rch CSS length unit is a font-relative length equal to the value of the ch unit on the root element. ch length is based on the width of the zero (0) character.
rch.description_html: The rch CSS length unit is a font-relative length equal to the value of the ch unit on the root element. ch length is based on the width of the zero (0) character.
rch.name: rch unit

read-write-pseudos.description: The :read-only and :read-write CSS pseudo-classes match elements that are read-only or read-write, respectively. For example, :read-only matches <input> and <textarea> elements with the readonly attribute.
read-write-pseudos.description_html: The :read-only and :read-write CSS pseudo-classes match elements that are read-only or read-write, respectively. For example, :read-only matches <input> and <textarea> elements with the readonly attribute.
read-write-pseudos.name: :read-only and :read-write

readable-byte-streams.description: A ReadableStream constructed with { type: "bytes" } reads bytes from a stream without making extra copies, improving efficiency for streams of large chunks. Also known as BYOB or bring your own buffer.
readable-byte-streams.description_html: A ReadableStream constructed with { type: "bytes" } reads bytes from a stream without making extra copies, improving efficiency for streams of large chunks. Also known as BYOB or bring your own buffer.
readable-byte-streams.name: Readable byte streams

readablestream-from.description: The ReadableStream.from() static method converts an iterable or async iterable object, such as an array or async generator function, into a readable stream.
readablestream-from.description_html: The ReadableStream.from() static method converts an iterable or async iterable object, such as an array or async generator function, into a readable stream.
readablestream-from.name: ReadableStream.from()

reading-flow.description: The reading-flow CSS property sets the order in which flex or grid elements are rendered to speech or reached via focus navigation. The reading-order property overrides this order.
reading-flow.description_html: The reading-flow CSS property sets the order in which flex or grid elements are rendered to speech or reached via focus navigation. The reading-order property overrides this order.
reading-flow.name: reading-flow

referrer-policy.description: The Referrer-Policy HTTP header and referrerpolicy HTML attributes control whether requests have the Referer header and what information the header contains.
referrer-policy.description_html: The Referrer-Policy HTTP header and referrerpolicy HTML attributes control whether requests have the Referer header and what information the header contains.
referrer-policy.name: Referrer policy

regexp.description: The RegExp object represents a regular expression, a notation for matching text patterns.
regexp.description_html: The RegExp object represents a regular expression, a notation for matching text patterns.
regexp.name: Regular expressions

regexp-compile.description: The compile() method of RegExp objects recompiles an existing regular expression object using a new pattern and flags.
regexp-compile.description_html: The compile() method of RegExp objects recompiles an existing regular expression object using a new pattern and flags.
regexp-compile.name: RegExp compile()

regexp-escape.description: The RegExp.escape() static method takes a string and replaces any characters that are potentially special characters of a regular expression with equivalent escape sequences. For example, RegExp.escape("[abc]") returns "\\[abc\\]".
regexp-escape.description_html: The RegExp.escape() static method takes a string and replaces any characters that are potentially special characters of a regular expression with equivalent escape sequences. For example, RegExp.escape("[abc]") returns "\\[abc\\]".
regexp-escape.name: RegExp.escape()

regexp-static-properties.description: The RegExp object has several static properties to access the input and results of the most-recent regular expression match.
regexp-static-properties.description_html: The RegExp object has several static properties to access the input and results of the most-recent regular expression match.
regexp-static-properties.name: RegExp static properties

region-capture.description: When using navigator.mediaDevices.getDisplayMedia() to capture a browser tab as a video stream, the region capture API allows you to crop the video to the bounding box of a given element. In contrast to the element capture API, any content that overlays that element is also captured.
region-capture.description_html: When using navigator.mediaDevices.getDisplayMedia() to capture a browser tab as a video stream, the region capture API allows you to crop the video to the bounding box of a given element. In contrast to the element capture API, any content that overlays that element is also captured.
region-capture.name: Region capture

registered-custom-properties.description: The CSS.registerProperty() static method and the @property CSS at-rule register custom properties for which types and behaviors can be defined.
registered-custom-properties.description_html: The CSS.registerProperty() static method and the @property CSS at-rule register custom properties for which types and behaviors can be defined.
registered-custom-properties.name: Registered custom properties

registerprotocolhandler.description: The navigator.registerProtocolHandler() method declares a site's ability to handle an address scheme (also known as a protocol). For example, an email site can register to open mailto: URLs or a VoIP site to open tel: URLs.
registerprotocolhandler.description_html: The navigator.registerProtocolHandler() method declares a site's ability to handle an address scheme (also known as a protocol). For example, an email site can register to open mailto: URLs or a VoIP site to open tel: URLs.
registerprotocolhandler.name: registerProtocolHandler

relative-color.description: The from keyword for color functions (color(), hsl(), oklch(), etc.) creates a new color based on a given color by modifying the values of the input color. Also known as relative color syntax (RCS).
relative-color.description_html: The from keyword for color functions (color(), hsl(), oklch(), etc.) creates a new color based on a given color by modifying the values of the input color. Also known as relative color syntax (RCS).
relative-color.name: Relative colors

relative-positioning.description: The position: relative CSS declaration offsets the position of an element relative to its position in the normal flow.
relative-positioning.description_html: The position: relative CSS declaration offsets the position of an element relative to its position in the normal flow.
relative-positioning.name: Relative positioning

rem.description: The rem CSS length unit is a font-relative length that is equal to the font size of the root HTML element which for most browsers is 16px.
rem.description_html: The rem CSS length unit is a font-relative length that is equal to the font size of the root HTML element which for most browsers is 16px.
rem.name: rem

remote-playback.description: The Remote Playback API initiates and controls playback of media on connected remote devices, such as smart TVs with AirPlay or Chromecast capabilities.
remote-playback.description_html: The Remote Playback API initiates and controls playback of media on connected remote devices, such as smart TVs with AirPlay or Chromecast capabilities.
remote-playback.name: Remote playback

reporting.description: The Reporting-Endpoints HTTP header and ReportingObserver() API send reports of Content Security Policy (CSP) violations, Permissions-Policy violations, deprecated feature usage, browser interventions, and crashes to a nominated URL or callback function.
reporting.description_html: The Reporting-Endpoints HTTP header and ReportingObserver() API send reports of Content Security Policy (CSP) violations, Permissions-Policy violations, deprecated feature usage, browser interventions, and crashes to a nominated URL or callback function.
reporting.name: Reporting API

request-animation-frame.description: The requestAnimationFrame() method schedules a function that runs before the next repaint. You can use it to animate content with JavaScript.
request-animation-frame.description_html: The requestAnimationFrame() method schedules a function that runs before the next repaint. You can use it to animate content with JavaScript.
request-animation-frame.name: requestAnimationFrame()

request-animation-frame-workers.description: The requestAnimationFrame() method in workers schedules a function that runs before the next repaint. Together with offscreen canvas, you can animate content from a worker.
request-animation-frame-workers.description_html: The requestAnimationFrame() method in workers schedules a function that runs before the next repaint. Together with offscreen canvas, you can animate content from a worker.
request-animation-frame-workers.name: requestAnimationFrame() in workers

request-video-frame-callback.description: The requestVideoFrameCallback() method for <video> schedules a function that runs with the next video frame. It is similar to requestAnimationFrame(), but for video.
request-video-frame-callback.description_html: The requestVideoFrameCallback() method for <video> schedules a function that runs with the next video frame. It is similar to requestAnimationFrame(), but for video.
request-video-frame-callback.name: requestVideoFrameCallback()

requestclose.description: The requestClose() method of a <dialog> HTML element closes the dialog, firing a cancel event first, which listeners can use to prevent the dialog from closing. This differs from the close() method, which only fires the non-cancelable close event.
requestclose.description_html: The requestClose() method of a <dialog> HTML element closes the dialog, firing a cancel event first, which listeners can use to prevent the dialog from closing. This differs from the close() method, which only fires the non-cancelable close event.
requestclose.name: dialog.requestClose()

requestidlecallback.description: The requestIdleCallback() API queues a function that runs in idle browser time, either at the end of a frame or when the user is inactive. Also known as the background tasks API.
requestidlecallback.description_html: The requestIdleCallback() API queues a function that runs in idle browser time, either at the end of a frame or when the user is inactive. Also known as the background tasks API.
requestidlecallback.name: requestIdleCallback()

resizable-buffers.description: The resize() method of an ArrayBuffer and the grow() method of a SharedArrayBuffer, constructed with the maxByteLength option, changes the size of the buffer in place.
resizable-buffers.description_html: The resize() method of an ArrayBuffer and the grow() method of a SharedArrayBuffer, constructed with the maxByteLength option, changes the size of the buffer in place.
resizable-buffers.name: Resizable buffers

resize.description: The resize CSS property sets whether an element can be resized by the user, and on which axes.
resize.description_html: The resize CSS property sets whether an element can be resized by the user, and on which axes.
resize.name: resize (CSS property)

resize-observer.description: The ResizeObserver API observes and reacts to changes in the size of DOM elements.
resize-observer.description_html: The ResizeObserver API observes and reacts to changes in the size of DOM elements.
resize-observer.name: Resize observer

resolution.description: The resolution CSS media query sets styles based on the pixel density, or how many pixels a device uses to display a single CSS pixel.
resolution.description_html: The resolution CSS media query sets styles based on the pixel density, or how many pixels a device uses to display a single CSS pixel.
resolution.name: resolution media query

resolution-compat.description: The -webkit-device-pixel-ratio, -webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio, and -webkit-max-device-pixel-ratio CSS media queries are standardized compatibility alternatives to resolution media queries.
resolution-compat.description_html: The -webkit-device-pixel-ratio, -webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio, and -webkit-max-device-pixel-ratio CSS media queries are standardized compatibility alternatives to resolution media queries.
resolution-compat.name: resolution media query (compatibility prefixes)

resource-size.description: The decodedBodySize, encodedBodySize, and transferSize properties of the PerformanceResourceTiming API reports the size of resources loaded.
resource-size.description_html: The decodedBodySize, encodedBodySize, and transferSize properties of the PerformanceResourceTiming API reports the size of resources loaded.
resource-size.name: Resource size

resource-timing.description: PerformanceResourceTiming entries report when network events happen while loading a resource, such as when connections start and end. You can use this information to measure loading times.
resource-timing.description_html: PerformanceResourceTiming entries report when network events happen while loading a resource, such as when connections start and end. You can use this information to measure loading times.
resource-timing.name: Resource timing

revert-value.description: The revert CSS keyword resets any property to its previous default, provided by either the user or browser stylesheets. For example, setting display: revert on a <div> will likely result in display: block, the browser default style. This is often confused with initial.
revert-value.description_html: The revert CSS keyword resets any property to its previous default, provided by either the user or browser stylesheets. For example, setting display: revert on a <div> will likely result in display: block, the browser default style. This is often confused with initial.
revert-value.name: revert

rex.description: The rex CSS length unit is a font-relative length that is equal to the x-height of the root element.
rex.description_html: The rex CSS length unit is a font-relative length that is equal to the x-height of the root element.
rex.name: rex unit

rgb.description: The rgb(), rgba(), and hexadecimal (as in #004488ff) notations pick colors using red, green, blue, and alpha (transparency) channels.
rgb.description_html: The rgb(), rgba(), and hexadecimal (as in #004488ff) notations pick colors using red, green, blue, and alpha (transparency) channels.
rgb.name: RGB

rhythmic-sizing.description: The line-height-step CSS property creates consistent vertical rhythm by setting the spacing between body text baselines. It rounds taller lines like headings up to the next multiple of the body text spacing.
rhythmic-sizing.description_html: The line-height-step CSS property creates consistent vertical rhythm by setting the spacing between body text baselines. It rounds taller lines like headings up to the next multiple of the body text spacing.
rhythmic-sizing.name: Rhythmic sizing

ric.description: The ric CSS length unit, or root international character, is a font-relative length equal to the width of CJK character relative to the root element.
ric.description_html: The ric CSS length unit, or root international character, is a font-relative length equal to the width of CJK character relative to the root element.
ric.name: ric unit

rlh.description: The rlh CSS length unit is a font-relative length relative to the line height of root element.
rlh.description_html: The rlh CSS length unit is a font-relative length relative to the line height of root element.
rlh.name: rlh unit

root.description: The :root pseudo-class matches the root element of the document, usually the <html> element.
root.description_html: The :root pseudo-class matches the root element of the document, usually the <html> element.
root.name: :root

round-mod-rem.description: The round(), mod(), and rem() CSS functions compute rounded values and the remainder after division.
round-mod-rem.description_html: The round(), mod(), and rem() CSS functions compute rounded values and the remainder after division.
round-mod-rem.name: round(), mod(), and rem()

ruby.description: The <ruby> element produces small annotations that are rendered with its base text.
ruby.description_html: The <ruby> element produces small annotations that are rendered with its base text.
ruby.name: <ruby>

ruby-align.description: The ruby-align CSS property sets the spacing and alignment of ruby annotation text when it does not fill its available space.
ruby-align.description_html: The ruby-align CSS property sets the spacing and alignment of ruby annotation text when it does not fill its available space.
ruby-align.name: ruby-align

ruby-overhang.description: The ruby-overhang CSS property sets whether ruby annotations may overlap adjacent text.
ruby-overhang.description_html: The ruby-overhang CSS property sets whether ruby annotations may overlap adjacent text.
ruby-overhang.name: ruby-overhang

ruby-position.description: The ruby-position CSS property sets the position of a ruby annotation in relation to its base text. Annotations can display over, under, or interleaved with the base text.
ruby-position.description_html: The ruby-position CSS property sets the position of a ruby annotation in relation to its base text. Annotations can display over, under, or interleaved with the base text.
ruby-position.name: ruby-position

s.description: The <s> HTML element indicates text that is no longer relevant or accurate, styling text as strikethrough by default.
s.description_html: The <s> HTML element indicates text that is no longer relevant or accurate, styling text as strikethrough by default.
s.name: <s>

safe-area-inset.description: The safe-area-inset- CSS environment variables represent a rectangle that cannot cut off content within a non-rectangular screen. For example, top:\ env(safe-area-inset-top); positions the top of an element below the notch on an iPhone.
safe-area-inset.description_html: The safe-area-inset- CSS environment variables represent a rectangle that cannot cut off content within a non-rectangular screen. For example, top:\ env(safe-area-inset-top); positions the top of an element below the notch on an iPhone.
safe-area-inset.name: Safe area inset environment variables

samp.description: The <samp> element represents a sample or quoted output from a computer program. Styled in a monospace font by default.
samp.description_html: The <samp> element represents a sample or quoted output from a computer program. Styled in a monospace font by default.
samp.name: <samp>

sanitizer.description: The Document.parseHTML() static method and the setHTML() method of Element and ShadowRoot objects parse and insert HTML into the DOM in a way that can prevent cross-site scripting attacks. The Sanitizer API can customize the sanitization process.
sanitizer.description_html: The Document.parseHTML() static method and the setHTML() method of Element and ShadowRoot objects parse and insert HTML into the DOM in a way that can prevent cross-site scripting attacks. The Sanitizer API can customize the sanitization process.
sanitizer.name: Sanitizer API

savedata.description: Browsers send the Save-Data HTTP request header when the user turns on a data-saving mode. It is a hint to reduce data sent to the browser. Servers should respond with alternative content, such as smaller images and videos, or different markup and styling.
savedata.description_html: Browsers send the Save-Data HTTP request header when the user turns on a data-saving mode. It is a hint to reduce data sent to the browser. Servers should respond with alternative content, such as smaller images and videos, or different markup and styling.
savedata.name: Save-Data

scheduler.description: The scheduler API provides a way to prioritize all tasks belonging to an application.
scheduler.description_html: The scheduler API provides a way to prioritize all tasks belonging to an application.
scheduler.name: Scheduler API

scope.description: The @scope CSS at-rule sets the scope for a group of rules.
scope.description_html: The @scope CSS at-rule sets the scope for a group of rules.
scope.name: @scope

scope-pseudo.description: The :scope CSS pseudo-class matches the scoping root, for instance the element that querySelector() is called on, or the root of a DOM subtree specified with @scope.
scope-pseudo.description_html: The :scope CSS pseudo-class matches the scoping root, for instance the element that querySelector() is called on, or the root of a DOM subtree specified with @scope.
scope-pseudo.name: :scope (pseudo-class)

scoped-custom-element-registries.description: The CustomElementRegistry() constructor creates a new custom element registry that's separate from the global window.customElements registry. Creating more than one registry is useful for multiple custom elements that have the same tag name to coexist.
scoped-custom-element-registries.description_html: The CustomElementRegistry() constructor creates a new custom element registry that's separate from the global window.customElements registry. Creating more than one registry is useful for multiple custom elements that have the same tag name to coexist.
scoped-custom-element-registries.name: Scoped custom element registries

screen.description: The window.screen property contains information about the screen of the output device that the referenced window is being rendered on.
screen.description_html: The window.screen property contains information about the screen of the output device that the referenced window is being rendered on.
screen.name: Screen

screen-capture.description: The navigator.mediaDevices.getDisplayMedia() method asks the user to choose a screen or portion of a screen (such as a window) to capture as a media stream.
screen-capture.description_html: The navigator.mediaDevices.getDisplayMedia() method asks the user to choose a screen or portion of a screen (such as a window) to capture as a media stream.
screen-capture.name: Screen capture

screen-orientation.description: The screen.orientation API gets information about the orientation of the viewport, such as landscape or portrait. With this API, you can adapt an application's layout or behavior in response to changes in orientation.
screen-orientation.description_html: The screen.orientation API gets information about the orientation of the viewport, such as landscape or portrait. With this API, you can adapt an application's layout or behavior in response to changes in orientation.
screen-orientation.name: Screen orientation

screen-orientation-lock.description: The screen.orientation.lock() method prevents changes to the screen orientation, typically in fullscreen applications such as games. For example, while locked, rotating a phone to the side won't change the screen orientation from landscape to portrait.
screen-orientation-lock.description_html: The screen.orientation.lock() method prevents changes to the screen orientation, typically in fullscreen applications such as games. For example, while locked, rotating a phone to the side won't change the screen orientation from landscape to portrait.
screen-orientation-lock.name: Screen orientation lock

screen-wake-lock.description: The navigator.wakeLock.request("screen") API prevents the device's screen from dimming or being turned off.
screen-wake-lock.description_html: The navigator.wakeLock.request("screen") API prevents the device's screen from dimming or being turned off.
screen-wake-lock.name: Screen wake lock

script.description: The <script> element contains or loads data or executable code. This is typically used to load JavaScript code. The <noscript> element represents alternative content to show when scripting is not allowed.
script.description_html: The <script> element contains or loads data or executable code. This is typically used to load JavaScript code. The <noscript> element represents alternative content to show when scripting is not allowed.
script.name: <script> and <noscript>

scripting.description: The scripting CSS media query sets styles based on whether scripting such as JavaScript is available. Values are enabled if scripting is available, initial-only if scripting is only available on page load (for example, printed content), or none.
scripting.description_html: The scripting CSS media query sets styles based on whether scripting such as JavaScript is available. Values are enabled if scripting is available, initial-only if scripting is only available on page load (for example, printed content), or none.
scripting.name: scripting media query

scroll-behavior.description: The scroll-behavior CSS property controls whether scrolling is smooth or snaps, for scroll actions not performed by the user such as those triggered by navigation.
scroll-behavior.description_html: The scroll-behavior CSS property controls whether scrolling is smooth or snaps, for scroll actions not performed by the user such as those triggered by navigation.
scroll-behavior.name: scroll-behavior

scroll-buttons.description: The ::scroll-button(<dir>) CSS pseudo-element is a focusable button which scrolls its originating scroll container element in the specified direction.
scroll-buttons.description_html: The ::scroll-button(<dir>) CSS pseudo-element is a focusable button which scrolls its originating scroll container element in the specified direction.
scroll-buttons.name: ::scroll-button

scroll-driven-animations.description: The animation-timeline, scroll-timeline, and view-timeline CSS properties advance animations based on the user's scroll position.
scroll-driven-animations.description_html: The animation-timeline, scroll-timeline, and view-timeline CSS properties advance animations based on the user's scroll position.
scroll-driven-animations.name: Scroll-driven animations

scroll-elements.description: The scroll() and scrollBy() methods change the scroll position of overflow content within an element. Similar to setting scrollTop and scrollLeft properties, but with options setting whether the scroll should animate smoothly or jump. Note that scrollTo() is an alias for scroll().
scroll-elements.description_html: The scroll() and scrollBy() methods change the scroll position of overflow content within an element. Similar to setting scrollTop and scrollLeft properties, but with options setting whether the scroll should animate smoothly or jump. Note that scrollTo() is an alias for scroll().
scroll-elements.name: Scroll methods on elements

scroll-initial-target.description: The scroll-initial-target: nearest CSS declaration sets the initial scroll position of its scroll container to the top of the element, much like scrolling to a URL fragment.
scroll-initial-target.description_html: The scroll-initial-target: nearest CSS declaration sets the initial scroll position of its scroll container to the top of the element, much like scrolling to a URL fragment.
scroll-initial-target.name: scroll-initial-target

scroll-into-view.description: The scrollIntoView() method scrolls an element's ancestor containers such that the element is visible to the user.
scroll-into-view.description_html: The scrollIntoView() method scrolls an element's ancestor containers such that the element is visible to the user.
scroll-into-view.name: scrollIntoView()

scroll-markers.description: A scroll container can be navigated by activating ::scroll-marker pseudo-elements which appear in a generated ::scroll-marker-group pseudo-element, either before or after the scroll container.
scroll-markers.description_html: A scroll container can be navigated by activating ::scroll-marker pseudo-elements which appear in a generated ::scroll-marker-group pseudo-element, either before or after the scroll container.
scroll-markers.name: Scroll markers

scroll-snap.description: CSS scroll snap controls the panning and scrolling behavior within a scroll container.
scroll-snap.description_html: CSS scroll snap controls the panning and scrolling behavior within a scroll container.
scroll-snap.name: Scroll snap

scroll-snap-events.description: The scrollsnapchanging and scrollsnapchange events fire when a scroll gesture changes the selected scroll snap target.
scroll-snap-events.description_html: The scrollsnapchanging and scrollsnapchange events fire when a scroll gesture changes the selected scroll snap target.
scroll-snap-events.name: Scroll snap events

scroll-to-text-fragment.description: Text fragments are URL fragments on the form #:~:text=snippet and link to a snippet of text within a page. The browser may scroll, highlight, or otherwise bring that text to the reader's attention.
scroll-to-text-fragment.description_html: Text fragments are URL fragments on the form #:~:text=snippet and link to a snippet of text within a page. The browser may scroll, highlight, or otherwise bring that text to the reader's attention.
scroll-to-text-fragment.name: Scroll to text fragment

scrollbar-color.description: The scrollbar-color CSS property sets the color of the scrollbar track and thumb.
scrollbar-color.description_html: The scrollbar-color CSS property sets the color of the scrollbar track and thumb.
scrollbar-color.name: scrollbar-color

scrollbar-gutter.description: The scrollbar-gutter CSS property reserves space for the scrollbar, preventing unwanted layout changes as the scrollbar appears and disappears.
scrollbar-gutter.description_html: The scrollbar-gutter CSS property reserves space for the scrollbar, preventing unwanted layout changes as the scrollbar appears and disappears.
scrollbar-gutter.name: scrollbar-gutter

scrollbar-width.description: The scrollbar-width CSS property sets the width of the scrollbar.
scrollbar-width.description_html: The scrollbar-width CSS property sets the width of the scrollbar.
scrollbar-width.name: scrollbar-width

scrollend.description: The scrollend event fires when an element or document has finished scrolling.
scrollend.description_html: The scrollend event fires when an element or document has finished scrolling.
scrollend.name: scrollend

search.description: The <search> HTML element is a container that represents the parts of the web page with search functionality.
search.description_html: The <search> HTML element is a container that represents the parts of the web page with search functionality.
search.name: <search>

search-input-type.description: The <input type="search"> HTML element represents a text field for search queries.
search-input-type.description_html: The <input type="search"> HTML element represents a text field for search queries.
search-input-type.name: <input type="search">

section.description: The <section> element is a generic standalone section of a document, which doesn't have a more specific semantic element to represent it.
section.description_html: The <section> element is a generic standalone section of a document, which doesn't have a more specific semantic element to represent it.
section.name: <section>

secure-payment-confirmation.description: The payment extension of a web authentication credential allows a relying party (such as a bank) to create a credential that can be queried by any merchant origin as part of an online checkout that uses the Payment Request API's secure-payment-confirmation payment method. Also known as SPC.
secure-payment-confirmation.description_html: The payment extension of a web authentication credential allows a relying party (such as a bank) to create a credential that can be queried by any merchant origin as part of an online checkout that uses the Payment Request API's secure-payment-confirmation payment method. Also known as SPC.
secure-payment-confirmation.name: Secure payment confirmation

select.description: The <select> element provides a menu of options for a user to pick from, typically rendered as a dropdown list.
select.description_html: The <select> element provides a menu of options for a user to pick from, typically rendered as a dropdown list.
select.name: <select>

selection.description: The ::selection CSS pseudo-element selects text a user has highlighted.
selection.description_html: The ::selection CSS pseudo-element selects text a user has highlighted.
selection.name: ::selection

selection-api.description: The Selection API controls and modifies user text selections within the page.
selection-api.description_html: The Selection API controls and modifies user text selections within the page.
selection-api.name: Selection

selectors.description: CSS selectors match elements based on their type, attributes, and relationship to other elements. They define the specific elements to which a block of styles will be applied. This feature represents the oldest selectors of CSS.
selectors.description_html: CSS selectors match elements based on their type, attributes, and relationship to other elements. They define the specific elements to which a block of styles will be applied. This feature represents the oldest selectors of CSS.
selectors.name: Selectors (core)

serial.description: The navigator.serial API communicates with devices over serial ports, such as microcontrollers.
serial.description_html: The navigator.serial API communicates with devices over serial ports, such as microcontrollers.
serial.name: Web serial

serializable-errors.description: The DOMException, Error, EvalError, RangeError, ReferenceError, SyntaxError, TypeError, and URIError objects are serializable. You can call structuredClone() on an error object or pass it to a worker using postMessage().
serializable-errors.description_html: The DOMException, Error, EvalError, RangeError, ReferenceError, SyntaxError, TypeError, and URIError objects are serializable. You can call structuredClone() on an error object or pass it to a worker using postMessage().
serializable-errors.name: Serializable errors

server-sent-events.description: The EventSource API creates a connection to a server and listens to a stream of events sent by the server.
server-sent-events.description_html: The EventSource API creates a connection to a server and listens to a stream of events sent by the server.
server-sent-events.name: Server-sent events

server-timing.description: The serverTiming property of the PerformanceResourceTiming API contains server timing information about network requests.
server-timing.description_html: The serverTiming property of the PerformanceResourceTiming API contains server timing information about network requests.
server-timing.name: Server timing

service-workers.description: The service worker of a website is a script that runs in its own thread and which acts as local proxy that intercepts network requests from the website. Use a service worker to implement advanced caching strategies, offline support, background tasks, or push notification support on your website.
service-workers.description_html: The service worker of a website is a script that runs in its own thread and which acts as local proxy that intercepts network requests from the website. Use a service worker to implement advanced caching strategies, offline support, background tasks, or push notification support on your website.
service-workers.name: Service workers

set.description: Set objects store unique values of any type.
set.description_html: Set objects store unique values of any type.
set.name: Set (initial support)

set-methods.description: The difference(), intersection(), isDisjointFrom(), isSubsetOf(), isSupersetOf(), symmetricDifference(), and union() methods of the JavaScript Set object performs operations between two sets.
set-methods.description_html: The difference(), intersection(), isDisjointFrom(), isSubsetOf(), isSupersetOf(), symmetricDifference(), and union() methods of the JavaScript Set object performs operations between two sets.
set-methods.name: Set methods

setinterval.description: The setInterval() global function repeatedly executes provided code on a given delay, and the accompanying clearInterval() cancels the interval.
setinterval.description_html: The setInterval() global function repeatedly executes provided code on a given delay, and the accompanying clearInterval() cancels the interval.
setinterval.name: setInterval

settimeout.description: The setTimeout() global function executes provided code after a given duration of time, and the accompanying clearTimeout() cancels the timer.
settimeout.description_html: The setTimeout() global function executes provided code after a given duration of time, and the accompanying clearTimeout() cancels the timer.
settimeout.name: setTimeout()

shadow-dom.description: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
shadow-dom.description_html: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
shadow-dom.name: Shadow DOM

shadow-parts.description: The part and exportparts HTML attributes expose elements of a shadow DOM as named parts, which can be selected by the ::part() CSS pseudo-element for styling.
shadow-parts.description_html: The part and exportparts HTML attributes expose elements of a shadow DOM as named parts, which can be selected by the ::part() CSS pseudo-element for styling.
shadow-parts.name: Shadow parts

shape-outside.description: The shape-outside CSS property, along with shape-margin and shape-image-threshold, sets the shape around which adjacent content will wrap.
shape-outside.description_html: The shape-outside CSS property, along with shape-margin and shape-image-threshold, sets the shape around which adjacent content will wrap.
shape-outside.name: shape-outside

shapes.description: The circle(), ellipse(), inset(), polygon(), rect(), and xywh() CSS shape functions create shapes for use with clip-path and shape-outside.
shapes.description_html: The circle(), ellipse(), inset(), polygon(), rect(), and xywh() CSS shape functions create shapes for use with clip-path and shape-outside.
shapes.name: shapes

share.description: The navigator.share() method invokes the device's native sharing mechanism and passes text, links, files, and other content to share targets. Also known as the Web Share API.
share.description_html: The navigator.share() method invokes the device's native sharing mechanism and passes text, links, files, and other content to share targets. Also known as the Web Share API.
share.name: navigator.share()

shared-memory.description: The SharedArrayBuffer object represents bytes shared between multiple workers and the main thread. The Atomics object safely accesses SharedArrayBuffer data to make sure predictable values are read and written and that operations are not interrupted.
shared-memory.description_html: The SharedArrayBuffer object represents bytes shared between multiple workers and the main thread. The Atomics object safely accesses SharedArrayBuffer data to make sure predictable values are read and written and that operations are not interrupted.
shared-memory.name: SharedArrayBuffer and Atomics

shared-storage.description: The sharedStorage API stores data to a shared space where the data can then be processed without the ability to track users across the different sites they visit. A common use case is measuring the reach of third-party ads without using user-tracking cookies."
shared-storage.description_html: The sharedStorage API stores data to a shared space where the data can then be processed without the ability to track users across the different sites they visit. A common use case is measuring the reach of third-party ads without using user-tracking cookies."
shared-storage.name: Shared storage

shared-storage-locks.description: The withLock option to set(), append(), delete(), clear(), and batchUpdate() methods of the sharedStorage API prevents duplicate reporting from cross-site race conditions.
shared-storage-locks.description_html: The withLock option to set(), append(), delete(), clear(), and batchUpdate() methods of the sharedStorage API prevents duplicate reporting from cross-site race conditions.
shared-storage-locks.name: Shared storage locks

shared-workers.description: The SharedWorker() constructor runs a script in its own thread, which can send and receive messages with other scripts running at the same origin.
shared-workers.description_html: The SharedWorker() constructor runs a script in its own thread, which can send and receive messages with other scripts running at the same origin.
shared-workers.name: Shared worker

show-picker-input.description: The showPicker() method for <input> elements shows the user interface for picking a value. For example, for <input type="date"> it shows the interface for picking a date.
show-picker-input.description_html: The showPicker() method for <input> elements shows the user interface for picking a value. For example, for <input type="date"> it shows the interface for picking a date.
show-picker-input.name: showPicker() for <input>

show-picker-select.description: The showPicker() method for <select> elements shows the dropdown menu or other user interface for picking one of the options.
show-picker-select.description_html: The showPicker() method for <select> elements shows the dropdown menu or other user interface for picking one of the options.
show-picker-select.name: showPicker() for <select>

sibling-count.description: The sibling-count() and sibling-index() CSS functions return integers that are useful to style elements based on their positions among siblings or on the number of siblings, for example as part of a calc() expression.
sibling-count.description_html: The sibling-count() and sibling-index() CSS functions return integers that are useful to style elements based on their positions among siblings or on the number of siblings, for example as part of a calc() expression.
sibling-count.name: sibling-count() and sibling-index()

sizes-auto.description: The sizes="auto" attribute for the HTML element reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts. This attribute only applies to images with the loading="lazy" attribute.
sizes-auto.description_html: The sizes="auto" attribute for the <img> HTML element reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts. This attribute only applies to images with the loading="lazy" attribute.

slot.description: The <slot> HTML element is a placeholder inside a web component where consumers of the component can insert their own markup.
slot.description_html: The <slot> HTML element is a placeholder inside a web component where consumers of the component can insert their own markup.
slot.name: <slot>

slot-assign.description: The assign() method for <slot> elements assigns nodes to the slot, as an alternative to using the slot and name HTML attributes. The nodes must be children of a shadow host and the shadow root must be created with the slotAssignment set to "manual". Also known as manual slot assignment.
slot-assign.description_html: The assign() method for <slot> elements assigns nodes to the slot, as an alternative to using the slot and name HTML attributes. The nodes must be children of a shadow host and the shadow root must be created with the slotAssignment set to "manual". Also known as manual slot assignment.
slot-assign.name: Imperative slot assignment

small.description: The <small> element represents side-comments and small print, like copyright and legal text, independent of its styled presentation. Styled in a reduced font size by default.
small.description_html: The <small> element represents side-comments and small print, like copyright and legal text, independent of its styled presentation. Styled in a reduced font size by default.
small.name: <small>

smil-svg-animations.description: The <animate>, <animateMotion>, and <animateTransform> SVG elements declaratively animate SVG elements. Also known as SMIL.
smil-svg-animations.description_html: The <animate>, <animateMotion>, and <animateTransform> SVG elements declaratively animate SVG elements. Also known as SMIL.
smil-svg-animations.name: SMIL SVG animations

smooth.description: The image-rendering: smooth CSS declaration scales images while retaining a gradual color blending that is useful for photos.
smooth.description_html: The image-rendering: smooth CSS declaration scales images while retaining a gradual color blending that is useful for photos.
smooth.name: smooth

source.description: The <source> element sets a media resource for the <picture>, <video>, and <audio> elements.
source.description_html: The <source> element sets a media resource for the <picture>, <video>, and <audio> elements.
source.name: <source>

sourcemap-header.description: The Sourcemap HTTP response header links generated code to a source map, so the browser shows the original source in a debugger. This makes it easier to work with minified or transpiled code.
sourcemap-header.description_html: The Sourcemap HTTP response header links generated code to a source map, so the browser shows the original source in a debugger. This makes it easier to work with minified or transpiled code.
sourcemap-header.name: Sourcemap header

span.description: The <span> HTML element is the generic inline container for content.
span.description_html: The <span> HTML element is the generic inline container for content.
span.name: <span>

speak.description: The speak CSS property sets whether or not text should be spoken.
speak.description_html: The speak CSS property sets whether or not text should be spoken.
speak.name: speak

speak-as.description: The speak-as CSS property sets how any element's content is spoken. Not to be confused with the speak-as descriptor of @counter-style at-rules.
speak-as.description_html: The speak-as CSS property sets how any element's content is spoken. Not to be confused with the speak-as descriptor of @counter-style at-rules.
speak-as.name: speak-as

speculation-rules.description: Speculation rules are hints to the browser to proactively download pages in the background so they appear instantly when the user navigates to them.
speculation-rules.description_html: Speculation rules are hints to the browser to proactively download pages in the background so they appear instantly when the user navigates to them.
speculation-rules.name: Speculation rules

speech-recognition.description: The SpeechRecognition API converts audio into text using the device's speech recognition service.
speech-recognition.description_html: The SpeechRecognition API converts audio into text using the device's speech recognition service.
speech-recognition.name: Speech recognition

speech-recognition-grammar.description: The SpeechRecognition.grammars property of the Web Speech API represents a set of words or patterns of words that the recognition service should recognize, used for when the recognition service's accuracy is low. This feature has been removed due to advancements in speech recognition.
speech-recognition-grammar.description_html: The SpeechRecognition.grammars property of the Web Speech API represents a set of words or patterns of words that the recognition service should recognize, used for when the recognition service's accuracy is low. This feature has been removed due to advancements in speech recognition.
speech-recognition-grammar.name: Speech recognition grammar

speech-synthesis.description: The SpeechSynthesis API converts text to speech with artificial voices.
speech-synthesis.description_html: The SpeechSynthesis API converts text to speech with artificial voices.
speech-synthesis.name: Speech synthesis

spellcheck.description: The spellcheck global HTML attribute sets whether the browser may check an element for spelling errors.
spellcheck.description_html: The spellcheck global HTML attribute sets whether the browser may check an element for spelling errors.
spellcheck.name: spellcheck

spelling-grammar-error.description: The ::spelling-error and ::grammar-error CSS pseudo-elements match text that is highlighted as misspelled and grammatically incorrect, respectively.
spelling-grammar-error.description_html: The ::spelling-error and ::grammar-error CSS pseudo-elements match text that is highlighted as misspelled and grammatically incorrect, respectively.
spelling-grammar-error.name: ::spelling-error and ::grammar-error

spread.description: The spread (...) syntax allows an iterable, such as an array or string, to be expanded in places where zero or more arguments (for function calls) or elements (for array literals) are expected.
spread.description_html: The spread (...) syntax allows an iterable, such as an array or string, to be expanded in places where zero or more arguments (for function calls) or elements (for array literals) are expected.
spread.name: Spread syntax

srcset.description: The srcset and sizes attributes for elements set a list of possible sources for the image and a corresponding list of size conditions for choosing a source, to show a responsive image that fits the size of the display.
srcset.description_html: The srcset and sizes attributes for <img> elements set a list of possible sources for the image and a corresponding list of size conditions for choosing a source, to show a responsive image that fits the size of the display.
srcset.name: srcset and sizes

starting-style.description: The @starting-style CSS at-rule sets the starting values for properties that are transitioning when the target element's style is first updated.
starting-style.description_html: The @starting-style CSS at-rule sets the starting values for properties that are transitioning when the target element's style is first updated.
starting-style.name: @starting-style

state.description: The :state() CSS pseudo-class matches custom elements based on their custom state, set through the ElementInternals.states API.
state.description_html: The :state() CSS pseudo-class matches custom elements based on their custom state, set through the ElementInternals.states API.
state.name: :state()

static-positioning.description: The position: static CSS declaration positions an element in the normal flow. A statically positioned element ignores physical and logical properties such as top or inset-block-start.
static-positioning.description_html: The position: static CSS declaration positions an element in the normal flow. A statically positioned element ignores physical and logical properties such as top or inset-block-start.
static-positioning.name: Static positioning

steps-easing.description: The steps() CSS easing function divides an animation or transition into equidistant intervals, jumping from value to value. The step-start and step-end keyword values are presets with a single interval.
steps-easing.description_html: The steps() CSS easing function divides an animation or transition into equidistant intervals, jumping from value to value. The step-start and step-end keyword values are presets with a single interval.
steps-easing.name: steps() easing

sticky-positioning.description: The position: sticky CSS declaration positions an element in the normal flow until it crosses a specified threshold, at which points it becomes fixed (stuck) at that position.
sticky-positioning.description_html: The position: sticky CSS declaration positions an element in the normal flow until it crosses a specified threshold, at which points it becomes fixed (stuck) at that position.
sticky-positioning.name: Sticky positioning

storage-access.description: The document.requestStorageAccess() method allows content in iframes to request storing and reading cookies and other site data, while the document.hasStorageAccess() method checks if such access is granted.
storage-access.description_html: The document.requestStorageAccess() method allows content in iframes to request storing and reading cookies and other site data, while the document.hasStorageAccess() method checks if such access is granted.
storage-access.name: Storage access

storage-buckets.description: The navigator.storageBuckets API allows you to organize locally stored data into groups called storage buckets. Each bucket can have different settings, allowing the browser to manage and delete buckets independently rather than applying the same treatment to all.
storage-buckets.description_html: The navigator.storageBuckets API allows you to organize locally stored data into groups called storage buckets. Each bucket can have different settings, allowing the browser to manage and delete buckets independently rather than applying the same treatment to all.
storage-buckets.name: Storage buckets

storage-manager.description: The navigator.storage API provides information about the availability and persistence of the data that a site stores on the device, by using APIs such as the Cache API or the IndexedDB API.
storage-manager.description_html: The navigator.storage API provides information about the availability and persistence of the data that a site stores on the device, by using APIs such as the Cache API or the IndexedDB API.
storage-manager.name: Storage manager

streams.description: The streams API creates, composes, and consumes continuously generated data.
streams.description_html: The streams API creates, composes, and consumes continuously generated data.
streams.name: Streams

stretch.description: The stretch CSS keyword expands a box as needed to fit its contents until the maximum size is reached, without preserving the content's preferred aspect ratio.
stretch.description_html: The stretch CSS keyword expands a box as needed to fit its contents until the maximum size is reached, without preserving the content's preferred aspect ratio.
stretch.name: stretch

string-at.description: The at() method of strings returns the character (one UTF-16 code unit) at an index, including negative indices for getting the character relative to the end of the string. Also known as the relative indexing method.

string-codepoint.description: The codePointAt() method returns the numeric value of the UTF-16 code point at an index of the string. The fromCodePoint() method returns a string created from one or more code points.

string-matchall.description: The matchAll() method of strings matches a string against a regular expression and returns an iterator of all results, including capturing groups.

string-normalize.description: The normalize() method of strings returns a Unicode normal form of a string as a new string. More than one code point sequence can represent the same characters. You can use the normalize() method to find canonically or compatibly equivalent strings.

string-pad.description: The padStart() and padEnd() methods of strings return a string lengthened to a minimum number of characters by adding characters to the start or end of the string.

string-raw.description: The String.raw() static method interpolates template literal substitutions, but ignores escape sequences. It is the tag function for template literals.
string-raw.description_html: The String.raw() static method interpolates template literal substitutions, but ignores escape sequences. It is the tag function for template literals.

string-replaceall.description: The replaceAll() method of strings returns a new string where all matches of a pattern (a string or regular expression) have been substituted with a replacement string.

string-wellformed.description: The isWellFormed() method of strings returns a boolean indicating if the string contains any Unicode lone surrogates. The toWellFormed() method returns a new string where all lone surrogates are replaced by the Unicode replacement character.

strong.description: The <strong> HTML element brings attention to the content, styling text as bold by default.

structured-clone.description: The structuredClone() global method creates a deep copy of an object. Values that cannot be cloned can instead be transferred, making the original value no longer usable.

style.description: The <style> element embeds an inline CSS stylesheet in a document.

sub-sup.description: The <sub> and <sup> elements sets inline text to be displayed as subscript or superscript for solely typographical reasons.

table-discouraged.description: Attributes and properties of table elements, such as align, vAlign, noWrap, bgcolor, or char set various visual presentation properties of the table and its sections and cells. These are obsolete, and some of them have no effect. Use CSS instead.

text-align.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal placement of the inner content of a block element.

text-box.description: The text-box CSS property sets the spacing above and below text based on a font's typographic features. For example, text-box: trim-both ex alphabetic trims the top to the top of the letter x and the bottom to the bottom of most letters, without descenders.

text-combine-upright.description: The text-combine-upright CSS property displays multiple characters in the space of a single character in vertical text. This is used in East Asian documents to display Latin-based strings such as components of a date or letters of an initialism.

For example, text-underline-position: under places the underline below the text, avoiding crossing descenders. The underline may be further adjusted by the text-underline-offset property.

Since it's not often available to touch-only, keyboard-only, or assistive technology users, it's not a substitute for other text.
