typed-array-iterators.description_html: Typed arrays are iterable with the for of statement and enumerable with the methods entries(), keys(), and values().
typed-array-iterators.name: Typed array iterators

typed-arrays.description: Typed arrays are ordered lists of JavaScript values, where all values are of the same numerical type, such as 8-bit integers or 32-bit floating point numbers.
typed-arrays.description_html: Typed arrays are ordered lists of JavaScript values, where all values are of the same numerical type, such as 8-bit integers or 32-bit floating point numbers.
typed-arrays.name: Typed arrays (initial support)

u.description: The <u> HTML element makes non-textual annotations, styling text as underlined by default.
u.description_html: The <u> HTML element makes non-textual annotations, styling text as underlined by default.
u.name: <u>

ua-client-hints.description: The Sec-CH-UA HTTP request header and the navigator.userAgentData API expose browser and platform information used to vary responses and application logic. User agent client hints are similar to user agent strings but more privacy-preserving and safer to parse.
ua-client-hints.description_html: The Sec-CH-UA HTTP request header and the navigator.userAgentData API expose browser and platform information used to vary responses and application logic. User agent client hints are similar to user agent strings but more privacy-preserving and safer to parse.
ua-client-hints.name: User agent client hints

uint8array-base64-hex.description: The Uint8Array object methods fromBase64(), toBase64(), and setFromBase64() convert to and from base64 strings. The fromHex(), toHex(), and setFromHex() methods convert to and from hex strings.
uint8array-base64-hex.description_html: The Uint8Array object methods fromBase64(), toBase64(), and setFromBase64() convert to and from base64 strings. The fromHex(), toHex(), and setFromHex() methods convert to and from hex strings.
uint8array-base64-hex.name: Uint8Array base64 and hex conversion

unicode-point-escapes.description: Unicode point escapes (\\u{}) represent Unicode characters within strings.
unicode-point-escapes.description_html: Unicode point escapes (\\u{}) represent Unicode characters within strings.
unicode-point-escapes.name: Unicode point escapes

unset-value.description: The unset keyword resets any CSS property, removing any values previously set by the author, user, or browser. Inherited properties (like color) reset to the parent element's computed value. Non-inherited properties (like display) reset to the specified initial value (inline).
unset-value.description_html: The unset keyword resets any CSS property, removing any values previously set by the author, user, or browser. Inherited properties (like color) reset to the parent element's computed value. Non-inherited properties (like display) reset to the specified initial value (inline).
unset-value.name: unset

update.description: The update CSS media query sets styles based on whether and how fast the user's device can modify display after it has been rendered. For example, you can avoid animations on devices that aren't fast enough to display them smoothly.
update.description_html: The update CSS media query sets styles based on whether and how fast the user's device can modify display after it has been rendered. For example, you can avoid animations on devices that aren't fast enough to display them smoothly.
update.name: Update frequency media query

upgrade-insecure-requests.description: The Upgrade-Insecure-Requests HTTP request header tells the server that the response should redirect to a secure (HTTPS) resource.
upgrade-insecure-requests.description_html: The Upgrade-Insecure-Requests HTTP request header tells the server that the response should redirect to a secure (HTTPS) resource.
upgrade-insecure-requests.name: Upgrade insecure requests

url.description: A URL object represents a web address, like https://example.com/, and parts of the address, such as the domain, path, and query string (as URLSearchParams).
url.description_html: A URL object represents a web address, like https://example.com/, and parts of the address, such as the domain, path, and query string (as URLSearchParams).
url.name: URL

url-canparse.description: The URL.canParse() static method checks whether a URL can be parsed into a valid URL object. It's an alternative to calling new URL() in a try  catch statement.
url-canparse.description_html: The URL.canParse() static method checks whether a URL can be parsed into a valid URL object. It's an alternative to calling new URL() in a try catch statement.
url-canparse.name: URL.canParse()

urlpattern.description: The URLPattern API creates patterns that can be matched against URLs or URL components.
urlpattern.description_html: The URLPattern API creates patterns that can be matched against URLs or URL components.
urlpattern.name: URLPattern

user-action-pseudos.description: The :active, :focus, and :hover CSS pseudo-classes match elements based on how users are interacting with them.
user-action-pseudos.description_html: The :active, :focus, and :hover CSS pseudo-classes match elements based on how users are interacting with them.
user-action-pseudos.name: User action pseudo-classes

user-activation.description: The navigator.userActivation API reveals whether the user has interacted with the page through an "activation" gesture such as a click, tap, or key press. User activation gated APIs (such as the fullscreen API) fail without user interaction, and this API allows you to predict such a failure.
user-activation.description_html: The navigator.userActivation API reveals whether the user has interacted with the page through an "activation" gesture such as a click, tap, or key press. User activation gated APIs (such as the fullscreen API) fail without user interaction, and this API allows you to predict such a failure.
user-activation.name: User activation

user-agent-sniffing.description: The navigator.userAgent property is the user agent string for the current browser. Selectively showing content based on the user agent string is unreliable. Consider using feature detection instead.
user-agent-sniffing.description_html: The navigator.userAgent property is the user agent string for the current browser. Selectively showing content based on the user agent string is unreliable. Consider using feature detection instead.
user-agent-sniffing.name: User agent sniffing

user-pseudos.description: The :user-valid and :user-invalid pseudo-classes match form controls that have been marked as valid or invalid based on their validation constraints.
user-pseudos.description_html: The :user-valid and :user-invalid pseudo-classes match form controls that have been marked as valid or invalid based on their validation constraints.
user-pseudos.name: :user-valid and :user-invalid

user-select.description: The user-select CSS property controls which elements can be selected by the user.
user-select.description_html: The user-select CSS property controls which elements can be selected by the user.
user-select.name: user-select

var.description: The <var> element represents the name of a variable in a mathematical expression or a programming context.
var.description_html: The <var> element represents the name of a variable in a mathematical expression or a programming context.
var.name: <var>

vertical-align.description: The vertical-align CSS property sets the vertical alignment of inline, inline-block, and table cell elements. It has no effect on block-level elements.
vertical-align.description_html: The vertical-align CSS property sets the vertical alignment of inline, inline-block, and table cell elements. It has no effect on block-level elements.
vertical-align.name: vertical-align

vertical-form-controls.description: The writing-mode CSS property orients form elements (such as radio buttons, progress bars, or select menus) vertically when the writing mode is vertical-lr or vertical-rl. The direction CSS property sets whether inputs flow from top to bottom or bottom to top.
vertical-form-controls.description_html: The writing-mode CSS property orients form elements (such as radio buttons, progress bars, or select menus) vertically when the writing mode is vertical-lr or vertical-rl. The direction CSS property sets whether inputs flow from top to bottom or bottom to top.
vertical-form-controls.name: Vertical form controls

vibration.description: The navigator.vibrate() method makes a tactile alert, if the device is equipped with a haptic motor.
vibration.description_html: The navigator.vibrate() method makes a tactile alert, if the device is equipped with a haptic motor.
vibration.name: Vibration

video.description: The <video> element plays videos or movies, optionally with controls provided by the browser.
video.description_html: The <video> element plays videos or movies, optionally with controls provided by the browser.
video.name: <video>

video-dynamic-range.description: The video-dynamic-range CSS media query sets styles based on whether a device can display video with at least standard range colors or at least high range colors. Non-visual devices will match neither.
video-dynamic-range.description_html: The video-dynamic-range CSS media query sets styles based on whether a device can display video with at least standard range colors or at least high range colors. Non-visual devices will match neither.
video-dynamic-range.name: video-dynamic-range media query

view-transition-class.description: The view-transition-class CSS property sets a name that can be used to apply styles to multiple named view transition pseudo-elements.
view-transition-class.description_html: The view-transition-class CSS property sets a name that can be used to apply styles to multiple named view transition pseudo-elements.
view-transition-class.name: view-transition-class

view-transitions.description: View transitions allow you to create animated visual transitions between different states of a document.
view-transitions.description_html: View transitions allow you to create animated visual transitions between different states of a document.
view-transitions.name: View transitions

viewport-segments.description: The viewport segment CSS environment variables and media features, and the viewport.segments API, allow you to adapt your layout to devices where the display is split, such as on foldable devices.
viewport-segments.description_html: The viewport segment CSS environment variables and media features, and the viewport.segments API, allow you to adapt your layout to devices where the display is split, such as on foldable devices.
viewport-segments.name: Viewport segments

viewport-unit-variants.description: The sv*, lv*, and dv* CSS viewport units are relative to the smallest, largest, and current (dynamic) viewport size. They are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.
viewport-unit-variants.description_html: The sv*, lv*, and dv* CSS viewport units are relative to the smallest, largest, and current (dynamic) viewport size. They are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.
viewport-unit-variants.name: Small, large, and dynamic viewport units

viewport-units.description: The vw, vh, vmin, and vmax CSS viewport units are relative to the size of the viewport, and are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.
viewport-units.description_html: The vw, vh, vmin, and vmax CSS viewport units are relative to the size of the viewport, and are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.
viewport-units.name: Viewport units

virtual-keyboard.description: The navigator.virtualKeyboard API inspects and controls on-screen virtual keyboards. You can use it to programmatically hide or show a virtual keyboard or respond to the keyboard disappearing or appearing.
virtual-keyboard.description_html: The navigator.virtualKeyboard API inspects and controls on-screen virtual keyboards. You can use it to programmatically hide or show a virtual keyboard or respond to the keyboard disappearing or appearing.
virtual-keyboard.name: Virtual keyboard

virtual-pressure-sources.description: The CreateVirtualPressureSource WebDriver command creates artificial sources of compute pressure for testing without the need real device sources of compute pressure.
virtual-pressure-sources.description_html: The CreateVirtualPressureSource WebDriver command creates artificial sources of compute pressure for testing without the need real device sources of compute pressure.
virtual-pressure-sources.name: Virtual pressure sources

virtual-sensors.description: The CreateVirtualSensor WebDriver command creates a virtual sensor for testing applications that use sensor APIs, without the need for real device sensors.
virtual-sensors.description_html: The CreateVirtualSensor WebDriver command creates a virtual sensor for testing applications that use sensor APIs, without the need for real device sensors.
virtual-sensors.name: Virtual sensors

visibility.description: The visibility CSS property sets whether an element is shown. Invisible elements still affect the document layout.
visibility.description_html: The visibility CSS property sets whether an element is shown. Invisible elements still affect the document layout.
visibility.name: visibility

visual-viewport.description: The visualViewport API provides a way to query and modify the user-visible viewport of a web page.
visual-viewport.description_html: The visualViewport API provides a way to query and modify the user-visible viewport of a web page.
visual-viewport.name: Visual viewport API

wasm.description: The WebAssembly.instantiate() and WebAssembly.instantiateStreaming() global static methods load WebAssembly code (also known as Wasm), a portable binary instruction format.
wasm.description_html: The WebAssembly.instantiate() and WebAssembly.instantiateStreaming() global static methods load WebAssembly code (also known as Wasm), a portable binary instruction format.
wasm.name: WebAssembly

wasm-bigint.description: Integer values pass bidirectionally between JavaScript and WebAssembly, converted to i64 values in WebAssembly or BigInt values in JavaScript.
wasm-bigint.description_html: Integer values pass bidirectionally between JavaScript and WebAssembly, converted to i64 values in WebAssembly or BigInt values in JavaScript.
wasm-bigint.name: BigInt to i64 conversion (WebAssembly)

wasm-bulk-memory.description: Bulk memory operations, such as copy and init, mirror the efficiency of native memcpy and memmove operations.
wasm-bulk-memory.description_html: Bulk memory operations, such as copy and init, mirror the efficiency of native memcpy and memmove operations.
wasm-bulk-memory.name: Bulk memory operations (WebAssembly)

wasm-exception-handling.description: Exceptions break the normal control flow of execution to represent exceptional behavior, such as an error. You can respond to the exception in JavaScript code.
wasm-exception-handling.description_html: Exceptions break the normal control flow of execution to represent exceptional behavior, such as an error. You can respond to the exception in JavaScript code.
wasm-exception-handling.name: Exception handling (WebAssembly)

wasm-exnref-exceptions.description: When caught, an exception is reified into an exception reference, a value of the new type exnref.
wasm-exnref-exceptions.description_html: When caught, an exception is reified into an exception reference, a value of the new type exnref.
wasm-exnref-exceptions.name: Exception references with exnref (WebAssembly)

wasm-extended-constant-expressions.description: The i32.add, i32.sub, i32.mul, i64.add, i64.sub, and i64.mul operations extend constant expressions to include arithmetic.
wasm-extended-constant-expressions.description_html: The i32.add, i32.sub, i32.mul, i64.add, i64.sub, and i64.mul operations extend constant expressions to include arithmetic.
wasm-extended-constant-expressions.name: Extended constant expressions (WebAssembly)

wasm-garbage-collection.description: Garbage collection tracks references for better memory management with garbage-collected languages running in WebAssmbly.
wasm-garbage-collection.description_html: Garbage collection tracks references for better memory management with garbage-collected languages running in WebAssmbly.
wasm-garbage-collection.name: Garbage collection (WebAssembly)

wasm-multi-memory.description: A single module in WebAssembly can have multiple memories.
wasm-multi-memory.description_html: A single module in WebAssembly can have multiple memories.
wasm-multi-memory.name: Multi-memory (WebAssembly)

wasm-multi-value.description: Instructions and blocks can produce multiple result values.
wasm-multi-value.description_html: Instructions and blocks can produce multiple result values.
wasm-multi-value.name: Multi-value (WebAssembly)

wasm-mutable-globals.description: Mutable global variables are importable and exportable.
wasm-mutable-globals.description_html: Mutable global variables are importable and exportable.
wasm-mutable-globals.name: Import and export of mutable globals (WebAssembly)

wasm-non-trapping-float-to-int.description: Saturating floating-point to integer conversion operators return the maximum or minimum integer value on overflow instead of trapping.
wasm-non-trapping-float-to-int.description_html: Saturating floating-point to integer conversion operators return the maximum or minimum integer value on overflow instead of trapping.
wasm-non-trapping-float-to-int.name: Non-trapping float-to-int conversion (WebAssembly)

wasm-reference-types.description: The externref type can be both a value type and a table element type, while funcref can be a value type.
wasm-reference-types.description_html: The externref type can be both a value type and a table element type, while funcref can be a value type.
wasm-reference-types.name: Reference types (WebAssembly)

wasm-sign-extension-operators.description: Sign-extension operator instructions extend the width of 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit values to 32-bit and 64-bit values.
wasm-sign-extension-operators.description_html: Sign-extension operator instructions extend the width of 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit values to 32-bit and 64-bit values.
wasm-sign-extension-operators.name: Sign extension operators (WebAssembly)

wasm-simd.description: 128-bit SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) performs one instruction on multiple units of data, when running on hardware that supports such instructions. Also known as vector instructions.
wasm-simd.description_html: 128-bit SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) performs one instruction on multiple units of data, when running on hardware that supports such instructions. Also known as vector instructions.
wasm-simd.name: Fixed-width SIMD (WebAssembly)

wasm-simd-relaxed.description: Relaxed SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) introduces local non-determinism, where the results of the instructions may vary based on hardware support.
wasm-simd-relaxed.description_html: Relaxed SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) introduces local non-determinism, where the results of the instructions may vary based on hardware support.
wasm-simd-relaxed.name: Relaxed-width SIMD (WebAssembly)

wasm-string-builtins.description: The WebAssembly builtin string functions mirror a subset of the JavaScript String API and adapt it to be efficiently callable without JavaScript glue code.
wasm-string-builtins.description_html: The WebAssembly builtin string functions mirror a subset of the JavaScript String API and adapt it to be efficiently callable without JavaScript glue code.
wasm-string-builtins.name: String builtins (WebAssembly)

wasm-tail-call-optimization.description: Tail call optimization discards a caller frame and replaces the call with a jump instruction.
wasm-tail-call-optimization.description_html: Tail call optimization discards a caller frame and replaces the call with a jump instruction.
wasm-tail-call-optimization.name: Tail call optimization (WebAssembly)

wasm-threads.description: Threads in WebAssembly run code in parallel, while atomic memory instructions can guarantee that no two threads can read or write to shared memory at the same time.
wasm-threads.description_html: Threads in WebAssembly run code in parallel, while atomic memory instructions can guarantee that no two threads can read or write to shared memory at the same time.
wasm-threads.name: Threads and atomics (WebAssembly)

wasm-typed-fun-refs.description: A typed function reference can be called directly.
wasm-typed-fun-refs.description_html: A typed function reference can be called directly.
wasm-typed-fun-refs.name: Typed function references (WebAssembly)

wbr.description: The <wbr> HTML element represents a word break opportunity, to explicitly mark a place within a word where a line might be broken.
wbr.description_html: The <wbr> HTML element represents a word break opportunity, to explicitly mark a place within a word where a line might be broken.
wbr.name: <wbr>

weak-references.description: The WeakRef and FinalizationRegistry objects hold references to garbage-collectable objects without creating strong references that prevent their garbage collection.
weak-references.description_html: The WeakRef and FinalizationRegistry objects hold references to garbage-collectable objects without creating strong references that prevent their garbage collection.
weak-references.name: Weak references

weakmap.description: A WeakMap object holds key-value pairs that do not create strong references to its keys, such that value data can be associated with a key without preventing garbage collection of the key.
weakmap.description_html: A WeakMap object holds key-value pairs that do not create strong references to its keys, such that value data can be associated with a key without preventing garbage collection of the key.
weakmap.name: WeakMap

weakset.description: A WeakSet object stores unique values of any type without creating strong references to the values, such that membership in the set does not prevent garbage collection of the value.
weakset.description_html: A WeakSet object stores unique values of any type without creating strong references to the values, such that membership in the set does not prevent garbage collection of the value.
weakset.name: WeakSet

web-animations.description: The web animation API programmatically creates, inspects, and controls element animations, to change and synchronize appearance over time.
web-animations.description_html: The web animation API programmatically creates, inspects, and controls element animations, to change and synchronize appearance over time.
web-animations.name: Web animations

web-audio.description: The Web Audio API creates graphs of audio nodes that handle sound inputs, synthesize sounds, apply effects, create visualizations, and output to audio devices.
web-audio.description_html: The Web Audio API creates graphs of audio nodes that handle sound inputs, synthesize sounds, apply effects, create visualizations, and output to audio devices.
web-audio.name: Web Audio

web-bluetooth.description: The Web Bluetooth API enables selecting and communicating with nearby Bluetooth devices.
web-bluetooth.description_html: The Web Bluetooth API enables selecting and communicating with nearby Bluetooth devices.
web-bluetooth.name: Web Bluetooth

web-cryptography.description: The Web Cryptography API performs low-level cryptographic operations, such as encryption, decryption, and signature verification. Also known as the Web Crypto API.
web-cryptography.description_html: The Web Cryptography API performs low-level cryptographic operations, such as encryption, decryption, and signature verification. Also known as the Web Crypto API.
web-cryptography.name: Web Cryptography

web-locks.description: The navigator.locks API coordinates work with shared resources through mutually exclusive ownership of a resource's name. Also known as web locks.
web-locks.description_html: The navigator.locks API coordinates work with shared resources through mutually exclusive ownership of a resource's name. Also known as web locks.
web-locks.name: Locks

web-midi.description: The Web MIDI API enables selecting MIDI input and output devices and sending and receiving MIDI messages.
web-midi.description_html: The Web MIDI API enables selecting MIDI input and output devices and sending and receiving MIDI messages.
web-midi.name: Web MIDI

web-nfc.description: The NDEFReader API reads and writes messages to near-field communication (NFC) tags.
web-nfc.description_html: The NDEFReader API reads and writes messages to near-field communication (NFC) tags.
web-nfc.name: Web NFC

web-otp.description: The OTPCredential API represents a one-time-password (OTP).
web-otp.name: WebOTP

webauthn.description: The web authentication API allows you to create public key-based credentials and use them for authentication, such as when signing in. Also known as WebAuthn.
webauthn.description_html: The web authentication API allows you to create public key-based credentials and use them for authentication, such as when signing in. Also known as WebAuthn.
webauthn.name: Web authentication

webauthn-public-key-easy.description: The getAuthenticatorData(), getPublicKey(), and getPublicKeyAlgorithm() methods of AuthenticatorAttestationResponse access credential data inside attestationObject without the need to parse it.
webauthn-public-key-easy.description_html: The getAuthenticatorData(), getPublicKey(), and getPublicKeyAlgorithm() methods of AuthenticatorAttestationResponse access credential data inside attestationObject without the need to parse it.
webauthn-public-key-easy.name: Web authentication easy public key access

webauthn-signals.description: The signalUnknownCredential(), signalAllAcceptedCredentials(), and signalCurrentUserDetails() methods of PublicKeyCredential inform authenticators of the state of public key credentials, so that incorrect or revoked credentials may be updated, removed, or hidden.
webauthn-signals.description_html: The signalUnknownCredential(), signalAllAcceptedCredentials(), and signalCurrentUserDetails() methods of PublicKeyCredential inform authenticators of the state of public key credentials, so that incorrect or revoked credentials may be updated, removed, or hidden.
webauthn-signals.name: Web authentication signal methods

webcodecs.description: The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to individual video frames and chunks of audio samples, for full control over the way media is processed.
webcodecs.description_html: The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to individual video frames and chunks of audio samples, for full control over the way media is processed.
webcodecs.name: WebCodecs

webdriver.description: The WebDriver protocol allows out-of-process programs to inspect and control browsers to, for example, run tests of web applications. Also known as WebDriver classic.
webdriver.description_html: The WebDriver protocol allows out-of-process programs to inspect and control browsers to, for example, run tests of web applications. Also known as WebDriver classic.
webdriver.name: WebDriver

webdriver-bidi.description: WebDriver BiDi is a bidirectional protocol that allows a WebDriver client and a browser to communicate with each other.
webdriver-bidi.description_html: WebDriver BiDi is a bidirectional protocol that allows a WebDriver client and a browser to communicate with each other.
webdriver-bidi.name: WebDriver BiDi

webgl.description: The WebGLRenderingContext API is the "webgl" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It represents a space for drawing two- and three-dimensional graphics and animations.
webgl.description_html: The WebGLRenderingContext API is the "webgl" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It represents a space for drawing two- and three-dimensional graphics and animations.
webgl.name: WebGL

webgl-color-buffer-float.description: The WEBGL_color_buffer_float extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds the 32-bit floating-point type RGBA32F as a color-renderable format.
webgl-color-buffer-float.description_html: The WEBGL_color_buffer_float extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds the 32-bit floating-point type RGBA32F as a color-renderable format.
webgl-color-buffer-float.name: WEBGL_color_buffer_float WebGL extension

webgl-color-management.description: The drawingBufferColorSpace and unpackColorSpace properties of WebGLRenderingContext sets the color representation for the buffer and imported textures, such as "srgb" or "display-p3".
webgl-color-management.description_html: The drawingBufferColorSpace and unpackColorSpace properties of WebGLRenderingContext sets the color representation for the buffer and imported textures, such as "srgb" or "display-p3".
webgl-color-management.name: Color management for WebGL

webgl-compressed-texture-astc.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_astc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the Adaptive Scalable Texture Compression format to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-astc.description_html: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_astc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the Adaptive Scalable Texture Compression format to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-astc.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_astc WebGL extension

webgl-compressed-texture-etc.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds many ETC2 and EAC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-etc.description_html: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds many ETC2 and EAC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-etc.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc WebGL extension

webgl-compressed-texture-etc1.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc1 extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the ETC1 compressed texture format to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-etc1.description_html: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc1 extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the ETC1 compressed texture format to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-etc1.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc1 WebGL extension

webgl-compressed-texture-pvrtc.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_pvrtc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds PVRTC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-pvrtc.description_html: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_pvrtc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds PVRTC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-pvrtc.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_pvrtc WebGL extension

webgl-compressed-texture-s3tc.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds S3TC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-s3tc.description_html: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds S3TC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-s3tc.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc WebGL extension

webgl-compressed-texture-s3tc-srgb.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc_srgb extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds S3TC compressed texture formats for the sRGB colorspace to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-s3tc-srgb.description_html: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc_srgb extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds S3TC compressed texture formats for the sRGB colorspace to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().
webgl-compressed-texture-s3tc-srgb.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc_srgb WebGL extension

webgl-debug-renderer-info.description: The WEBGL_debug_renderer_info extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts exposes information about the graphics driver for debugging purposes.
webgl-debug-renderer-info.description_html: The WEBGL_debug_renderer_info extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts exposes information about the graphics driver for debugging purposes.
webgl-debug-renderer-info.name: WEBGL_debug_renderer_info WebGL extension

webgl-debug-shaders.description: The WEBGL_debug_shaders extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the getTranslatedShaderSource() method to debug shaders from privileged contexts.
webgl-debug-shaders.description_html: The WEBGL_debug_shaders extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the getTranslatedShaderSource() method to debug shaders from privileged contexts.
webgl-debug-shaders.name: WEBGL_debug_shaders WebGL extension

webgl-depth-texture.description: The WEBGL_depth_texture extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts defines 2D depth and depth-stencil textures.
webgl-depth-texture.description_html: The WEBGL_depth_texture extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts defines 2D depth and depth-stencil textures.
webgl-depth-texture.name: WEBGL_depth_texture WebGL extension

webgl-desynchronized.description: The optional desynchronized parameter of a canvas's getContext() method permits the browser to draw a WebGL canvas independently of the event loop. This can reduce drawing latency.
webgl-desynchronized.description_html: The optional desynchronized parameter of a canvas's getContext() method permits the browser to draw a WebGL canvas independently of the event loop. This can reduce drawing latency.
webgl-desynchronized.name: Desynchronized WebGL canvas

webgl-draw-buffers.description: The WEBGL_draw_buffers extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts enables a fragment shader to write to several textures, which is useful for deferred shading, for example.
webgl-draw-buffers.description_html: The WEBGL_draw_buffers extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts enables a fragment shader to write to several textures, which is useful for deferred shading, for example.
webgl-draw-buffers.name: WEBGL_draw_buffers WebGL extension

webgl-lose-context.description: The WEBGL_lose_context extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts simulates losing and restoring a WebGLRenderingContext or WebGL2RenderingContext.
webgl-lose-context.description_html: The WEBGL_lose_context extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts simulates losing and restoring a WebGLRenderingContext or WebGL2RenderingContext.
webgl-lose-context.name: WEBGL_lose_context WebGL extension

webgl-multi-draw.description: The WEBGL_multi_draw extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts renders more than one primitive with a single function call.
webgl-multi-draw.description_html: The WEBGL_multi_draw extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts renders more than one primitive with a single function call.
webgl-multi-draw.name: WEBGL_multi_draw WebGL extension

webgl-oes-draw-buffers-indexed.description: The OES_draw_buffers_indexed extension for WebGL 2.0 contexts allows you to control blending on a per-color basis when writing to multiple color buffers simultaneously.
webgl-oes-draw-buffers-indexed.description_html: The OES_draw_buffers_indexed extension for WebGL 2.0 contexts allows you to control blending on a per-color basis when writing to multiple color buffers simultaneously.
webgl-oes-draw-buffers-indexed.name: OES_draw_buffers_indexed WebGL extension

webgl-sab.description: SharedArrayBuffer objects can be used in WebGL APIs that previously only worked with ArrayBuffer objects.
webgl-sab.description_html: SharedArrayBuffer objects can be used in WebGL APIs that previously only worked with ArrayBuffer objects.
webgl-sab.name: SharedArrayBuffer in WebGL

webgl2.description: The WebGL2RenderingContext API is the "webgl2" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It represents a space for drawing two- and three-dimensional graphics and animations. It corresponds to OpenGL ES 3.0.
webgl2.description_html: The WebGL2RenderingContext API is the "webgl2" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It represents a space for drawing two- and three-dimensional graphics and animations. It corresponds to OpenGL ES 3.0.
webgl2.name: WebGL2

webgl2-color-management.description: The drawingBufferColorSpace and unpackColorSpace properties of WebGL2RenderingContext sets the color representation for the buffer and imported textures, such as "srgb" or "display-p3".
webgl2-color-management.description_html: The drawingBufferColorSpace and unpackColorSpace properties of WebGL2RenderingContext sets the color representation for the buffer and imported textures, such as "srgb" or "display-p3".
webgl2-color-management.name: Color management for WebGL2

webgl2-desynchronized.description: The optional desynchronized parameter of a canvas's getContext() method permits the browser to draw a WebGL2 canvas independently of the event loop. This can reduce drawing latency.
webgl2-desynchronized.description_html: The optional desynchronized parameter of a canvas's getContext() method permits the browser to draw a WebGL2 canvas independently of the event loop. This can reduce drawing latency.
webgl2-desynchronized.name: Desynchronized WebGL2 canvas

webgpu.description: The navigator.gpu API performs operations such as rendering and computation on dedicated graphics hardware (also known as a Graphics Processing Unit).
webgpu.description_html: The navigator.gpu API performs operations such as rendering and computation on dedicated graphics hardware (also known as a Graphics Processing Unit).
webgpu.name: WebGPU

webhid.description: The WebHID API provides access to Human Interface Devices (HID) that are connected to the user's device.
webhid.description_html: The WebHID API provides access to Human Interface Devices (HID) that are connected to the user's device.
webhid.name: WebHID

webnn.description: The WebNN API constructs and executes computational graphs of neural networks by making use of the various machine learning capabilities and hardware accelerators available on the device. Also known as Web Neural Network API.
webnn.description_html: The WebNN API constructs and executes computational graphs of neural networks by making use of the various machine learning capabilities and hardware accelerators available on the device. Also known as Web Neural Network API.
webnn.name: WebNN

webp.description: The WebP image format is a raster graphics file format that supports animation, alpha transparency, and lossy as well as lossless compression.
webp.description_html: The WebP image format is a raster graphics file format that supports animation, alpha transparency, and lossy as well as lossless compression.
webp.name: WebP

webrtc.description: The WebRTC API establishes real-time communication channels directly between browsers. It is commonly used in video conferencing applications.
webrtc.description_html: The WebRTC API establishes real-time communication channels directly between browsers. It is commonly used in video conferencing applications.
webrtc.name: WebRTC

webrtc-encoded-transform.description: The WebRTC encoded transform API allows you to modify audio and video streams in WebRTC connections. For example, it can be used for visual effects or custom codecs.
webrtc-encoded-transform.description_html: The WebRTC encoded transform API allows you to modify audio and video streams in WebRTC connections. For example, it can be used for visual effects or custom codecs.
webrtc-encoded-transform.name: WebRTC encoded transform

webrtc-sctp.description: The sctp object on RTCPeerConnection represents the negotiated SCTP transport. SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) is the protocol that RTCDataChannel uses.
webrtc-sctp.description_html: The sctp object on RTCPeerConnection represents the negotiated SCTP transport. SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) is the protocol that RTCDataChannel uses.
webrtc-sctp.name: WebRTC SCTP information

webrtc-stats.description: The RTCPeerConnection.getStats(), RTCRtpSender.getStats(), and RTCRtpReceiver.getStats() methods return detailed information about the status, performance, network, and media for a given WebRTC connection.
webrtc-stats.description_html: The RTCPeerConnection.getStats(), RTCRtpSender.getStats(), and RTCRtpReceiver.getStats() methods return detailed information about the status, performance, network, and media for a given WebRTC connection.
webrtc-stats.name: WebRTC statistics

websockets.description: The WebSocket API opens a two-way communication channel between the user's browser and a server.
websockets.description_html: The WebSocket API opens a two-way communication channel between the user's browser and a server.
websockets.name: WebSockets

webtransport.description: The WebTransport API transmits data between a client and a server, by using the HTTP/3 protocol.
webtransport.description_html: The WebTransport API transmits data between a client and a server, by using the HTTP/3 protocol.
webtransport.name: WebTransport

webusb.description: The WebUSB API exposes USB compatible devices to web pages.
webusb.description_html: The WebUSB API exposes USB compatible devices to web pages.
webusb.name: WebUSB

webvr.description: The navigator.getVRDisplays() API represents virtual reality (VR) devices, including sensors and head-mounted displays.
webvr.description_html: The navigator.getVRDisplays() API represents virtual reality (VR) devices, including sensors and head-mounted displays.
webvr.name: WebVR

webvtt.description: WebVTT is a captions and subtitles format. WebVTT files are loaded using the <track> element, and the VTTCue API can be used to create or update cues dynamically.
webvtt.description_html: WebVTT is a captions and subtitles format. WebVTT files are loaded using the <track> element, and the VTTCue API can be used to create or update cues dynamically.
webvtt.name: WebVTT

webvtt-cue-alignment.description: The WebVTT cue alignment settings control which part of the cue is aligned with the given line and position. Cue alignment is set using line and position settings in WebVTT files or the lineAlign and positionAlign properties of VTTCue using JavaScript.
webvtt-cue-alignment.description_html: The WebVTT cue alignment settings control which part of the cue is aligned with the given line and position. Cue alignment is set using line and position settings in WebVTT files or the lineAlign and positionAlign properties of VTTCue using JavaScript.
webvtt-cue-alignment.name: WebVTT cue alignment

webvtt-cue-settings.description: The VTTCue API updates various aspects of cues dynamically, such as alignment, size and position.
webvtt-cue-settings.description_html: The VTTCue API updates various aspects of cues dynamically, such as alignment, size and position.
webvtt-cue-settings.name: WebVTT cue settings

webvtt-regions.description: WebVTT regions set the areas of the video where captions or subtitles should be rendered, such as placing roll-up captions used for live captions.
webvtt-regions.description_html: WebVTT regions set the areas of the video where captions or subtitles should be rendered, such as placing roll-up captions used for live captions.
webvtt-regions.name: WebVTT regions

webxr-anchors.description: An XRAnchor object keeps track of a pose that is fixed relative to the real world. Anchors build an illusion that the placed objects are really present in the user's environment.
webxr-anchors.description_html: An XRAnchor object keeps track of a pose that is fixed relative to the real world. Anchors build an illusion that the placed objects are really present in the user's environment.
webxr-anchors.name: Anchors (WebXR)

webxr-ar.description: The "immersive-ar" value for navigator.xr.requestSession() starts an augmented reality WebXR session that renders content aligned with the visible environment.
webxr-ar.description_html: The "immersive-ar" value for navigator.xr.requestSession() starts an augmented reality WebXR session that renders content aligned with the visible environment.
webxr-ar.name: Augmented reality

webxr-camera.description: The XRView.camera property provides direct access to pose-synchronized camera images within a WebXR session.
webxr-camera.description_html: The XRView.camera property provides direct access to pose-synchronized camera images within a WebXR session.
webxr-camera.name: Raw camera access for WebXR

webxr-depth-sensing.description: An XRDepthInformation object represents a measurement of the distance from the user's device to the real-world geometry in the user's environment.
webxr-depth-sensing.description_html: An XRDepthInformation object represents a measurement of the distance from the user's device to the real-world geometry in the user's environment.
webxr-depth-sensing.name: Depth sensing

webxr-device.description: The navigator.xr API represents the browser's virtual reality or augmented reality system. You can use to request a WebXR session.
webxr-device.description_html: The navigator.xr API represents the browser's virtual reality or augmented reality system. You can use to request a WebXR session.
webxr-device.name: WebXR

webxr-dom-overlays.description: A DOM overlay shows 2D DOM content as an interactive, transparent layer on top of a WebXR application's WebGL content and camera image.
webxr-dom-overlays.description_html: A DOM overlay shows 2D DOM content as an interactive, transparent layer on top of a WebXR application's WebGL content and camera image.
webxr-dom-overlays.name: DOM overlays for WebXR

webxr-gamepads.description: The gamepad attribute of an XRInputSource represents an XR input device, such as a motion controller, that reports data from physical inputs (such as buttons, touch pads, and triggers).
webxr-gamepads.description_html: The gamepad attribute of an XRInputSource represents an XR input device, such as a motion controller, that reports data from physical inputs (such as buttons, touch pads, and triggers).
webxr-gamepads.name: Gamepad (WebXR)

webxr-hand-input.description: An XRHand object, from the hand attribute of an XRInputSource object, represents a WebXR session's fully-articulated hand tracking model.
webxr-hand-input.description_html: An XRHand object, from the hand attribute of an XRInputSource object, represents a WebXR session's fully-articulated hand tracking model.
webxr-hand-input.name: Hand input

webxr-hit-test.description: The getHitTestResults() method of an XRFrame object helps place objects in an augmented reality session by finding where cast rays intersect with real-world geometry.
webxr-hit-test.description_html: The getHitTestResults() method of an XRFrame object helps place objects in an augmented reality session by finding where cast rays intersect with real-world geometry.
webxr-hit-test.name: Hit test

webxr-layers.description: WebXR layer types, such as XRCylinderLayer, XRCylinderLayer, XREquirectLayer, XRProjectionLayer or XRQuadLayer, are managed by the system compositor, to reduce latency or resampling.
webxr-layers.description_html: WebXR layer types, such as XRCylinderLayer, XRCylinderLayer, XREquirectLayer, XRProjectionLayer or XRQuadLayer, are managed by the system compositor, to reduce latency or resampling.
webxr-layers.name: Layers (WebXR)

webxr-lighting-estimation.description: The XRLightProbe and XRLightEstimate objects represent real-world environmental lighting conditions during a WebXR session.
webxr-lighting-estimation.description_html: The XRLightProbe and XRLightEstimate objects represent real-world environmental lighting conditions during a WebXR session.
webxr-lighting-estimation.name: Lighting estimation

wheel-events.description: The wheel event fires when the user moves a mouse wheel or similar spatially rotating input device.
wheel-events.description_html: The wheel event fires when the user moves a mouse wheel or similar spatially rotating input device.
wheel-events.name: Wheel events

where.description: The :where() CSS functional pseudo-class takes a selector list as its argument, and matches any element that can be selected by one of the selectors in that list. It is functionally equivalent to the selectors in the list, but doesn't affect the CSS rule specificity.
where.description_html: The :where() CSS functional pseudo-class takes a selector list as its argument, and matches any element that can be selected by one of the selectors in that list. It is functionally equivalent to the selectors in the list, but doesn't affect the CSS rule specificity.
where.name: :where()

white-space.description: The white-space CSS property sets how white space is collapsed and how lines wrap. It is a shorthand for white-space-collapse and text-wrap-mode.
white-space.description_html: The white-space CSS property sets how white space is collapsed and how lines wrap. It is a shorthand for white-space-collapse and text-wrap-mode.
white-space.name: white-space

white-space-collapse.description: The white-space-collapse CSS property sets whether new line characters are shown as line breaks, and whether multiple consecutive spaces are all displayed or combined.
white-space-collapse.description_html: The white-space-collapse CSS property sets whether new line characters are shown as line breaks, and whether multiple consecutive spaces are all displayed or combined.
white-space-collapse.name: white-space-collapse

widows-orphans.description: The widows and orphans CSS properties set the minimum lines included in a text fragment created by page, column, or region breaks.
widows-orphans.description_html: The widows and orphans CSS properties set the minimum lines included in a text fragment created by page, column, or region breaks.
widows-orphans.name: Widows and orphans

width-height.description: The width and height CSS properties set the preferred physical size of an element.
width-height.description_html: The width and height CSS properties set the preferred physical size of an element.
width-height.name: Width and height

will-change.description: The will-change CSS property gives hints to the browser about expected changes to an element's scroll position, contents, or style. These hints allow browsers to optimize for upcoming style changes.
will-change.description_html: The will-change CSS property gives hints to the browser about expected changes to an element's scroll position, contents, or style. These hints allow browsers to optimize for upcoming style changes.
will-change.name: will-change

window.description: The window global object represents a browser tab or iframe and its relationship to the document and other tabs. It's also a generic global object, under which many other APIs are located.
window.description_html: The window global object represents a browser tab or iframe and its relationship to the document and other tabs. It's also a generic global object, under which many other APIs are located.
window.name: Window

window-controls-overlay.description: The display_override:\ ["window-controls-overlay"] web application manifest member shows content in the title bar area of a progressive web app that is installed on a desktop device.
window-controls-overlay.description_html: The display_override:\ ["window-controls-overlay"] web application manifest member shows content in the title bar area of a progressive web app that is installed on a desktop device.
window-controls-overlay.name: Window Controls Overlay

window-management.description: The window.getScreenDetails() method gets information about the screens on a device, which you can use to place new windows on a specific screen with window.open().
window-management.description_html: The window.getScreenDetails() method gets information about the screens on a device, which you can use to place new windows on a specific screen with window.open().
window-management.name: Window management

with.description: The with JavaScript statement adds a given object to the chain of scopes used to evaluate names.
with.description_html: The with JavaScript statement adds a given object to the chain of scopes used to evaluate names.
with.name: with

word-break.description: The word-break CSS property sets how lines break within words.
word-break.description_html: The word-break CSS property sets how lines break within words.
word-break.name: word-break

word-break-auto-phrase.description: The word-break: auto-phrase CSS declaration specifies that wrapping should occur at natural phrase boundaries, especially in CJK languages.
word-break-auto-phrase.description_html: The word-break: auto-phrase CSS declaration specifies that wrapping should occur at natural phrase boundaries, especially in CJK languages.
word-break-auto-phrase.name: word-break: auto-phrase

word-break-break-word.description: The word-break: break-word CSS declaration sets word breaks to occur according to their customary rules. Superseded by overflow-wrap: anywhere.
word-break-break-word.description_html: The word-break: break-word CSS declaration sets word breaks to occur according to their customary rules. Superseded by overflow-wrap: anywhere.
word-break-break-word.name: word-break: break-word

word-spacing.description: The word-spacing CSS property sets the amount of white space between words.
word-spacing.description_html: The word-spacing CSS property sets the amount of white space between words.
word-spacing.name: word-spacing

writing-mode.description: The writing-mode CSS property sets whether text is laid out horizontally or vertically, and left to right, or right to left.
writing-mode.description_html: The writing-mode CSS property sets whether text is laid out horizontally or vertically, and left to right, or right to left.
writing-mode.name: writing-mode

writing-mode-svg-values.description: The lr, lr-tb, rl, rl-tb, tb, and tb-rl keyword values for the writing-mode CSS property set the text direction for elements in SVG 1.1 documents.
writing-mode-svg-values.description_html: The lr, lr-tb, rl, rl-tb, tb, and tb-rl keyword values for the writing-mode CSS property set the text direction for elements in SVG 1.1 documents.
writing-mode-svg-values.name: writing-mode SVG 1.1 values

writingsuggestions.description: The writingsuggestions HTML attribute turns on or off a browser's writing suggestions. Writing suggestions vary by browser. For example, if turned on then a browser might show inline text completions accepted by pressing Tab.
writingsuggestions.description_html: The writingsuggestions HTML attribute turns on or off a browser's writing suggestions. Writing suggestions vary by browser. For example, if turned on then a browser might show inline text completions accepted by pressing Tab.
writingsuggestions.name: writingsuggestions

xhr.description: The XMLHttpRequest API makes HTTP requests. It's the predecessor to fetch(). Also known as XHR.
xhr.description_html: The XMLHttpRequest API makes HTTP requests. It's the predecessor to fetch(). Also known as XHR.
xhr.name: XMLHttpRequest

xml-serializer.description: The XMLSerializer API provides the serializeToString() method to construct an XML string representing a DOM tree.
xml-serializer.description_html: The XMLSerializer API provides the serializeToString() method to construct an XML string representing a DOM tree.
xml-serializer.name: XMLSerializer

xpath.description: The document.evaluate() method selects elements in an HTML or XML document based on an expression of XPath, a domain specific language for querying XML documents. Also known as XML Path Language.
xpath.description_html: The document.evaluate() method selects elements in an HTML or XML document based on an expression of XPath, a domain specific language for querying XML documents. Also known as XML Path Language.
xpath.name: XPath

xslt.description: The XSLTProcessor API transforms XML documents into new XML or HTML documents, using XSLT stylesheets. You can use XSLT to convert data between different XML schemas or to convert XML data into web pages or PDF documents. Also known as Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations.
xslt.description_html: The XSLTProcessor API transforms XML documents into new XML or HTML documents, using XSLT stylesheets. You can use XSLT to convert data between different XML schemas or to convert XML data into web pages or PDF documents. Also known as Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations.
xslt.name: XSLT

z-index.description: The z-index CSS property orders overlapping elements, with higher values appearing in front of or on top of lower values.
z-index.description_html: The z-index CSS property orders overlapping elements, with higher values appearing in front of or on top of lower values.
z-index.name: z-index

zoom.description: The zoom CSS property scales the size of an element. Unlike the transform property, a zoomed element affects page layout.
zoom.description_html: The zoom CSS property scales the size of an element. Unlike the transform property, a zoomed element affects page layout.
zoom.name: zoom

zstd.description: Zstandard or zstd is fast lossless compression algorithm. When used as a content encoding, it is often faster and offers better compression than brotli.
zstd.description_html: Zstandard or zstd is fast lossless compression algorithm. When used as a content encoding, it is often faster and offers better compression than brotli.
zstd.name: Zstandard compression
